CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2015
CommentsContent: I am on my fourth replacement and it still does not work.  This worked fine for a while, in fact I liked it so much I bought one for my sister.  After a while the top plate stopped heating.  Cuisinart replaced it and because of California consumer law, did not even charge shipping.  Great, except the replacement was DOA.  The next replacement still did not heat properly, pancakes gradually browned with a hard crust.  Now on my third griddler that did not work I called "customer service"  to see if I could talk to a technical person to find out what is wrong.  You cannot get past the customer service rep, who did offer to give me a full credit to apply to the purchase of a different model That sounded great until they now insisted that I pay for return shipping.  Since my cost of shipping would be about half the cost of the product (and possibly against California Consumer protection, I just told them to send me yet another GR-4n.  It is here, does not work well, and they have yet to send me the return shipping authorization.  I think Cuisinart has decided that it is more economical to build junk than quality and then replace how ever many fail..  Another quality brand trashed.

CommentsTitle: To brown pancakes and waffles you have to turn up to 425degrees and wait a good 10 minutes or more to heat up
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2017
CommentsContent: This is our 3rd Cuisinart Griddler GR-4N 5-in-1. First two lasted until they would not hear. Ordered 3rd one and would not get hot enough to dopancakes and waffles. Ordered replacement but does not seem to be much different. To brown pancakes and waffles you have to turn up to 425degrees and wait a good 10 minutes or more to heat up. The first two seemed to be better made than these last ones. Am trying it out still and hope it will be ok.Also top lid is a little hard to control opposed to first two. We have enjoyed this machine going on 5 years from the first wereceived as a gift. Hope this helps with product

CommentsTitle: Initial impressions - exactly what I needed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2017
CommentsContent: After first usePROS- Easy unboxing, unwrapping, and setup. Packaging seemed adequate for safety without feeling excessive. Scissors or cutting pliers for a zip tie are recommended.  Didn't really need to read the manual.- Preheated to 350 F within minutes. Clear indicator light on the temperature knob showed it was ready.- Cooked 12 oz / 1" steak to medium in 5 minutes, then cooked a serving of asparagus in 3 minutes. Didn't need to reapply cooking spray, and the food came off the griddle with no effort.- Lid was easy to lift.- Steam / smoke was less than expected (helps that I patted down the food before cooking).- Not expecting any drama with clean-up (letting it cool first).CONS- As others have said, the top griddle can drip juice at the back when the lid is lifted up. I may have missed a drip pan back there. If there isn't one, a foil boat should resolve that moving forward.NEUTRAL- Meat had grill marks but not a heavy char. My mistake for not setting to Sear in the last minute. Will report back if the results aren't satisfactory.OVERALLWould recommend for cooking meals for 1-4 people (based on initial impressions). Will report back if the product fails before the extra 4-year warranty expires / I run into any quality control issues.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2019
CommentsContent: When I saw my 14 year old trying to make a grilled cheese sandwich on a waffle iron, I knew it was time to get a Panini Press! When we received this press we had to use it right away. We have to get use to how to make a Panini sandwich (so there’s some learning curve here) but I think this will be a game changer for my son who really just wants to heat up a cup of noodle for lunch. He will actually make a grilled cheese sandwhich! I need to figure out some more recipes for him. I like how the plates come off for easy cleaning, and lay flat option will be great! We haven’t grilled any meats yet, I’m sure I can get dinner done a lot faster!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Ok, I've only had it 4 days, but I have used it 3 times, and it is slick as can be. I used for a turkey burger. For Hot Italian turkey brats. And for a grilled ham & cheese. All 3 were excellent. I will cook the burger for slightly longer at a slightly lower temp going forward, but this was the first time. The brats I could for 11 mins at 325 - perfect. The grilled cheese took about 3 minutes due to heat from both sides. Truly wish I'd bought it sooner. And I didn't realize the plates are two-sided: Can be used for grill or griddle. And the clean-up very nicely.

CommentsTitle: Keep A Supply Of Q-Tips For Cleaning
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2018
CommentsContent: Really difficult to keep very clean. The grill plates clean very well. The grease catcher cleans well in the dish washer.Problem all the little nooks, crannies, indentations, corners and the like have a tendency to collect the fats and grease thrown off by the high temperature cooking. The plates too not completely seal the cooking area. A portion, but in amounts large enough to be a problem collect around the grill in the nooks, crannies,indentations, corners and the like.No real way to completely clean except by complete immersion which is strongly not recommended.Keep a supply of q-tips for cleaning. In almost a year have found no other way to keep accumulations in check.As for cooking works really well. More than well enough to put up with the grease accumulations.

CommentsTitle: So let me just tell you that those people who call this Griddler CRAP, just don't know how to cook
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2014
CommentsContent: Hi, ok so I looked at this Griddler again and again, I Googled it and I looked at YouTube video reviews and then I just decided to buy it. So let me just tell you that those people who call this Griddler CRAP, just don't know how to cook! They probably work for another company that competes with Cuisinart so they post all these negative reviews. This Griddler is awesome! It is sooooo easy to cook with and clean. I got it for my fiancée because he loves making grilled cheese, and Cuban sandwiches! I figured we could just use it as a panini press but let me tell you, after we did delicious grilled cheese and how fast and easy it was, we decided to make burgers on it. We grinded our own ground beef and put the Griddler on “Sear”. It seared the beef right away, all liquids were pouring into the container, it was draining excess fat perfectly and it took probably 5-7 minutes to make the burger well-done. It was juicy and delicious!Cleaning was a piece of cake! I don’t know why people complaint that it’s a crap or that it’s hard to clean. Well obviously you don’t scrub the plates with forks and metal scouring pads! If food got dried so badly on the plates, soak them in hot water for a few minutes and that’s it. Another complaint that I saw is about plastic clips that hold the plates. Okay, I honestly wonder where this people bought this Griddler. It either a Chinese knock off of it or something else, maybe different model.. The one I bought is the one with dripping tray that goes inside under the Griddler and I have metal clips.  Other people complaint that it splatters everywhere, okay, does your skillet splatter when you cook? It’s a hot, open surface, so when you put a piece of juicy something of course it’s going to splatter! Every single griddle does that! Or somebody said that it would turn off on its own or something like that, well it’s probably an electrical problem, it happens. I got an expensive table lamp and it did not work, I returned it and ordered another one, the same exact one. Things like that happen, it doesn’t mean it’s a bad product! Maybe it got damaged during shipping!  I’m just mad how people find one thing they don’t like and say it’s crap. It doesn’t have timer like some George Foreman Grills, but it doesn’t mean it’s a bad Griddler. It is not some super-duper fancy Griddler but it does perfect job in anything. It is a GOOD Griddler, It is super easy to cook with, super easy to clean. And don’t freak out if it splatters a little when you put a piece of steak on it and then give it one star and say "Oh my God, I hate this product!"Out of 4,076 reviews only 290 gave it one star. That’s pretty good. So just use your common sense and don’t rely on those reviews that say It’s “crap” or “doesn’t work”, and make sure you get the right model.

CommentsTitle: An excellent grill, much better than Foreman
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I really love this grill. It's so much easier to clean, and heats more evenly than my old Foreman grill. My last Foreman was a newer model, and the ceramic coating didn't last 3 months. I received a replacement, and the same thing happened. I decided to try the Cuisinart "Griddler", and I couldn't be happier. I've learned to adjust cooking times, compared to the suggestions in the book, because what I'm cooking is not always what they describe. That, however, is the only adjustment I've had to make. I highly recommend this item.

CommentsTitle: The grill part wasn't much better. Frozen hamburgers (which were no problem on my ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2014
CommentsContent: This grill/griddle never achieved hot enough temperatures to cook properly in a decent amount of time. A batch of eggs took 15 minutes (after the 6min. warm time for the thermostat) before the whites were done, and by then, the yolks were rock hard.  The grill part wasn't much better. Frozen hamburgers (which were no problem on my old George Forman grill)  spattered all over the place from the sides of the machine when the top was closed over the patties, and the fat filled up the grooves before it started to drain.On the plus side, the machine is very attractive, and Amazon's return policies for Prime members are top notch.Given the 1000's of positive reviews for the GR-4N 5-in-1, I'm disappointe with my experience. But in the end, this machine can't cook.

CommentsTitle: I use this little grill all the time!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this little grill!  It makes perfect hamburgers and so much more— so much easier than cooking burgers on a traditional grill and no flare ups from dripping fat or oil. I just put the burgers in the grill and set the kitchen timer for 8 minutes and walk away.I actually keep it on a little rolling cart in our garage to minimize cooking odors in the house.I’ve had it about three weeks, and so far I have used it for grilled vegetables (green beans, eggplant, butternut squash, Brussels sprouts), toasted cheese, burgers, and quesadillas.The grill plates really are non stick, though I sometimes use cooking spray.  Clean up is quite easy— just pop out the grill plates and put them in the dishwasher.  I also like the simple, easy to use dial controls.Preheating is quick— I usually give it about 4 minutes and it is ready to go.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2018
CommentsContent: If you live in an apartment, this thing is amazing. I am a breakfast man and I hate washing dishes so the Griddler is perfect! I am way more impressed with this than the Foreman grill. Eggs are a little tricky since they tend to run to the drain. The grease trap under the unit is perfectly placed! If you want to keep this under a counter, you'll be shocked at how clean it stays. I have been washing the plates by hand and are not hard to clean, even after making bacon, sausage or burgers. You may be able to wash them in the dishwasher but I do not want to lose the non-stick coating. I have a laser temp gun and the plates heat evenly. I've gone through several (Foreman's, etc) and this is the number 1 electric grill on the market hands down.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2018
CommentsContent: Bought this for a Christmas gift and it doesn’t heat properly. So now it’s too late to return!  What a waste of $100+ because of course I bought the extra items to go with it. Don’t waste your money!  Cuisinart is supposed to be a great product. Very disappointed 😡UPDATE: My son contacted Amazon and is getting to return the items since they were a Christmas gift.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2018
CommentsContent: I think you usually get what you pay for, but not in this case. This should be a $39 item, and I’d give it another star. But that’s it. It’s messy and drips grease despite the drip tray. It’s underpowered when doing more than one burger. Worst of all is the grease gets under the thin hot plates into where the heat coil is and good luck trying to get it out. As a result of all this, the thing smokes like crazy so have an outside exhaust or extra smoke detector batteries. I’d try more money and better design next time rather than once good name.  IMHO

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I live where I have not been able to grill for the last 13 years and I've missed it.  No more.  The Griddler is truly amazing.  First, I am not a cook, even at 73 years old.  Today I grilled and seared chicken breast.  Tonight I had delicious grilled chicken for dinner and my cats are now in nirvana.  Clean-up was just as Cuisinart says.  I had the plates cleaned in a matter of minutes.  (I don't mean dinner plates)I'm really excited about the prospects of cooking with the Cuisinart Griddler.  The sky's the limit.  This is one small appliance you won't see at a yard sale.  Thanks Cuisinart.  I recommend it completely.

CommentsTitle: Better than my oven and BBQ
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: This is such an amazing item I now have an indoor barbecue and I can’t begin to tell you the quality of this item it’s above excellent. When I cook the salmon with skin or without skin it comes out restaurant quality. My mouth waters just thinking about how incredible it tasted and how perfectly grilled it was. It made the skin on the salmon a delicacy and I could never do that in the oven only on my barbecue outside. Worth every penny.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2019
CommentsContent: Before the Cuisinart grill, I was using the LMGM, which was a pain in the A to clean, and distribute heat evenly. As for the Cuisinart? Not only does the pic say it all, but I can usually use a folded paper towel for clean up. I love the fact not only that the grill plattens are removable and reversible, but that they're dishwasher safe. The greas trap is also a joy. I've had this since May or June 2019 (an early birthday present to myself), and it's the BEST birtday present I  could have given myself. Moral? A grill doesn't need to be lean, or mean. Practical is much better. Oh, and don't let the cost throw you. It is WAY worth it!!!😎

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Got this to make pancakes, and for that purpose, it's pretty convenient. I can make 8 medium/small pancakes at once. They cook at mostly the same rate, without any burning or undercooking.Temperature control on this, however, is not great. You must preheat for a few minutes and then get it back up to heat a second time after putting the food on. This can be an issue for things like eggs (don't do it), breakfast meats (if you like crispy), or anything you want to cook more quickly.2 Month Update: I have made dozens if not over a hundred pancakes on this thing, and it is such a time saver. I have also grilled some pretty tasty lamb. I just use it on full heat every time and it works great. Never have to add oil or butter. I also only wash the pans with hot water, and only the tiniest bit of soap if there is a lot of grease.

CommentsTitle: Works great for my small apartment
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my second purchase of the Griddler (the first was in 2012). My son loved the first one so much I gave it to him for his first home alone. I found I really missed it more than I thought I would. I had it on my wish list and when I got a notification from Amazon of a decrease in the price I just couldn't wait. Works great for breakfast meals but also for grilling a steak for one since I now live in a small apartment without access to an outdoor grill!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2015
CommentsContent: There are a lot of kitchen appliances which you might get excited about, at first, and then completely forget about a couple of months later - I'm looking at you, breadmaker in the basement. This is not one of those appliances.I have used this miracle device multiple times a week, for over two years - and it still looks and works like new. A couple of reviews I've read mention that the coating starts to come off or that temperature is irregular. Again, after two years of use I have yet to see any of this myself. I washed the plates regularly in a dishwasher for at least six months, multiple times per week - no problem. Since then I have been hand-washing them -- no dishwasher. The plates show zero wear and tear. The food cooks in the exact amount of time, every time - without fail. I have never had this appliance break or not perform exactly like it's supposed to.The grill is very easy to clean and maintain - like washing a couple of dishes. The grease catcher works quite well and is also very easy to clean. Only downside is... if you're grilling a bunch of food at once, you do get some splatter around but nothing more than you might get from a pan on the stove.One trick I've learned is to keep a paper towel under the grill, which helps keep the surface under the grill clean. Just replace every week or two, no sweat.I am so fascinated by this device that I had to write a review. I primarily use this appliance to grill chicken and shrimp and I absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for an indoor grill. Spectacular product and worth every penny.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought it primarily to make grilled sandwiches (paninis). It does get super hot and melts the cheese inside the sandwiches,  but only *somewhat* toasts/crisps-up the outside of the bread... The bread NEVER gets browned. Not sure how it gets so hot yet doesn’t produce browning on the bread’s surface? We’ve tried different breads, with and without butter. No browning for some reason... We end up making toasted sandwiches in the old air-fryer more than this because of the lack of “toastiness” of the bread :(If you have kids (out clumsy folks) around, beware: the outside of the top **does** get super hot (we, the clumsy folks, learned the hard way)...A friend recommended this model, as she has it and loves it. She cooks pork chops and that sort of thing on it. So maybe it’s better for “grilling” than “panini-making”?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this damn thing almost constantly, my only gripe is when they designed the grill plates for moving the grease and fat away and out of the grill, they could have done a better job. The edge near the hinge tends to overflow into the restraining clips because the plates are either not deep/tall enough, or there needs to be a deeper groove for managing grease flow. Wouldn't have hurt to make the grooves slowly get deeper further back on the grill side of the plate. Otherwise, EVERYTHING else is fantasticTL;DR: Awesome, but a little more messy than it should be.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I've used the Griddler a number of times now to cook chicken and turkey cutlets. It's easy to use and the drip pan works fairly well. There is a certain amount of grease that splatters out of the sides (I was using it closed to cook the meat on both sides at once) so I put a large piece of aluminum foil underneath to catch the splatter. It cooked both the chicken and turkey cutlets quite quickly. They were done in about 10 mins or so. Cleaning the removable griddles was not difficult. I washed them by hand in  order to make sure they got completely clean. I haven't tried washing them with the dishwasher yet. Having the removable griddles was important to me and I'm glad I went with a machine that had that feature. Once I had the chicken cooked, I then put it on some good bread with some pesto and roasted peppers and lightly coated the outside of the bread with olive oil. I then put them back into the Griddler and used it as a panini maker. The sandwiches that came out were golden brown and really tasty! It's a quality machine and does a good job both as a griddle and as a panini press.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this thing! I use it a lot. The trays are on a slight slope so any grease drips down a small dip on the edge and into the grease tray. Not a major slope like a George Foreman grill, it's barely noticeable. Being mostly flat, I sometimes have to help grease along into the dip if it's thick grease, like for hamburger patties, but that's ok. It's handy especially in the winter when you don't want to use a large bbq outside, and it's nice to have all of the pancakes ready at the same time. I spray it down first with cooking spray, but that being said, I haven't had anything stick to it. The trays are very easy to clean, and they haven't scratched. You can do two griddle trays, two grill trays, or one of each. I probably wouldn't use it for bacon because the sides are not very high and the grease may overflow, but I haven't tried. For improvements, the dip to the grease tray could be a little bigger, and when I cooked waffles, one side was a lot more brown than the other, so I guess the waffle trays don't cook totally evenly. (They are sold separately). All in all though I am very happy with it and would recommend it to anybody.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Got this to replace my George Foreman that had the teflon flake off after years of use.  I love having the replaceable plates, and the functionality of being able to use this as multiple appliances is a great upgrade from the george.  This isn't just a "George Forman Grill" style device.  You can flip it open and use it as an indoor grill, or by flipping the plates you can use this as a indoor griddle when your stove is full (great for pancakes and eggs on Thanksgiving morning when the burners on your stove are all full.)Add the optional waffle plates and this will replace your waffle iron as well without taking up more space.  The plates take up less space than yet another machine.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I own a previous version of same product, which after years and years of use (and abuse) broke down. Even so, I decided to replace it with exactly the same model but got impressed with the fact that in this newer version certain things that wore out on my old griddler got improved. The new model has a much better mechanism to keep the plates in place, which also allows to use reversible plates with different surface patterns (grill and griddle) instead of the two sets the old design came with. Also, the resistive heating elements now are encapsulated, which I am expecting to last much longer than the previous ones. So, I am bery happy with my choice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased the Cuisinart Griddler along with its waffle plates with the primary purpose of using it as a waffle maker.  I  can unequivocally say that this is the best waffle maker I have every used, bar none.  And as a panini maker, it is also fantastic!  The non-stick plates are just that...non-stick with no added oils and such to them and they are easy to remove and replace.  The heating elements in this Griddler are fantastic with great heat control with the lid heating as well as the bottom of this Griddler, which is unusual for many of the other panini style makers.  You won't go wrong with this product.

CommentsTitle: The new griddler is poorlly constructed, I returned it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2014
CommentsContent:
Please note that I rarely return anything and was sad to do so here, I wanted to love the griddler.

Big problems:
*Uneven cooking
*too low of a temperature
*didn't maintain heat

Small problems:
*Griddle plate came scratched
*Plates very thin
*Knobs are that cheap, plastic, fake chrome
*Overall felt cheap compared to other Cuisinart products

Good:
*Very easy to clean
*Amazon rules at returns

The story:
I wanted to upgrade from my George Foreman and tried, multiple times, to love the Cuisinart Griddler. The concept is great, the engineering and quality is low.

We first tried to use it as a griddle, it started off fine, then pancakes started cooking slow, then REALLY slow. The thin plates really loose heat fast and the internal thermostat doesn't maintain the temp well.

With eggs we noticed lots of hot and cold spots, they cooked unevenly.

So, I figured no worries, we really bought it to replace the Foreman as an indoor grill. It came up short here as well.
It took MUCH longer to cook anything from frozen on the grill. Turkey burgers, chicken, it all took a really long time.

Bottom line:
Wanted this to be an upgrade to the George Foreman grill, ended up being flexible but bad at everything it was intended to do. Sad to see such a good design ruined by such poor construction and cheap materials.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2019
CommentsContent: These little grills are amazing. I had a lower quality one without removeable plates and it was a real pain to clean. Spend the extra money it's worth it for both cleaning and cooking This one cleans up very easily... remove the plates, stick 'em in the dishwasher or just wash by hand only takes a few minutes. It cooks well, gets more than hot enough. I use it to cook steaks when I cant or dont want to grill outside. Does them FAST. This has variable temperature so you can really control how you're cooking as you get used to it.  I use this all the time it never gets put away. I'd recommend this one for the price. One downside is that it does not appear to cook the top side quite the same as the bottom when cooking  on the highest setting. Just something you need to be aware of if you want "perfect". I've had it for a year it is holding up well.

CommentsTitle: Great appliance for those seeking to grill food indoors and year round
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2018
CommentsContent: If you're an apartment dweller and love the taste of grilled food then this is the appliance for you.• Choose any food you love to grill in warm months and you can now do so all year round.• The grill heats up quickly and food is cooked evenly.• A green indicator light on the selector knob to the far right lets you know the grill plates are ready.• There is minimal smoke emitted from this grill - far less than one would expect using an outdoor grill - rendering it highly useful for indoor cooking.• The grilling plates are easily removable and dishwasher safe.• The grill top cover can be adjusted to lie flat on the grill base plate to make panini.* Only one essential caveat: grease spills lying by the base section's heating coils (when the lower grilling plate has been removed) must be cleaned up as soon as possible to avoid the potential for the grease to short circuit the coils on the next round of cooking. (Unfortunate lesson already learned).Conclusion:• Great appliance for apartment dwellers (or homeowners) seeking year round grilling.• Easy to use, easy to clean.Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I grabbed this one bc all the reviews on the others said how they wishes they could control the temp! I saw one review on this one about how flat the sandwiches were. All the rest were amazing so I got it! Well..... my husband asked me last night if panini meant “flat sandwich”? I said why? He said because twice now I’ve used it and my I had to use the scrapper to get what was left of my sandwich out! LOL! It is very top heavy. So this is a second warning to buyers so to speak. Your sandwich will be FLAT. Other than that? Works as it should. I’ve been making quesadillas in it lol

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2014
CommentsContent: Well, another name brand appliance that isn't the quality one would expect! I bought this about 1 1/2 years ago, and I really haven't used it but maybe half a dozen times, not because I didn't like it because I did love it, but I just don't grill things very often. Anyway, I just discovered how great flatbreads are cooked on it, and using it last night, the plastic clip that holds the top grill in place broke, and I wasn't doing anything rough with it. So I called Cuisinart, and since it has a 3 year warranty, they offered to replace it, but I was going to have to pay them $10.00 shipping, then I would have to return my broken one at an additional cost of @$30.00. So, to get it replaced I will have to pay @$40.00,(and they don't make replacement clips) which is insane. I will not be buying anymore Cuisinart products!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I love the griddler. I was initially looking for a 4 waffle waffle iron with removable plates and found this. I'm happy I did. Unfortunately, I'm on my second Griddler in 2 weeks. With the first one the top plate did not cook as hot as the bottom, light waffles on top were nearly burnt on the bottom. After 5 or 6 uses one of the clips on the top plate started to malfunction. I requested a replacement and was surprised to see it shipp immediately, before the return of the first. I've used the second griddler twice this week and the plates heat evenly and so far the latches are working properly.

CommentsTitle: Buy if you want your food unevenly cooked.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Don’t buy. The temperature on both surfaces are different. I can’t press a sandwich without having different cooking stages in both sides.I contacted costumer service and they replace the unit. The picture shown are the new unit with the same defect. The costumer service representative insinuate that the unit is cheap and if I wanted a better one I could pay the difference. I don’t think a $80 grill press is supposed to be subject to uneven cooking. I was a fan of this brand and I even wanted to get the Convention oven air fryer but based on this experience it won’t happened.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this less than a year ago.  I don't use it a lot, so store it in my pantry.  I took it out of the pantry, and bumped it against the wooden door jamb.  One plastic leg on the back of the griddle tore off.  Small appliances should survive one small bump without breaking to pieces.  I'd gladly pay a couple extra dollars for sturdier construction.  Now I'll spend the next several years trying to keep the thing level.  It worked well while it lasted, although I only use it for steaks and chops. My previous grills, a Foreman and a Sunbeam, lasted about ten years each.Edit: a year later, the exact same thing. A small bump, and the other plastic leg broke off. Pieces that stick out from small appliances shouldn't be made from very brittle plastic.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2015
CommentsContent: Best griddle i have so far, i use griddles so much i burn them out. I have gone threw a stack over the years, after my last one crapped out i wanted something that would last longer. After searching many reviews on many websites, i kept seeing this model so i got it and i love it.- You can set the temp so much easier and keep it exactly what you want.- The plates are very easy to remove and clean extremely easy. I know you can wash in the dishwasher, but i let them cool and hand wash them.- Really cool how you can flip the plates and have either a flat griddle or a raise grill.- The lid can pivot for sandwiches, or lock for grilling meats.- Both lids have a fat drip in the back that is great idea, Every griddle drips to the front, which i thought was great, but after using this one that goes to the back to the fat tray that is built in or should i say under. By the time i was done cooking, all the fat had been collected and you couldn't see any.- Can flip open to a full griddle, with allot of cooking area. You can have the flat plates or raised for burgers and steak. Still all the fat runs to the middle into the hidden fat tray.Another feature, you can either set the temp by (Sear/High/Med/low/Warm) or by (temp ”F)

CommentsTitle: Small Grill in a Small Space
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2021
CommentsContent: If you are a couple looking for a small highly portable grill that can double as a skillet and panini press, this could be it.  We currently have a relatively small RV with limited space and we were looking for something with just this type of functionality.  This little guy has worked out great so far.  We've done our best to keep it protected while in transit but it still gets bounced around a bit.  Despite that, it hasn't failed us yet.  We've grilled burger, dogs and kabobs.  Fried eggs, bacon and sausage.  Even pressed a sandwich of two with no issues.

CommentsTitle: Great grill press for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this a few weeks ago and 1st off if you think this is going to complete with top notch panini grill guess what, it's not going to. However it does work as described. I read reviews regarding the plate removal button and can see how this might be a problem, but I think if you push down on the plate before pressing the button it removes a lot of the harsh stress on it because the plates are spring loaded. We bought the waffle plates as well making it a 6 in 1 grill. Made some awesome buttermilk waffles with it. I have not had any problems with reheating or cooking whatsoever as other have in the reviews. For the price it is definitely worth buying.

CommentsTitle: I am very happy with it and would recommend it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2014
CommentsContent: Keep in mind that this is a glorified two-sided frying pan, so set your expectations accordingly. Overall, I am very happy with it and would recommend it. Details below.Pros:- big aid in my attempt to loose weight. Cooks my vegetables and proteins without any oil.- very quick. The trick is to preheat. So I turn it on ("Sear" for pretty much anything), and start rubbng/ seasoning whatever I plan to grill. By the time I am done, the indicator light goes green so the grill is ready. 6-7 min for veggies, 3-5 min for meat/fish, and a healthy, tasty, fresh and nice-looking dinner is ready. Overall time from getting into the kitchen to eating my meal is about 15 min -- unprecedented, and really awesome when you come home exhausted from work.- removable interchangeable heating plates. Cleaning is OK.- nice heavy stainless steel construction with lid that adjusts to the thickness of the food- possibilities are endless. Experiment!cons:-no timer. I don't understand how in the 21st century there is no timer on an electric cooking appliance.-it does set off my smoke alarm, so I had to place it on my stove under the fan; that did the trick.-small. Fits just enough for me and my never-too-hungry husband. May be too small for bigger families; definitely too small for parties.- obviously, does not give you a true grill aroma. You can use barbecue sauce a bit, but keep in mind that anything that drips off the meat will burn.Other tips:There is a booklet which is very helpful with cooking times, but some of the instructions are off. It takes a couple of trials for you to get a sense of your grill, so don't get discouraged by a few undercooked or overdried things. I wrote down adjusted cooking setting and times in the booklet, and now my grilling is failproof.Enjoy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2018
CommentsContent: Love my new grill!! My big George Forman was loosing the coating off of it. I wanted a grill where I could remove the plates and wash them. Because it’s just not cool trying to clean a grill off that doesn’t have removable plates. Like how is that even suppose to work!? This grill is the perfect solution.  It’s a win win! You can make it fold flat which is super awesome! I’ve cooked pancakes, hamburgers, and tortillas so far and haven’t had any issues with it. I also got the plates where I can make waffles. Haven’t used those yet though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2017
CommentsContent: This is a great indoor grill.  I've used it about six times so far.  I have a George foreman stand grille I was using that did a great job but I dropped the cover and it broke the handle, then the temperature dial is only heavy paper and didn't hold up well outside even though it was under cover.  This little cuisinart is very well made, easy to use and very easy to clean.  My only complaint so far is the handle doesn't fold down for storage.  Otherwise I really love it.  The drip pan works well and collects a lot of the grease.  I'm not sure why others had a problem unless it's not level.  I scrape the grill plates with the plastic scraper while it's still pretty warm and then wait for it to cool before finishing cleaning.  A little dawn dishwashing soap and a light wash and it's ready to go.  You can also clean the plates in the dishwasher.  More than enough room for food for one or two and more if open flat.  The food tastes wonderful.  I've made steak and chicken.  I'm not as much of a fan for simple grilled cheese but it's ok.

CommentsTitle: Easy to use and cooks in just minutes
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I love my griddler! It's simple to use, just set the temperature control and turn it on. It heats up in just a couple of minutes. Since it cooks from both sides, steaks, pork chops, whatever are done in just a few short minutes. I can cook 2 thick pork chops in 5 minutes! Surprisingly I haven't even tried to make paninis with it yet.

CommentsTitle: Makes a mess!! Hard to clean up after.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2018
CommentsContent: Used it for the first time for cooking hamburgers. The sides of the grill plates are too short! The hamburger grease flowed over the tiny lip around the grill plates. A quarter inch higher on the sides would greatly improve this appliance. Cleanup was a hassle as well, due to all the nooks and crannies that grease gets into. The removeable plates are a nice feature. The "stainless steel" top is easily scratched. Would not purchase again.

CommentsTitle: absolutely love this griddle pannini waffle combo
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I've been using this press for something like 6+ years and just decided to order a new one since my old one was looking well worn.  Really love the ease of this appliance, especially cleaning up, the plates slide into the dishwasher and you can wipe down the outside. grease tray can be thrown in dishwasher too.I use this daily for breakfast, and occasionally for lunch or dinner.You can lay the plates flat, which is super convenient because you then have two cooking surfaces. do yourself a favor and buy the additional waffle plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I was  concerned when I took it out of the box ,  the outer part of it was grease  spattered. and the cord  was poorly re-folded  and wraped with a thin  ordenary rubber- band. I  feel  I was sent  a reconditioned  one and not  a  new never used  one, that I ordere . also it dose not  remove  very much of the fat from the meats as the table top grill  I was replacing , and  the drain off of the fat that is removed DOSEN'T DRAIN AWAY' there for the  five  stars for easy cleaning; this grills only  good feature.. I will soon be giveing this one away and purchaseing  the old  brand that I had before....

CommentsTitle: I Wanted This Griddler To Be Great
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I've had this grill for awhile and end up avoiding it because it just doesn't get the job done efficiently.  My biggest gripe is that grease (or any cooking liquids that show up) puddle on the grill and even occasionally run over the side.  There's just not enough of an angle for the grease to reliably run into the little drain hole.  Anyway ..., long and short, is that I'm going to sell this bad boy and get something else.  I'm done with it.

CommentsTitle: Love it!!! Will use it several times/wk - mnildly concerned about durability over time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2016
CommentsContent: I LOVE this appliance!!!  It's so easy to use, the plates are easy to place, remove, wash... and it's all Dishwasher safe - for lazy people like me!!!A few reasons I reduced the rating were:1) the electric cord cannot be removed and it's not retractible - so you still have to do the wrap and twist-tie deal... And I plan to use this all the time, so it will sit on my counter (which is why a removable/retractible cord would be nice)2) the top surface gets VERY HOT.... I've only used this on Med - but I place it on my stove so my kid can't reach it.3) the sliding button (that releases the top burner to use the panini press) seems to not hold the plate in position well... frequently when I lift the top, the plate will remain in the horizontal position - so the grease runs off to the table surface ... I have to use tongs or a hot-pot holder to push it back up where it will click and go up in a vertical position (so grease will run into the container)4) the handle seems to be made of metal... but not a very sturdy metal - so I'm a little concerned about lifespan ... but that may be an unnecessary concern5) also - since I LOVE this appliance, I wanted to find more plates (so I could have at least one set to use while one's in the DW) - But I had a really hard time finding just the plates (and the ones I did find were $80)... so I'm somewhat concerned about getting replacement parts when needed...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020
CommentsContent: This grill is the best thing I have bought in a long time. It makes amazing grilled sandwiches, bagel sandwiches and I love that you can flip the grilling component and have both sides open (flat) to have a bigger grilling area for pancakes etc.  We heated up left over sliced spiral ham last night on it and it heated it up in matter of seconds just to get the chill out of the ham and was delish.  It is sturdy, well built and I wish I bought everyone in my family one for the holidays.  Purchasing two more now to send my kids back to college with because it is so easy to use and convenient.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2021
CommentsContent: Had one of these previously and it's a great machine, unfortunately we have had the same issue 2x and ended up returning this one -- The first machine, the plastic temperature dial broke; the second machine arrived and the temperature dial just spun and didn't seem to have any tension to keep it set.  I would recommend going with the next version up - worth it for the quality, digital temperature control, etc. It's great that the plates are non-stick and I love that they can go in the dishwasher. We also purchased the add on waffle plates.

CommentsTitle: Good while it lasted, but non-stick plates are not high quality and do not last
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2018
CommentsContent: What attracted me to this machine were the removable plates, to make the grill surface easy to wash.The problem is that the quality of the plates is not high - they gradually started sticking about three years after the purchase. Since Cuisinart's warranty is three years, they won't offer a replacement, and each plate costs $50 - it's cheaper to buy a new unit! It's a complete ripoff.It's especially disappointing because a much cheaper Foreman grill I once owned never had this problem, and while it was not easy to clean, the surface remained non-stick for many years.Not a unit I would recommend purchasing, and Cuisinart has lost a lot of trust from me.

CommentsTitle: Ready to ditch outdoor gas grill. Buy Griddler cookbook!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2015
CommentsContent: We purchase this item after owning for the first time a panini maker made by Kolorik at a local super market.  We use the other unit every day  u can read review. The Cuisinart Griddler is a top notch well made kitchen appliance that does a lot cooking too near perfection. But I have to tell you it casn' t hold a candle to the Kolorik in making crispy bacon strips for our favorite: BLTs.  So in the short period we have made the following with great results.  Pork tenderloins, ribeye steaks, hamburgers, chicken breast, thick sliced zucchini, tomatoes, red onions and portabella mushrooms.  Buy the accompanying cookbook and watch YouTube videos to learn how to properly use it.  You do to have watch your food, bast veggies with balsamic dressing.  Otherwise It will turn out dry, so have side dishes near the ready.  You have to stay with the Griddler but you will not be disappointed.  Do not cook bacon on it, the grease catcher fills quickly and could be more than a mess possibly a hazard.  We have not tried fish and probably won't, broilling is best for fish. We have the Kindle cookbook and you can modify anything in that book to suit  your taste. We have not used it as a open grill for hotcakes yet, but no doubt they will turn out great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Good point: it is definitely nonstick.Bad point: nowhere near level.We'll be returning this and going with a single griddle with an edge. There is no leveling adjustment.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2021
CommentsContent: My mom really likes it. It replaced her smaller electric grill and waffle maker (I got her the waffle plates too).  So far she’s done turkey burgers, steak, and waffles. It seers steak quickly.  The plates are easy to clean so far but it is still new so hopefully that holds up. Overall I recommend it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2021
CommentsContent: Large base unit and two arms up to the top unit that are cast metal. All the weight and torque from the top is supported by the arms. One arm was broken when I received it. Just below the base the metal of the arm is very short and narrow. The weak point is .7 inch by .25 inch and made from a very light metal (not aluminum, cheap alloy) Two of these hold up the entire top.Not recommendedNote: I do not know if any brand is structurally sound anymore.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Best grill in this price range. Heats quickly and evenly. Easy to use & easy to clean. Non-stick plates easily remove for cleaning.But I wish the heat controls listed temperatures instead of labeled medium or high. (What temp is “medium”?)  I overcooked my burger last night!

CommentsTitle: Good for chicken, burgers/bad for bacon and waffles. One major issue
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2018
CommentsContent: This is an ok device.  It is good for most meats and panini.  The major issue is the top does not get as hot as the bottom.  Nothing you do in setting can correct this.  It isn't the end of the world because the top does get hot but the bottom will cook at a different rate.  The aftermarket waffle plates (not by Cuisinart) are terrible and don't work. Which is a shame because they were a big part of why I went with this unit.  The waffles stick no matter what I do and the waffles are always ruined.  This is a good replacement for a foreman type grill and will work ok as a griddle, but overall I'm disappointed with the consistency in cooking temperature and underwhelmed by its use as a griddle.  It's bad for bacon because the griddle plates have a lip around the edge to prevent grease spills.  Unfortunately this prevents the top plate from making contact with the bacon resulting in even a greater disparity between the cooking on the bottom and the top.  You still have to flip the bacon or one side will be burned and the other under done.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: UPDATE 3/1/21/BUYER BEWARE! DO NOT BUY! I received this item for a Christmas present and I will be returning it, after only using it twice! I made grilled ham and cheese sandwiches, the best I have ever made, and then, grilled chicken the next day. When I let it cool before removing the plates to wash, the little PLASTIC thing that released the plates, broke. I could still remove the plates, but the quality control of this item is very poorly designed. I will be returning it and buying a cheaper panini maker, that I would expect not to be as high quality. Very very disappointed in this item Kathy Dillon UPDATE....this is the worst product I have ever bought from Cuisinart and will NEVER purchase another. It has not functioned like it is supposed to, and tonight, I finally had to resort to grilling sandwiches on the stove top. BUYER BEWARE!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2018
CommentsContent: Beats The Foreman grill by about ten miles. This is the most commonly used appliance, by far, in my kitchen. From paninis, to burgers, to steak, fish, and everything In between including pancakes. this thing does it all. The drip tray is new and improved. The griddle plates pop right off and go in the dishwasher. Easiest appliance to clean in my world. I love this thing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I was excited to get this Panini Griddler as we have used and worn out two previous different brands.  Thought I would try this one.  Big mistake!  It looks like it would work until I tried closing the lid on a nice loaded sandwich.  It would push my sandwich out and since the top was so hot I would have to open the lid and get a fork to push the sandwiches back into place.  Also, the second or third time I used this as a Panini maker, the top would not brown so I would have to flip the sandwich to get the other side brown.  This defeats the purpose of a Panini.  Sorry, only three stars

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2013
CommentsContent: BUYER BEWARE: This has received a lot of positive reviews, and I loved that it had all the features I wanted. Pros: easy cleanup with the removable plates you can use either on grill or griddle sides. Drip tray works very well, even in open position. Con: the really important part, the HEAT, does not work well in the open mode. I took a chance and bought it having seen that in some of the other reviews, but some reviewers said that preheating as instructed eliminated the problem. Not so for us! We loved it the first two times we used it, once as a closed contact grill and once as a closed Panini press. Tried to do pancakes and sausage--- took all @#$% night practically and had to keep closing the unit again to get it back up to a useable temp. The fat from the sausage actually got close to solid a few times, the unit got so dang 'cold' (plates still felt hot and you could've easily burned a finger, but it wasn't hot enough to cook the meat). Disappointed with the fact you can't really use it in the open position, so I may return it (recently purchased) and hope that the replacement unit will work better. If it doesn't, I guess my two choices are either to keep it for contact-grill only or return it altogether. Not sure which I'll do.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2018
CommentsContent: I love this machine.  It makes the BEST sandwiches.  (Try a Reuben sandwich on two buttered genuine rye bread slices. (needs to smell really fresh) Place buttered side on one grill; spread inside of slice with brown spicy mustard; top with two slices aged Swiss cheese; top cheese with pressed sauerkraut (pressing sauerkraut eliminates sogginess from the juice); top sauerkraut with fresh pastrami deli slices; then invert the second piece of bread on top of meat so that the buttered side is facing up towards the grill that will be pressing the sandwich to toast.)  YUMM!  Serve with dill pickle on the side.  :)  The machine is excellent for waffles or just about anything you want to make on a grill.  I give this machine as a gift often.  The receivers love it as much as we do.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2020
CommentsContent: First Griddler lasted seven years (used three times a week or so) until the non-stick material started flaking off the the plates. I made the executive decision to purchase a new one rather than try to replace the plates. So far so good (a few months). If this one last sevens years, I'll be satisfied. A very useful appliance. I grill vegetables and bread, but not meats. I would imagine that burgers or steak or bacon might present a clean-up challenge.

CommentsTitle: Top and bottom heat do not match settings....poor quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: This unit does not match temperatures on top and bottom resulting in cooking inconsistencies. Cuisinart used to be very fine quality....not in my experience. This year I also had to return a new coffeemaker that leaked.I won't buy any of their products in the future

CommentsTitle: How did we manage without it?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought one for my daughter in law and loved it so much we bought one for our house. Very easy to clean because the plates are removable.  The plates are dishwasher safe, but I found briefly washing them with a soft sponge worked great.  Tried the teriyaki chicken recipe from the included booklet and the sauce burned since we cooked the chicken in batches, but the plates also cleaned up easily using the included plastic scraping tool.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2021
CommentsContent: This is my second griddler.  I like the convenience as it is lightweight, easy to clean.  Small enough to put away when not needed but large enough cook surface for my needs.  I had to buy the second one as after four years of pretty rugged use; the knobs on the first griddler broke off, making any type of temp control impossible.  Still, I liked it enough to buy the same thing again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2013
CommentsContent: Received today, one day ahead of delivery date. Item looks good, well constructed and above all simple to use. Short receipe book enclosed with some intresting eats. Have not used griddle yet but feel certain, based upon experience with Cuisianart products, it will perform well. Excellant price and has three year warranty from date of purchase. Of course you must register item with Cuisinart. Large enough for two grilled sandwiches or large steak. Small enough to be out of the way when not in use. For $87.00 with delivery by FEDEX, whats to lose?Jan 31 2013  Used the grill for first time today. Two rib steaks about eight ounces each. Used grilling plates on sear setting. The cook book recomends 5 to 8 min on sear. At five minutes flat steaks were well done. This bad boy cooks quickly so be careful. The next steaks will be on high to slow down the process. A couple points on what I read from other buyers comments. One complaint was that the hooks which hold the cooking plates in place were made of plastic and that they would melt from the heat. The retaining hooks on my grill are metal, pot metal to be sure, but metal. The cooking plate release button is made of plastic, however does not engage the hot plates. The other complaint was the red and green light cycles on and off. When I turned the grill on, the red on light on the center control lit up. After heating, approximately four minutes a green light lit on the grill control, the right hand control, to show the grill ready. It went out with the introduction of the meat and did not come back on. The machine however, cooked up a storm. Be sure to read the manual as the controls may be a bit confusing. The middle control turns the machine on and off. The left control is for open face griddleing. In essence the machine works almost too well. More to come as I learn this baby. CheersFeb 11, 2013  A couple of weeks have passed and the grill has been used a little more. Be sure to free the top cooking head, two releases on the sides of the closing handle, to ensure even cooking. This allows the upper plate to apply even cooking to the item being prepared. To leave it locked will cause the food item to cook unevenly resulting in over cooking the rear and under cooking the front. Really a nice little rig which makes slam dunk grilled chesse and ham sandwiches. Cheers

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: We already have an older model of this and love it for making panini sandwiches, but it’s also great for grilling a couple pork chops. I have never used the griddle for pancakes, but the heat seems to distribute evenly, so I’m sure it would work. The grilling pans pop out very easily for cleaning, much better than a quesadilla maker we had that did not. It died on us too. Small tortillas can be used to make them as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Excellent panini press and griddle in one. I've had mine for six years now and had no problems with it at all. While making lunch on it again today I realized I've owned and used it for years and never come back to review it.Finds itself getting used for all kinds of simple kitchen tasks that would normally be on some other pan or appliance just because it's so versatile and easier to clean than a regular pan. Heat distribution isn't as good as a copper bottomed or cast iron pan but not every meal needs it.I've given a couple of them as gifts over the years since and they're always appreciated. Just pop the plates off and throw them in the dishwasher and you're ready to go next time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2016
CommentsContent: I'm so disappointed with this. I spent a lot of time reviewing panini makers and chose this one for it's versatility. The problem is in it's design. First, the grease doesn't drain because the only place for it to drain is about a 1/2 inch groove that easily gets clogged with drippings that have bits of bacon or ground beef in it. So you have to constantly push it through to drain it.Also, the top doesn't lock. It unlocks to allow it to pivot so it can lie flat on a thicker item. It's also supposed to be able to lock into place. Well it doesn't. Remember the aforementioned 1/2 groove? It drains into a drip tray off the back of the grill. When you open the lid and it won't lock, it doesn't line up the top plate's groove into that tray so it just drips all over the counter while you fumble to hold it in place.This doesn't cook evenly, either. Best test is grilled cheese. If you close it, put it on Grill, and let it sit without flipping, the bottom browns very quick before the top is done. And there seems to be no difference between Grill and Griddle settings. They are the same, just labeled differently.Complete waste of money. SO SO disappointed.

CommentsTitle: I am beyond delighted with how handy it and the use we've gotten ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2017
CommentsContent: We are in the middle of a kitchen remodel & I splurged on this to help make meals while we're without our other kitchen appliances. I am beyond delighted with how handy it and the use we've gotten out of it already. After ordering the waffle plates I'll be able to get rid of my griddle and waffle iron and use just this one small appliance. I've so far used it to grill burgers, sausages, cook eggs, make panini sandwiches and heat up meals. I'm not sure what the negative reviews are about, this is the best appliance I have in my kitchen right now. The drip pan for runs is great and the ease of clean up is amazing. I'm so happy with this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2018
CommentsContent: I should have bought this sooner.  I purchased one of these a few years ago for my daughter who was starting grad school and she used it extensively.  I finally decided to give it a try because I got a hankering for fresh panini sandwiches and this is exactly the appliance for that and many other uses.  It cleans up faster than a skillet.  I have used it for large hamburger patties and just made a breakfast with it... perfect for bacon.  Recommend egg rings because there is a slight slope for draining grease.  Not suggested for cooking bone-in meats such as pork chop but just about anything boneless is fair game.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this Griddler! Easy cooking for everything from chicken to steaks or, grilled sandwiches. I used the Griddler to also make paninis, waffles & pancakes. Makes the best bacon ever without grease splatters . Pretty great little small appliance to add to your kitchen. I Especially love the easy clean up with the removable plates. Separate grease catchers are not required since the new design makes the grease-catching unit integral to the grill.Please click below vote if you found my review helpful so I can improve them to help others like you.

CommentsTitle: Good & flexible, but be careful with the drip tray - it's out of sight, out of mind, out of space?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2018
CommentsContent: I like the size and flexibility, but the drip tray for grease collection is designed for form over function.  PRO:There's a lot of grill space compared to my old Foreman.The reversible, removable plates are a joy to pop out and clean (no more balancing the Foreman over the edge of the sink).I haven't used it in the folded open position, but it's nifty having options!  CON:The drip tray is neatly hidden away, but that limits its functionality:  - It is quite small (don't expect to do more than a pound of 80% lean hamburger patties).  - The collection point is at the back, where you can't see what's going on...  - There is no way to see how full it is (short of spinning around and trying to peer in from the back or removing the tray).  - There isn't a good way to empty it while in use.  (I made room to shove a saucer against the back to catch the drips while I pulled out the tray...)It can be tricky to position items to get the top to level off when closed

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I had one for a year and was so sad when  it stopped heating.. I figured i had a lemon.. I like Cusinart products so I decided to get another one.. This one only came with one grill plate and one griddle plate, my last one came with 2 of each so when you make a Pannini you get the grill marks on each side.. Plus this plate is thinner and cheaper quality.  Very disappointed in the decline of their products.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2018
CommentsContent: So far it has cooked everything amazingly, even thick steaks, cooks sausages really fast, makes excellent pancakes, and grilled cheese sandwiches are a snap, cleanup is a no brainier with the pop out trays just put then in the dishwasher.  Don't know why I didn't buy one of these sooner.  The only drawback I can find is the drip tray, it's not very large so you have to monitor it closely if your cooking something like bacon or other things with a lot of drippings, but that wouldn't stop me from buying another one if the need should arrive.

CommentsTitle: A Outstanding Design, But Badly Flawed! (See Update.)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2011
CommentsContent: We started by purchasing one of these for ourselves from Amazon, and quickly purchased a second as a gift for my in-laws - having Amazon ship it for FREE right to their door almost 3,000 miles from us.  We experienced a fairly serious warping of one of the two griddle plates.  It warped upward on the grill side right where grease should drain to the reservoir below the unit.  This wasn't good since grease won't flow uphill and, were the steak or burgers greasy enough, would lead to grease overflow onto the sides of the Griddler itself.Both Amazon & Cuisinart were extremely helpful - shipping a replacement to us in just 2 days without even having to return the faulty part.  Since then one of the plates has developed a much less serious warping in the same place, and we're keeping an eye on it.As for the in-laws' Griddler it had a problem in that the plate release buttons had to be pressed VERY hard to get them to release.  We were visiting them shortly after sending it to them and, once we saw their difficulty in removing the plates, we called Amazon.  Again, Amazon & Cuisinart couldn't have been more receptive and Cuisinart sent a replacement unit with return shipping label for the faulty one.  The replacement arrived before we had to go back home - a period of about 3 days.  Since then they use it often and have had no problems.As for the cooking performance, the Griddler excels compared to rivals such as George Foreman.  Where it excels is in its ability to sear the outside of the meat before it is done cooking.  Our big George Foreman would cook a steak to an unpleasant shade of gray, where steaks cooked on the Griddler have that striped, grilled appearance you get from an outdoor grill.  And it is very, very fast.  Once heated and ready to cook it takes about 3-4 minutes for most anything you're grilling.The George Foreman, however, is better at draining grease since its cooking surfaces are tilted downward - making good use of gravity.  The Griddler's dual purpose design will not allow for that same downhill tilt.  Speaking of that dual purpose, we have never used the griddle side for anything, yet, so we can't say with certainty how well it cooks eggs, pancakes, bacon or whatever.  But, I can't see why it wouldn't do a fine job since it does have temperature controls - something lacking on most counter-top grills.P.S.  Amazon had the best price and shipping was FREE.  Go Amazon!!UPDATE:I am sorry to have to report that both removable cooking plates, yes even the replaced one, have now warped!  In fact, the warping is so severe that it's bad enough, when heated, to cause the plates to release themselves from the spring-loaded holding clips - while cooking!!  Trying to reconnect it with a sizzling steak and red-hot elements attacking me is no fun - believe me!This makes the product unacceptable after a few months of occasional cooking, even though it was excellent when new.  I will now contact Cuisinart to see if they are as willing to help as they were when the first warping problem occurred during the warranty period.Sadly, I've had to downgrade its rating from 4 stars to 2 stars.  It may go up to 3 if Cuisinart proves helpful.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Terrible purchase for the price. Does not heat quickly or cook food quickly such as chicken unless you put the top grill on top of the food. It is messy and the grease from the food  does not flow to one spot so it goes all over the counter. I regret buying this and will purchase something cheaper but better made.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I used this grill to press sandwiches most of the time, I also used it to grill chicken breasts. It was great at first. Easy temperature controls and had enough area to fit two sandwiches at the same time. It was also very easy to clean.However, after about one year of use, it stopped working completely. It would heat up at the beginning to reach the set temperature, but won't maintain that temperature. It starts cooling down and won't work again. I tried turning it off and on to see if it will start heating again, but that didn't work. I tried using other temperature settings…nothing worked. The only way to get it to heat again was to wait a very long time (like an hour), at that point, it only heats to the set temperature before it start cooling again. This wasn't a one-time-only flaw, it started happening after about 8 months of use, and kept happening more frequently until the grill became completely useless.  So if you are looking to buy a product that will last long, I recommend you look for a different grill.

CommentsTitle: NO! Drips Grease from Top plate
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2017
CommentsContent: Its okay, except for hamburgers, or anything that generates much grease. When you open it up, all the grease and juice on the top runs down and drips on your counter and the electric cord. It forms little puddles on your counter and gets all over the feet and bottom if you aren't careful.

CommentsTitle: Great griddle, but the plastic clips are a major design flaw
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2012
CommentsContent: We have had the Griddler for a year and a half. There are things I love about this Griddler, but there are some serious flaws as well. We recently had to replace it under warranty.Pros:1. I love the reversible plates. I liked having the option of using it as either a grill or a griddle, but I didn't like other products with many different sets of removable plates. One simple set of reversible plates was easy to store.2. The coating on the grill was very good. Whereas the nonstick coating on our old Foreman grill wore off quickly, in over a year and a half the plates looked as good as new.3. It cooked food very evenly and it was easy to adjust the temperature as needed.4. It was very easy to clean with the removable plates and removable drip tray.Cons:1. The grill plates were held on by plastic clips that melted after a few months. We still were able to use the griddle for a long time even with the deformed melted plastic clips. But the clips eventually broke off entirely. This is why we had to replace it under warranty--the plates were no longer being held on by the plastic clips, rendering the device inoperable. Whoever designed the griddle to use plastic clips to hold on hot metal plates wasn't thinking very clearly!2. The dials on the front of the Griddler also came off very easily. This wasn't as much of a deal breaker because we could easily pop the dials back on, but it still was annoying at times.3. The 3-year-limited warranty worked great for us because we live in California--but anyone outside California would have to pay approximately $20 in shipping to get a replacement product.Now to share my experience with the Warranty: When I called to inquire about the warranty, I was able to connect immediately with a customer service representative. It was nice to not have to wait. She told me that they would replace the product but I would have to pay for shipping. I told her I would have to think about it. After thinking it over, I decided that I would pay the shipping to have the product replaced because $20 was still less than a new product would cost. But when I called back and spoke with a different customer representative, he told me that because I lived in California I didn't have to pay for shipping for the return. They sent a deliveryman straight to my house to pick up the package off of my porch and I had a new griddle within a week. That was fantastic. But only because I live in California.When I got the new Griddler, there was one difference I noted from the old Griddle, and I'm curious to see how this affects the performance. Our original Griddler had a heavy, cast-iron grill plates, but the new version had lightweight grill plates (aluminum I guess). It does cause the plates to heat up faster. I don't know if the non-stick coating will last as long with these plates. But I'm hoping the lightweight plates put less pressure on the plastic clips so that the griddle will last longer. I have only used it a few times--no problems yet, but I will update this review if any issues with the new product turn up.

CommentsTitle: How did I live without this?!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I LOVE this grill! Got it and used immediately for paninis. Will be using to grill chicken and burgers this week. Popping off and Cleaning the plates are super easy, flick and push of side buttons is a snap. It is on my counter and will probably remain year round, even though we have both a charcoal and propane in backyard that we often use. This is for lazy nights or rainy, cold nights, of which we have at this time if year.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2021
CommentsContent: This was a Christmas present (was on my Amazon wish list) and I love it!  I’m using it at least 3 nights a week for a wide variety of recipes.  It’s the perfect size for two and possibly three.  Easy to clean, compact so doesn’t take up a lot of countertop space, just be careful the lid gets hot, when you tip it to accommodate thicker panini use a hot pad.  Overall I’m very pleased with it!

CommentsTitle: Most Used Cooking Device in the Kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2016
CommentsContent: Three months in and I love this Griddler.  It was bought it for paninis, but it is now the most used cooking device in the kitchen.  In addition to any type of sandwich, we've grilled everything on this from pork chops to chicken breasts to hamburgers to thin strip steaks.  Because it is double sided grilling, there is no flipping and food gets cooked in half the time.  Was real surprised at how well it did hot dogs and brats - once again, no flipping or even rolling around.  For cheeseburgers, just use the handle to keep the upper grill slightly about the cheese, and it quickly melts in less than a minute.  It even works well with marinated items like teriyaki and BBQ sauce.  Even better is that cleanup is a breeze.  The griddles cool off in the time it takes to eat dinner.  We just throw them in the sink and use a nylon bristle brush to quickly work the "gunk" off, then wipe them clean with a soapy sponge.  Use the same method to clean out the grease tray.  So far, it seems to be holding up real well.  Clearly it was my best purchase of 2015

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Since I read the directions before trying it (unlike my husband) it was easy to understand the 3 control knobs andtheir functions. Heats rapidly.  Pork chops came out perfectly, top and bottom equally grilled.Looking forward to making pancakes. On a whim bought the waffle plates for a future adventure.The Grill is relatively small and stores easily in my pantry.  Clean up took under 5 minutes.I'm 100% happy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2019
CommentsContent: This griddle is perfect to take to the office, tailgating and is easy to store at home. It distributes heat quickly and evenly and cleaning it is a breeze. If you’re looking for something to accommodate a larger family I wouldn’t recommend this however we are s family of 5 and it’s perfect for pancakes and bacon on Sunday mornings. Great product at a great price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2020
CommentsContent: My wife bought this for me as a gift. I thought it would sit on the shelf next to my bread maker, never to be seen again, but happily I was wrong! I've made quesadillas; they turned out great, and melted cheese that leaked out and burnt wiped right off. I've made waffles; they turned out great too; the only problem is my Cuisinart waffle maker now sits idle; this is better because it is easier to clean.We like it enough that we bought two more for our son in laws.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2020
CommentsContent: This is great device for grilling a small steak or chicken. Good even cooking. It is also good as an all-in-one compact way for preparing a breakfast of bacon, eggs, and pancakes or for making French toast.  The accompanying recipe booklet has recipes fro Panini sandwiches as well, although I have not tried them yet. Cleanup is very easy. The only drawback I have found has been gauging the amount of time needed to warm up to the desired coking temperature. I’ve found letting it heat up for 8 to 10 minutes is best for most things so far.  I think this could be a very useful cooking tool for RV’ers. It’s efficient, cleans up easily, is versatile, and does not take up a lot of room.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2019
CommentsContent: We are empty nesters, and going to bbq well, ..... MY husband did not like to bbq for just us.  So I bought this Cusinart grill for him.  He really likes this grill.  Everything works great.  The steaks taste like they were on the grill, hamburgers are TERRIFIC.He made pancake with chocolate chips they were fabulous.The clean up is easy.I would recommend this grill.  You won't be disappointed.

CommentsTitle: I highly recommend this item! Versatility, easy clean up, great results!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought the bundle that included waffle plates and I absolutely love it! The plates on my previous panini maker couldn’t be removed for cleaning, so it wasn’t used very often. This is so easy to clean and use, so versatile, and it looks great, so it’s on the counter. The plates are light weight and easy to clean, and everything we’ve made with this has turned out great. I also love that the temperature is adjustable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020
CommentsContent: My daughter's grandpa in California lost his wife in December. He is the sweetest man ever and mentioned he missed her cooking steaks for him. Welp I purchased this as a Father's day gift and he made his first steak and loves it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2015
CommentsContent: I'm sorry to say that I wasn't impressed.  I bought this because we just  renovated our kitchen  and I didn't  want  to fry bacon, sausage, eggs  etc.  that would make a big mess.  I heated it up as instructed (about 10-12 minutes) placed  sausage links on the grill, only to find that it was not hot enough to cook them, or anything else for that matter.  There is no way this would  have fried an egg.  I moved everything over to my stove and continued cooking it.  Next I tried pancakes.
