They were pretty good, but not as hot as it should have been;  an old time individual griddle is much better.  As far as paninis, they cooked them but they were about 1/8th of an inch thick;  we like our sandwiches a little heartier that this.  For  $100 this was a huge disappointment.  I would not recomend this product.  I hardly ever use it.  Good thing I have a brand new kitchen.  The only feature that I did like was easy cleanup.  I also found that the knobs for the temperatures to do the same thing.  What's  the purpose of that???  Save your money, or buy a George  Foreman.

CommentsTitle: Want an Indoor Grill?  Do You Feel Lucky?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2015
CommentsContent: This is a review of the Cuisinart GR-4N Griddler.  I was excited because I thought with this many positive reviews the GR-4N must be better than the cheaper grills made by the x-boxer.  I have owned many of those cheaper grills which eventually fail to stay hot or are too small.  Unfortunately, like many cheaper grills my GR-4N would not get very hot and would not stay warm.  Pancakes were pathetic.  I ended up trashing the pancakes and made them on my stove with a couple pans.  Then I tried frying a couple eggs on the flat plate.  The eggs rolled to the back of the plate and drooled off the back of the unit onto my kitchen counter!  This happened because the cooking plates have a really lame micro lip instead of a lip of any substance that actually keeps food, grease, fat and other liquids on the grill instead of your counter.  Secondly, the plates were not hot enough to cause the eggs to quickly solidify.  Bacon took forever and much to my disappointment Cuisinart does not recommend closing the cover to cook bacon.  What?Here are my lessons learned after years of frustration using inferior indoor grills.1. If you want an inexpensive indoor grill the cooks decent, don't get removable plates and don't expect a large cooking surface.  Don't expect any fancy features or dials.2. The easiest way to clean an indoor grill is with a damp towel while the grill is still warm/hot.  Don't be 'E.coli paranoid'.  The heat kills many germs.3. The most even heating can occur when the heating elements are actually embedded in the plate$.  You will need to pay for this design if buying removable plates or for less money get a grill where the plates are not removable.4. Most non-stick surfaces peel sooner or later.  Depressing.5. Due to the high failure rate and poor performance of so many indoor grills even some pricey ones, I suggest for a pricey grill you get an extended warranty (maybe with SquareTrade) or just buy the cheapo grills instead and expect to replace them when they fail.6. The quality control on the manufacturing of indoor grills must be pathetic.  You'll see many 5 star reviews but then many 1 and 2 star reviews for the same model.I give Amazon 5 stars for allowing me to return this 1 star grill (free return shipping).  So my latest gamble is with a Breville BGR200XL. I can get a 3 year warranty for $21 from SquareTrade after a 25% discount.  I'll review it in the future.

CommentsTitle: Where have you been all my life?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Where have you been all my life? This is good sent. Amazing gadget for quick delicious meals. Super easy to use, very easy to clean. Can make a variety of foods - delicious paninis, grilled cheese, pancakes, quesadillas, just to name a few. It’s awesome for paninis - it allows the cheese and the meets marry all the flavors together while making the outside break crispy and toasty.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Plates don't get hot enough with cooking pancakes.  Pancakes don't get golden brown.  They could have made an adjustment for moving the temperature scale one way or the other.  For Paninis it works just fine.  I like the removable plates.  They are well made.  Not very easy to store or transport.  Its rather large and bulky.

CommentsTitle: Great grill and perfect size for any counter!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Purchased this grill after my best friend kept raving about how much she loves hers and how many different things she's able to cook on it and I don't regret it.I can make so many different things, and is great for both griddle and grilling purposes. I can make burgers, steaks, corn on the cob, chicken, pancakes, bacon , the list goes on and on.Do remember to clean the drain on the side of the grill often if not after every use since it tends to fill out with grease and food buildup also.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I use it almost every day and very satisfied with the product. Nice design, easy to clean and great temperature control. One noticeable minus - when you cook meet there is no enough heat and you have to cook it long time until the meet is getting dry. I didn’t drop stars because as far as I understand US 120V outlets just can’t provide enough power to heat it stronger. Probably that’s why electric stoves use special 240V sockets.This griddler fits great to cook breakfast (eggs, sausages, bacon). Toasts come out nice and crunchy. Excellent for grilled cheese sandwiches.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I just can't stop coming out with ideas of what to make for my family! It heats up really quickly and is easy to clean (just two "plates" basically). Food looks elegant and and it's much healthier (to grill rather than cook or fry). It's sturdy and nicely designed comparing to other options out there. Could have been bigger, but it's not a major issue, as it grills food so fast, you can quickly make some more if needed.

CommentsTitle: A must have in the home.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2018
CommentsContent: This is a Amazing grill!!!. Clean Grill check,Burgers prepped check start grilling!!!! I used both sides of the griddle to cook this burger. This is my second and third time cooking and it cooks everything good from burgers to chicken.. Haven't tried Panini's although. What great is the temperature control and how high the temps may be.. I think 400 or something.Here are some picture cooking two burgers(non frozen). I like mine well done. Everything works well from grease tray to heating.. Make sure you cook on even surface!!!Pros: Almost everything!!!Cons: I have tough times cleaning the grill like really tough time. Also don't touch the top silver part that's hot too......

CommentsTitle: Cuisinart Griddler with waffle iron plates
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2015
CommentsContent: This is a great griddle! Love it, I would have given it a 5 star if they weren't so cheap with the buttons that push off the plates. Both buttons have popped off I am able to put them back in, but there's no excuse for these cheap fitted buttons. Especially since I have to use them to swap to grilling, waffle iron plates and griddle.  Cooks even and fast. You can put out grilled sandwiches in no time sure beats standing over the stove! The temperature runs hot ... so no need to turn it up high when using. I have heated up left over grilled steaks on this and it is fast, even and doesn't spoil the flavor. The waffle plates are great, Wish I had bought this sooner. Such even cooking on this! I just wish they would have used a better quality button for changing the plates.  Hope Cuisinart upgrades this and makes i so they can send us a replacement to purchase so we can fix this annoying problem this is something that is err on their part.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the second time that I’ve purchased this griddler. I bought the first one for my own home and we love it so much that we bought a second one as a gift for our son. He lives in an apartment and wanted something to cook burgers, hot dogs, etc. on that would be easy to clean and wouldn’t make a big mess. We both love how easy it is to use and clean. Neither one of us have had any issues with it.

CommentsTitle: Terrible Design I Should Have Payed More Attention To The Negative Reviews
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2012
CommentsContent: We had a beat up old foreman grill that needed replacement. I looked on amazon for a foreman grille and the griddler came up with good ratings. I ordered one and when it got time to cook it was a miserable failure. I'm used to the foreman grills sloped draining design which as you know drains the fat/juices from the meat. Well this piece of crap griddler is perfectly flat so the grease just sits there on your grill. There is some sorry sloped notch towards the back of the grill plate that is supposed to drain the grease into the rear bottom grease trap. This is so terribly designed. Besides the fact that the grease really doesn't make its way to the grease trap, when you open the grill the top grill lets the grease fall down onto your counter. After using it 4 times to cook hamburgers already the top of the grill has dingy yellowish grease marks that are really hard to clean. One of the worst part of the grill is that if you are cooking something fatty the grease will shoot out all of the sides since there is no lip to prevent grease splatters. The way the grease collects in the back causes it to get into the actual internals where the electric elements are which is a huge pain to clean.Some may like this but I wasn't happy with it. A Cheap old forman grill did a better job and was way less messy.I threw the griddler into the trash.

CommentsTitle: ... had mine for 16 months and at first I loved it. I used it maybe once or twice ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2018
CommentsContent: I've had mine for 16 months and at first I loved it. I used it maybe once or twice a week and always hand cleaned it well after each and every use. It slowly began to fall apart. The top grill would lock into place so it would was hard to spray with Pam once heated. The button to pop out the griddle broke and last night the unit broke in two while I was cooking.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2012
CommentsContent: I love the compact design of this device.  It is much smaller and lighter than my old indoor grill, yet still has more grilling surface.  I also like having temperature controls - something my old grill lacked.I first tested the grill side of the plates with a thick piece of meat.  The grill heated up in less than 5 minutes.  Unlike other reports of plastic latches for the plates that melt, mine appear to be the same type of metal as the plates themselves, probably aluminum.  Not wanting to take chances, however, I used the high setting at first and turned it up to sear for just the last few minutes.  The meat was still partly frozen when I put it on, but the grill held its temperature for about two minutes before the green light went off, and took only two more minutes to get back up to temperature after that, which is not bad in my opinion.  The hinge design is great.  With my old grill, I never would have been able to apply even pressure from the top with a piece of meat this thick.  The grill marks were also much better.  When they say sear, they mean it.Next morning, I used the griddle side of the plates to make pancakes.  Much easier than doing it in a frying pan.  I don't have the waffle plates yet, but they are on my Christmas list.  The multifunction capability was my primary reason for getting this device.  My old grill had removable plates, but this was just for easy cleaning.  It had grill plates only, and no griddle or other plate types were available.So far, I am definitely happy with my purchase.UPDATE:I have since gotten the waffle plates, and absolutely love them.  They make four waffles at a time, but two is really enough for one person unless you are really hungry.  I use a store bought batter mix instead of the recipe in the included book, so it took me a few times to get them the way I like them, but I have it down now.  After nearly a year and a half of regular use, this little grill is still going strong.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm now a professional chef! I cooked chicken breast in 8 mns, perfect. Grilled sliders in 6 mns amazing. Cleaning this is so easy. I was super skeptical about buying this. But, I'm really happy with the booklet instructions and ease of cleaning. It does what it says it does.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2019
CommentsContent: The main reason I got this was to cook a vegan patty for my daughter. The patties are breaded and they take a long time to cook in a pan and they need such a high heat. With this grill I have been making chicken panini's, chicken sandwiches all over the place and it is really very easy. The drip tray is very conveniently out of the way but I can see that it could overflow if you are cooking something really juicy or if you just totally forget about the tray entirely.

CommentsTitle: So many panini sandwiches, quesadillas and you name it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I have had this product for 5 years. It is so worth it every penny. So many panini sandwiches, quesadillas, and you name it. It is like Panera bread at home.  Considering purchasing a waffle attachment. It is slightly expensive though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2013
CommentsContent: I looked at a boatload of grills for years and just never liked anything for one reason or another.  Although this one isn't perfect, it's close enough to get 5 stars from me.I am not a "hand wash only" person.  I'm lazy.  If something can't go in the dishwasher, it better be because it's too big.  This one does just fine.  The plates come off easily and take up no more room than a dinner plate in the dishwasher.  They've cleaned up well with no issues so far even though others have mentioned longevity issues with the coating.  I'll update the review if I see that.It takes a while to heat up to "sear".  "Sear" may be a bit optimistic a term.  It definitely gets hot though.  Once at "sear", my plates still smoke (probably the coating) so I put the pre-stamped 1/3 pound frozen burgers from Costco on immediately.  (Hey, I already said I was lazy, so I'm not going to do them from scratch)  The burgers are medium rare in 5 minutes.  Medium in 5 1/2 and well done in 6.The "almost perfect" comes in the drip area.  I like the design.  Well done with minimal additional space.  It may just be my countertop, but there doesn't seem to be enough rearward lean angle to make the liquids run off to the back drip area.  I just put a 1/4" wood strip under the front feet and it solves that issue for me.  I can live with that and would buy it again knowing that.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2019
CommentsContent: This is so much easier to clean than my old GF grill that didn't have removable plates.  Most of the time, a rinse under running water gets any gunk off.  Only downside so far is that the temp controls are a little confusing as there is with temp markings and one with low-high markings - if both are on, which setting will grill go to?  Does it matter which plate I use? etc. .  I think one control with both markings would be easier.  I'm tempted to get the waffle plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I just received this product and I used it as a flat griddle to make arepas, which worked very well.  I tried to scramble eggs on the griddle but there is a slight tilt to the plates so the eggs ran into the drip tray.  I'm currently testing this product against the Krups Precision Grill.  I'll be cooking ribeyes tomorrow and that will determine which product I keep.  I really like the size and versatility of the Cuisinart Griddler.  There's a mistake with the selector knob on the unit that I have.  It should say "GRIDDLE" on the left and "GRILL-PANINI" on the right.  Instead, the selector knob matches the grill-panini knob.  This doesn't affect the function of the unit but it makes me question Cuisinart's quality control.

CommentsTitle: Earlier version worked fantastic. Top element off 50 degrees
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: We have a prior version of this product and is a work horse. Needed another for larger groups.This unit is terrible. Using my heat gun, the top element is 50-60 degrees lower than than bottom. No panini, no quesodella . Wife won't use it. No info from Cuisinart on how to resolve . Poor design .Get the unit with different griddle and panini plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2013
CommentsContent: The unit has one obvious design flaw.  Grease sits on the bottom plate and will not drain properly.  Not a huge problem until recently when the cooking plates seem to have lost their coating and meat will stick unless the plates are sprayed with PAM beforehand.When cooking is done and the unit opened beware of grease spattering everywhere including in your face.  This is no doubt a result of greasing with PAM but if you don't the unit is worthless and cannot be used.We loved this appliance until the plates wore out.  Shouldn't they have lasted more than a year?  I doubt I'll buy another one.UPDATE: We are so unhappy with the appliance at this point we are ready to toss it in the garbage.  The plates have lost all their coating and have warped to the extent that the grease settles in the corners and has no chance of draining.I can't believe this piece of junk is still on the market.

CommentsTitle: Fast cooking time, easy cleanup and versatility
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2021
CommentsContent: We recently replaced an old George Forman grill with the Cuisinart GR -4NP1. What a difference in cooking time and cleaning. With the removable grills on the Cuisinart, they can be placed in the dishwasher where as the Forman could not. Burgers, steak, and chips cook in a matter of minutes and the cooking liquid is collected in an internal removable tray which is much nicer than our old George Forman where the tray was set in front of the grill and relied on gravity to collect the excess liquid - much cleaner with the Cuisinart.

CommentsTitle: SO much better than my old one!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: My old one was given to me by my aunt. I tried to order new griddle plates but at $30 each, it was cheaper to buy a new unit. OMG! I am so glad I did! This drips in the back (instead of the front) AND has a built in drip tray! Not only that but the new plates are double sided (griddle on one side, grill on the other)! So, these shouldn’t warp!

CommentsTitle: A poor imitation of the original.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2018
CommentsContent: Very disappointed with this replacement for the original Griddler that we used for years. Looks the same except:. the two new reversible plates instead of the 4 dedicated plates; two for grilling and two griddles arevery light weight and do not heat up or hold the heat for the hoped for results.. the new built-in grease catcher does not collect the grease so it still requires external catching cups with no designedencouragement for collection.. the heating is non-uniform, both upper and lower, and inadequate for the job.. a flimsy feel overall with use confined to grilled cheese sandwiches, pale pancakes, and the like.In short, the cost cutters were successful but the great product is a shell of it's formerself.

CommentsTitle: George F*reman would buy THIS ONE!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2012
CommentsContent: stop reading reviews and BUY IT!  This thing is like a luxury car, no details were missed.There are no cons at all (even if I tried to make some up), so I'm just gonna hit the great parts:1.  Quality craftsmanship, brand you can trust2.  Griddle plates are ridged on all sides except for the drip area, so no mess.3.  Easy cleanup, truly non-stick and water rolls right off, you could hand wash these in two minutes, no problem, air dry.4.  Plates pop right off with a push of a button and click back on just as easily.5.  Rubberized handle is solid, leveling feature for thick food works great, the top of the griddler floats.6.  Lights to let you know when you're up to temperature7.  Trays are reversible for flat or grill********Stop buying overprice quesadillas and paninis!  This makes AWESOME quesadillas, use plenty of butter, cheese won't even stick to this thing!  **********George probably owns this one.MY RECIPE:  BIG SLICES OF ITALIAN BREAD, SPICY/HOT HAM, PEPPERONI, GENEROUS DILL PICKLE SLICES, BRICK CHEESE, FRENCH'S BROWN MUSTARD, BUTTER/MARG BOTH SIDES, COOK ON HIGH GRILL FOR A FEW MINUTES, EPIC.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2018
CommentsContent: This does it all and does it well.Intelligently designed, multi purpose...........one of the only grillers that you canactually take the grill plates off and clean.  Cleans up in a breeze.  Use hot water, dish soap and a non scratch pad.Great design - can leave on your counter (because you will use it all the time for everything)and looks great.  People will think you have taste and style.......FUN FACT:  Do not use Pam product on grill plates (or any non stick surface) it's actually not compatible with nonstick cookware - will ruin it...use a non aerosol oil mister (pump), OR brush oil on grill OR use oil on paper towel and coat surface.

CommentsTitle: Part broke off during first use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2013
CommentsContent: Updated -The new one did not have an issue with the same part that broke off another unit.  I have used this many times and like it much better as a grill than as a panini maker.  I've found that many times the bread doesn't brown - it just gets hot and somewhat mushy.  I'm not sure if I am doing something wrong.Received this tonight.  Was very excited to use it right away. Panini's for dinner!  The unit is pretty hefty and seems well built except for a few plastic pieces. And therein lies the problem.  On the right hand side of the unit's top plate there is a black slide lever that releases a lock so the unit can open to a flat position. When I was trying it out before use, it worked fine.  However, after heating up the unit and cooking dinner I let it cool down as instructed and then went to open it flat also as instructed to remove the plates for cleaning.  The plastic lever broke right off.  I requested a replacement in hopes that this problem is not inherent to the product. If it happens again, I'll update this review.  I rated this a 3 because of the potential quality problem - but it worked great on our panini's.

CommentsTitle: Easy to Use and Clean, Compact
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I grill chicken just about every week for lunches, so I wanted a small griddler that was easy to use. This one is perfect for what I need.  It took me a minute to figure out when the griddle was at the right temperature, and it seems like the top grill gets hotter than the bottom. Overall, the chicken always comes out completely cooked and juicy. I love that the griddles come off the grill, it makes clean up so much easier. It's also compact and light, so storage is easy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019
CommentsContent: We have several Cuisinart products in our kitchen to include an older Griddler version that continues to work very well.  Bought 2 of this new model with high expectation (one was to be a gift),  The new model does not obtain or maintain cooking temperature.  Just when items start cooking the griddle cools and does not reheat until almost cold.  Took 35 minutes to cook 5 slices of bacon after 10 minutes warming time.  The book says it is a great way to cook breakfast for 2 people or a large family.  At the rate I experienced, some of my family would get breakfast close to lunch time.  Returning both griddlers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2019
CommentsContent: This griddle sucks.  The the grooves of the grill plates do not properly line up with the oil drip pan.  So the juices drip onto my counter instead of into the oil drip pan.  We followed the instructions in the manual and tried every which way of arranging the grill, same result.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2009
CommentsContent: I am impressed with this grill and find it far superior to my old Foreman grill.  The plates detach for cleaning and the top plate can press down at variable heights/angles to adjust to the height of whatever you have on the grill.The temperature adjuster is a great feature to have and the grill heats up within 5 minutes to its maximum.  I've been using it mainly for paninis and grilling.On nonstick finishes:  I have read some complaints about the nonstick finish and suspect some users are not quite aware of the limitations and proper care of nonstick cookware.  In general, nonstick finishes are not so much "poorly designed" (as one reviewer puts it), they just have real life limitations no matter what brand you use.  Even cast iron, fairly durable, has its own limitations.  Be suspicious of complaint reviews that don't suggest a better alternative. Nonstick finishes WILL break down the more you use it and the higher the temperatures.  You might just be looking for a product that just doesn't exist.Nonstick surfaces show best longevity if oiled just before food is placed on them.  Furthermore, temperatures above 500 degrees (around the max setting here) cause them to break down a bit.  So don't grill something messy on these at max temperature if you want them to last.  The nonstick finish on this is a little less potent than on some cookware I've used, but I suspect this is because of the higher grill temperature they are expected to endure (so users won't get flecks of Teflon on their food).  I shouldn't have to say this but I will:  You can't expect to use metal on nonstick surfaces (knives, scouring pads) and expect it to last.  I've had this about 6 months and use it 2-3 times a week and the plates are still in great shape.  Bread and sandwiches clean up easily.  If I am going to cook something messy and don't want the hassle of cleanup, then sometimes I use aluminum foil.  You still get a nice set of char marks.

CommentsTitle: Uneven heating and does not sear well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I was very disappointed that this product did not live up to its name.  The unit seems to heat unevenly, but most disappointing is that it does not sear well.  I mean that was the whole point of the product was to get a good sear on meat.  If not too late, I will try to return for refund.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2018
CommentsContent: This beats George Foreman's grill by a mile! It does everything it should superbly. It heats up quickly and evenly, the plates come out for easy cleaning, and the stainless is handsome and durable. Chicken, pork, hamburgers, steak, sandwiches, bacon, eggs - well I don't need to ramble; it does it all. I put it easily away rather than clutter my counters. I have learned that it does spit a bit of fat droplets on the counter, So I use a paper towel or two. Tasty, healthy, fast, and reliable. If it boiled my broccoli too I'd give my pots to Goodwill. Get one - you'll love it too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2011
CommentsContent: Dissatisfied in every way.  This replaced a prior Cuisinart unit that was ready for replacement after several years of use:  its surface was wearing out etc. Bought this unit due to removable trays for easier cleaning. However, it has several problems.1. Heat level is inadequate.  The heating units are too small or too far from the trays, and it takes forever to cook anything, and the heat level is insufficient even to brown a paninni. I suspect the air flow between the trays and the unit also contribute to uneven, spotty and inadequate heating. The only area that's useful for cooking is about a 4 inch circle at the center of the tray.2. Construction is flimsy compared with the other Cuisinart unit it replaces.3. Takes forever to warm up, based on the inadequate heating elements.4. While it is acknowledged that it is not intended for cooking eggs or omelets, on the prior unit you could do this, on this one you can't: the drain function prevents it. Also, the ridge around the edge of the trays are too shallow: so the product runs off the edge and over the side.5. Ridges are too shallow and flat to cook pannini's.I rarely return items but this one is going back and I'm going to find a replacement that has removable trays and will be more useful.  This unit needs a redesign with better trays, better more even heating, and perhaps an adjustable height on the rear legs so you can either use it in 'drain' mode or not.  Or an adjustable drain fence.

CommentsTitle: Loved the Smaller Version, Love this One Too
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2014
CommentsContent: We had the smaller version for a year and a half before we decided to upgrade to this model.  We thought the larger surface would allow us to cook meats more evenly and we found the idea of waffle plates appealing.  We used the compact one at least 2 or 3 times a week on average and have continued that with this one over the three weeks we've owned it.The controls are easy to use and operation is mostly intuitive.  I referred to the recipe booklet only for to get an idea of what they suggested for different items as far as cooking with the griddler closed or open.  When I follow those recommendations, my food turns out just fine.  When I don't, it turns out okay, but sometimes it gets overdone on the outside before its internal temp is right.  Other reviewers have noted the thermostat goes on and off so that the temperature is not truly constant.  That may be the case, but it has not caused me any problems at all.  I will agree that it can be a little tricky to use in the open position.  The heat dissipates kind of quickly with the unit open and can cause problems when preparing anything more than 1/2" thick or so.  However, closing the grill has not compromised the juiciness of any of the meats I've prepared:  steaks, chicken breasts, and pork chops so far.  And, if you really want to use it open, try using a foil tent to trap the heat.  That has worked well for me when cooking more food than will fit on the single plate.We are very happy with our purchase.  Macy's (where we first saw this) puts this unit on "sale" for more than Amazon wants normally.  Buying the waffle plates at the same time gave us an even better deal.  The waffle plates worked well, too.  We've owned several waffle irons and the only one better than this was a huge Cuisinart model.  The small compromise in quality is more than made up for by the space we save having it all on one unit.

CommentsTitle: I particularly like the Panini feature
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2014
CommentsContent: You gotta get one of these. My kids call it the "transformer". This devilce, along with a T-Fal fryer that I bought about the same time, has literally taken over cooking duties in our kitchen. (Well, those duties that can't be served by a microwave, anyway...) With this thing laid out flat, my wife and I can prepare a pancakes and eggs breakfast, complete with  bacon for both of us in one fell swoop. When the kids are home, we have to do two runs...big deal. There's four times as much to cook when they're home!I particularly like the Panini feature. Until we got this I didn't even know what a panini was.Now that we have this, the panine is a fifth food group ( along with chocolate, bacon, coffee and beer).The one thing I whine about is this. The destructions say that you can get waffle plates for it. I've tried locally and online. Even the online dealers that say they have them report them as out of stock when you try to order a set. I WANT MY WAFFLE PLATES!!!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this grill daily, sometimes twice a day.  I can make pork chops for dinner in 7 minutes and those cooking plates are very easy to clean.  I can have crispy bacon in 4 minutes,  Burgers in 5 minutes, steaks in 4 minutes.I really like being able to prep and cook dinner in less than 10 minutes.  We are eating real food as opposed to fast food more often because this machine makes dinner easy.  Sorry McDonald's but spending my 20 dollars on steaks instead of your burgers and fries.This grill heats up quickly, cooks evenly, is easy to clean and is inexpensive.  The instructions have a good amount of information on the cooking times of various items.  I would definitely recommend this grill to friends, in fact my mother recommended it to me.

CommentsTitle: Awesome Griddle/Grill, wish it came with waffle plates though
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2012
CommentsContent: This griddle/grill is amazing. The only reason I took a star away is that it doesn't come with the waffle plates, which would make it my absolute favorite kitchen appliance ever. And they cost half the price of the griddle. But anyways, as to the griddle/grill. I got this for Mother's Day and have been testing it out in all of its many forms. I have grilled hamburgers, pork chops, made paninis, grilled cheese, used the griddle to make breakfast, and everything I have tried has come out fantastic! It cooks quickly, and grilled foods taste amazing! I was really surprised at how yummy the hamburgers turned out, since I usually hate the taste of indoor george foreman type "grilled" stuff. These actually tasted like they had been grilled, and were very juicy.The other thing I absolutely loooooove about this thing is the removable plates that can go in the dishwasher. That is the best feature ever! I always HATED cleaning our regular griddle because it had to be hand washed, and with care due to the electrical parts. Now I don't have to be so careful of it, and even hand washing is a breeze if I do it that way because stuff just comes right off the plates. The nonstick surface is really good. I usually just throw them in the dishwasher though, and then they are ready to go next time I want to use the griddle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I really like this product. I spent a long time deciding which panini press I wanted to get, searching reviews and product review sites. Eventually decided on this one and it’s awesome. I was a little wary thinking any appliance at this price point had the potential to be cheaply made. This is very sturdy, heats well and there’s enough versatility to make this purchase worth it. I find a lot of the time I’m cranking the heat past the recommended setting but it’s still very effective at grilling sandwiches or anything else. I’ve made perfect pancakes and French toast for the entire family all at once. Definitely a great investment I’m glad I pulled the trigger on.

CommentsTitle: Great burgers, can't wait to try chicken
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2014
CommentsContent: I've cooked eight burgers since receiving the Griddler yesterday.  Everything is great; from the high temperature leaving sear marks on the burgers, to how quickly the burgers cook!I will be trying boneless chicken breast soon, first with the grill closed after pounding to be the same thickness, and looking forward to trying the open grill too.The best part about it is that the clean-up is much easier than a regular grill.  The plates are removable, a feature I was looking forward to, and they are reversible with a griddle (flat) on one side and grill (with ridges) on the other side.  They are very easy to remove and put back, so easy to clean.I'm glad I didn't spring for one of those really expensive grills.  This makes making burgers as easy as making waffles - once I figure out really how quickly the burgers cook - less than 5 minutes is my estimate and they are 160 degrees!  An added bonus is being able to keep the grill closed while you check the meat temperature; can't do that easily with an outdoor grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: First time using the grill got so hot and burnt my hand. Did settings as recommended. Set off my smoke alarms big time. Very disappointed and would not reccommend this product. Dangerous, off to the dumpster and made sure noone else can use this dangerous device. Cut the cord.

CommentsTitle: Perfect kitchen appliance it does so many things!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Absolutely love my griddler! I am so satisfied With the quality, the heat distribution and options and settings .It's perfect for steaks, chicken breast, wraps ,fish and paninis.I love it! Then I get to use it for pancakes French toast sausage and eggs ! It's perfect

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2018
CommentsContent: I thought if I purchased a Cuisinart I would be getting a good product.  But this appliance feels flimsy and cheap.  The whole unit feels like tin and as flimsy as aluminum foil.  The plates are very light weight.  The dials have a lot of play to them so I'm never sure if I have the setting correct.  It does not drain well even though it has a collection reservoir.  The lid does not stay secure.  Especially hazardous since it gets very hot.  The whole appliance gets very hot...not just the plates.  It is not worth the pricey amount I paid for it.  Very disappointed in Cuisinart.

CommentsTitle: Love it but waffle plates should be included
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2018
CommentsContent: So far I've only used the Griddler to make grilled cheese sandwiches and waffles (with the separately purchased waffle plates). It heats up quickly and is simple to use. The waffles turn out perfect every time. I learned that when using it for sandwiches, regular sandwich bread is too thin and squashes down too flat.My only complaint is that the waffle plates should be included with it. If they came with it I would have given 5 stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2019
CommentsContent: We absolutely love this little gadget. From beyond burgers to pancakes, grilled cheese, and more, this griddler is the perfect surface on both the grill and flat side. You do need a couple good feet of counter space to use it, and it needs to be pretty near a plug, but that wasn't a problem for us. Cleans easily and really simple to use. The only thing I'd say to take note of is that if you are a right-handed person the little catch to open the lid fully is kind of in an awkward place, and my husband got a light burn accidentally when his finger caught the side of the griddler trying to get that latch open. Just something to be careful of! But otherwise we adore our griddler and have told our friends who cook that they need one too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Overall I like the product. However, the bottom doesn’t leave grill marks on my bread or chicken tenders, so I’m thinking the heating element doesn’t heat up as much as the top. Also, some butter leaked under one of the grill plates and it’s impossible to get the baked butter from around the heating elements. Would have returned, but the return window has expired. It might just be the unit Amazon sent me, as others have no issues at all.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Have had this griddler for about a week, have cooked almost every meal on it.  Only one that had an issue was trying to cook 4 burgers, they cooked great, but the fat drippings over filled the drip tray.  Have now cooked: bacon, burgers, chicken breasts, chicken tenders, grilled cheese, ham and cheese... even grilled a PB&J sandwich!  Burgers were better on a regular BBQ, but everything else is perfect on this griddler.  Easy to clean, heats up quickly

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2014
CommentsContent: I read all of the reviews for the Griddler before buying it.  Considered buying the larger version but waffle plates are not available for it and this seemed like a good size for our family of 3.  Have had it for 2 days and have already made paninis three times and waffles (bought the bundle with the waffle plates included).  All came out great.  Highly suggest spending a little time reading he instructions and figuring out how the device works before trying to cook on it.  With (quite a bit of) versatility comes a small degree of complexity so it really is time well invested.  All of the food came out great.  Used ciabatta rolls and made a smoked turkey, avocado, tomato and cheese Panini as well as my personal favorite - the pesto, tomato and fresh mozzarella (twice because my daughter wanted one of these for breakfast!).  Made waffles for my husband.  It was fast easy and convenient and very quick clean up.  No issues with the surfaces heating up - another reviewers have pointed out you need to keep the grill CLOSED to preheat it,  HIghly recommended.  Looking forward to grilling some vegetables for dinner tonight.  Fun to use- quick - let it heat up while you are prepping your ingredients and follow the guidelines in the recipe book for heating times.  Will update my review if anything changes but I'm really looking forward to cooking on this and expect we'll be using it often.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2013
CommentsContent: I love this Griddler for so many reasons I hope I fit them all in. First, and probably my most important reason is that I have a black stove.  If I even boil water on it, it gets spots.  Frying is waaay worse.  This has an additional grill that does two things.  One, it cooks the item on two sides at once which makes it very fast and two, there is very very little spatter on my granite counter top.  Which cleans up a lot easier than the stove.  The top grill swings loose so that when you bring it down on an item it lands completely flat.  Another big thing is that it can be a grill with lines raised across it or you can easily detach & flip  the plates over for a griddle that you can do grilled cheese, pancakes, eggs, etc. on.  It also unlocks so that you can flip it back off itse4lf and it is doubly big which is great for pancakes or eggs or anything that isn't grilled.  Also, it has very efficient and easily used controls.  In the center is a knob for griddle one way, off up, & grill right.  The left knob is for the griddle that is marked with 250, 300, 350 degrees.  The right knob for the grill is "low, med, high, sear."  Ovens take so long. I live alone & this is great for single meals even though it is roomy enough for about 4 pieces of meat, fish, etc.  All in all it is great in so many ways.  I would definitely recommend it.

CommentsTitle: I really wish I could love this grill but I can’t
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2018
CommentsContent: I really wish I could love this grill but I can’t. What I do love is that the plates pop off for easy cleanup and is dishwasher safe.This is a very small 2 person grill. Yes, you can get 4 burgers in but honestly how often do you eat burgers. Two chicken breasts max is all it will hold. Thus far I seem to only be able to get a seat on one side unless I flip the meat.My other complaint is the way it catches drip. There is a small opening at the back where it is supposed to drip down and be caught by the drip pan. Most of the time I end up with the drippings all over the counter with very little in the pan.I’ve had a George Foreman before which I loved with the exception that I couldn’t take the trays off of it so it was difficult to clean.Still hoping to find that perfect indoor grill for quick meals.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2018
CommentsContent: Got this because I didn't want another George foreman after going through 2 different ones. I really love this one and the features it has. Have used it several times already since we got it a month ago. The removable plates make cleaning really easy. The only thing that seems like it could break is the bottom since it's plastic, just going to try to be careful with that, not a deal breaker. The others I've had had more plastic than this one. Like people have said, if you're cooking something greasy like burgers with the grill press and you open it up  it can make a mess behind it because of how the hinged lid works. However I found if you just use the scraper or a spatula to push the lid back into its snapped in position, there's no drips all over behind it, makes it into the grease tray that way. All in all so far it's the best counter grill we've had.

CommentsTitle: Superb, just could learn one thing from the Breville. 4.5 Stars!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2010
CommentsContent:
This grill is awesome, that is all I can really say. This one attracted me because it has the flippable cooking plates so that there's lots of versatility. Originally I was looking for a panini grill and an electric griddle, but after investigating electric griddles and using some at friends houses, there just didn't seem to be any good ones out there. Every electric griddle I've seen all just won't cook evenly because they are huge in surface area without having enough heating element coiled underneath to heat the surface properly, but not so with this wonderful machine. I was used to using The 

  
Breville BSG520XL Panini Duo 1500-Watt Nonstick Panini Press









  
  
    
  , which is a great panini press, I'll compare the two for you.Major Pros:Temperature control dials:You get full control of your cooking, unlike the breville machine which simply turns on when you plug it in and must be unplugged to turn off and it set to turn on hot, the Griddler has the ability to cook on low or high. I found this much better for cooking paninis because you can cook them on lower temps to make sure the inside of the sandwich is all hot and the cheese is melted, etc. then you can finish it off on hot to put those nice grill marks on the bread.The Griddle function:Not only is this a great panini grill/contact grill, but I'm sure it is the best electric griddle on the market. When you unlatch the top end to make it all lay flat you can fit around 10-12 slices of bacon on the machine or about 8 small pancakes, so it's not a terrible downgrade in size from your average electric griddle. The best part is that IT COOKS EVENLY! Unlike all the other griddles out there that have one big circular coil that leaves the center unheated the Griddler has full coil coverage on both sides for perfect cooking!Minor Con:The Lack of a Lock/Adjustment switch on the swing arm:The only way that the breville out does this machine is that it has a switch that allows the top surface to move and lock into positions that are more accommodating for a variety of sandwich thicknesses. If you cook a thick sandwich with the Griddler it will take a little bit of extra effort to make it turn out perfect, because the griddler will want to squish it a little more on the back side instead of coming at the sandwich from right above.Also, the same switch on the breville locks the machine shut so that you can pick it up with one hand by the handle and allows it to be stored flat against a cabinet or countertop wall, the Griddler will always have to be moved/stored in it's normal sitting position which takes up more space.All in all I definitely wouldn't trade my Griddler for any other panini grill or griddle. It's an awesome machine.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2016
CommentsContent: Great product.  We've use it everyday!  I will admit I've purchased counter top grills before and before you know it, it's stored in a cabinet and somewhat forgotten.  We started using this product when it arrived about 2 months ago and we've literally used it everyday.  We've used it for both fresh and frozen meats, sandwiches, and the most prefect pancakes and bacon imaginable. The 3 cooking dials allows for a variety of temperatures ranging from 200 to 425 as well as  high, med, low, warm and sear settings. The  grill plates snap on and off easily and clean up is even easier whether hand wash or in the dishwasher. I definitely recommend this product.

CommentsTitle: The six things I love about this Griddler!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2015
CommentsContent: The minute I opened the box, I knew this was going to be perfect!Things I love about it (1) The grill panels are removable for easy cleaning (2) the grill panels are two sided -- with the griddle side and the flat side (2) It has a temperature control (3) It has an on-off switch so I don't have to unplug it (4) It has a removable pan that catches drippings (5) It can be used 5 different ways (6) its attractive enough to leave out on the counter.I made a sandwich today and it was great! The grill panels were easily removed and cleanup was simple. Highly recommend this model.I started using a sandwich maker about 18 months ago. Based on product prices and reviews I purchased two other recommended brands. Was very disappointed in missing features and griddle quality. I just threw out the second one because the teflon coating started peeling. I finally realized that if something doesn't last very long and you have to buy a replacement within a year, you don't really save any money. Better to shell out a few extra bucks and buy something that will last, with all the features you need.

CommentsTitle: So glad I did my research
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I was just about to pull the trigger and buy a competing grill press (rhymes with "doorman") when I started reading its reviews - broke after one year, uneven temp, hard to clean etc.  Even though it was a popular brand I couldn't look past those reviews. It also didn't have adjustable temp control or removable grill plates.  Not only does the Cuisinart GR-4NP1 have both of those things, the plates are reversible and the whole thing can lie flat.  So easy to clean.  I think I may order the waffle plates.  Very happy with my choice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2014
CommentsContent: I had a george foreman before this one, and the hinges broke, so I replaced it with this one. The George foreman was bigger but had only high temp. This one has temp control from warm to sear. George foreman only folds over on a fixed hinge, this one is adjustable and lays open with reversable plates from grill to griddle. George foreman had the grease tray set right in front on counter easy to view if it full but also easy to bump and spill( I did many times) this one has tray slide into underneath, stays put but you can't see if it full. The sear temp on this one is not that high like on the George foreman so cooking is a little slower but not too bad. The george foreman was wipe clean that was the worst. This one you detach plates and place in dishwasher(amazing) then you wipe clean sides if you happen to make a mess. Over all I give this one a 4 only because it is a little smaller then I thought. But it is also looks good on the counter where the George foreman did not.

CommentsTitle: Great, but a couple of design flaws
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2008
CommentsContent: I have had the griddler for a couple of years, and use it quite often. I also bought one for my daughter for Christmas, and she loves it. I haven't noticed any problems with temperature drops as mentioned in other reviews, but I guess I have paid more attention to how the food cooks. I use the panini plates for most of the foods I cook, and have made a number of different foods.In the time I have had the grill and as much as I have used it, the teflon coating is still in new condition. I haven't been hard on it, though. I use a plastic or silicone turner only to remove foods. To clean, I wipe the plates with a paper towel as soon as I remove the food, and all of the cooked on food and grease comes off very easily. After the plates cool, they are washed with soap and water and dried. I don't put them in the dishwasher.Although I really like this griddler and use it often, I have two complaints. The top part of the unit has the floating hinge which is nice for cooking thicker foods, but it is held in place by two small round nubs on the handle that are too easily released. If you touch the top unit at the middle or bottom to wipe it, it releases and the plate can come down to burn your hand. I hold the top of the plate with a pot holder to prevent it from fall on my hand. The other complaint is that it is necessary to "help" the floating hinge when making a thicker grilled sandwich such as a patty melt or a panini. While lowering the upper grill plate, I hold the back of it with a pot holder to keep it parallel with the sandwich. If this isn't done, the upper plate meets the top of the sandwich on an angle causing the top of the sandwich and part of the contents to squish forward. I have figured out how to get around the two problems, so the grill works for me. Hopefully, this will help anyone with similar problems.As for spattering grease, that's what hot grease does. The solution would be to keep the heat lower for cooking, or to cook foods with less grease in them. I haven't considered this to be a problem with the griddler because the result would be the same when cooking bacon or other greasy foods in a pan.

CommentsTitle: Very disappointing as sandwich press and as griddle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2019
CommentsContent: I researched sandwich grills extensively, and chose this Cuisinart model as the best value.  A year later, I am sorely disappointed and will be donating this to a charity event.  Sandwiches in the press were soggy rather than crisply toasted.  Sandwiches on the griddle were not much better.  Pancakes on the griddle were so-so.  I had hoped that, with the waffle inserts, this would replace both my waffle iron and flat-top griddle.  No such luck; off to the silent auction it goes!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2019
CommentsContent: Awesome little indoor grill/griddle. Cooks very well and distributes the heat evenly. Also has a little drawer thing that you can pull out to empty the grease. I love that the top grill can angle with a press of the button bc it makes it VERY easy to toast buns or large burgers without crushing them to death lol. It's also REALLY easy to clean up after using. Definitely recommend if you're wanting a counter top griddle/grill as it does a GREAT job.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2014
CommentsContent: After three months of extensive use the Griddler has done a really great job on just about everything I've cooked on it.  It really excels with steaks and chicken breasts and does quite well with sausages as well.  Bacon and eggs takes a little extra time but but still come out well.  The only thing I was a little disappointed in was cooking burgers on it (Both turkey and beef).  Because the plates are not at a slant, like other electric grills, the grease does not drain away from the burgers.  I kept my Foreman grill just in case the Griddler didn't work to my liking.  I'm glad I did as the Foreman grill is still the best, by far, for cooking hamburgers and turkey burgers.All in all, the Griddler is a great accessory for anyone (like myself) that doesn't have a chefs kitchen at their disposal.  If they can improve how the grease drains from the plates I would give it 5 stars.P.S.  Anyone with small children should make sure to keep them away from this device when in use as it gets very hot to the touch.  It will save you a trip to the emergency room for burns to little fingers.

CommentsTitle: This thing is DURABLE like no other
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2011
CommentsContent: We have a hot dog stand that's open 14 hours a day 6 days a week and we don't even have a commercial grill. We have this little Cuisinart Griddler thing and although I've bought a new one as a back up recently, it's still in the box because the old one I bought almost a year and a half ago just keeps on working! I know, getting excited over a grill that's still running after one year might seem strange at first glance, but I doubt you'll be grilling every single day for 14 hours straight. That's some grueling grilling. Stretch that out into weekly grilling hours, that's a long, long, ridiculously long time.And here is another thing I've learned. If you're serious about grilling, you need a grill where the electrical connection is separate from the hinge. This one has a super sturdy and thick cable containing the wiring, wrapped in a protective metal coil, like a spring. Open close, open close, 14 hours a day, nothing happens to the wiring. Try THAT, George Foreman. HAH!Now one caveat. The non-stick coating on the grill plates is long gone. I don't know where it went. But it's gone. For my purpose, it's not a problem. It's most likely because I tend to really go to town on the grill plates every morning with that little scraper that comes with it, and a brush, but honestly this thing gets so much constant (ab)use, non-stick coatings don't have much of a chance. On the positive side, the grill is "seasoned" absolutely PERFECTLY for our use now.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2020
CommentsContent: We purchased this mainly to make Panini Sandwiches and I found the Waffle plates (purchased separately).  All fits awesome and we have used it for Waffles, Pancakes and Panini Sandwiches.It cleans very easy since all removable plates are dishwasher safe.

CommentsTitle: Easy to use with so many options.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019
CommentsContent: I absolutely LOVE this panini maker. One of the best things is that I could make two large sandwiches at the same time. Clean up was fast and efficient with plates being easy to take off and put back on. Can’t wait to try veggies on the grill. If I need to update this review I will. Otherwise this purchase was so worth it. I threw away my old Hamilton beach and also a too small George foreman press. Only need one. This one!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2020
CommentsContent: We love it! Makes great hot sandwiches. Watch out, though, it gets hot! Make your adjustments to the top lid for the height of the food BEFORE you heat it up!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2021
CommentsContent: My Panini says are delicious. Great Cuban,Ruebans,Ham and cheese. Tuna Melts. Anything you desire in the way of Toasted sandwiches. Love it. I had a George Foreman,had to flip the Samy over to get good grill marks. Wolfgang Puck Panini Maker was fine untill it Burnt out after a couple years. Now my Qusinart is Perfect.

CommentsTitle: Status light lit but no heat
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2012
CommentsContent: The unit was received in good order but, once set up, the status light is lit but the unit doesn't heat. Customer service rep "Jacob" at Cuisinart advises no troubleshooting is possible and recommends return to Amazon. However, my own experimentation prior to my call demonstrated that a poorly inserted grill plate could fail to disable the safety interlock and that the status light is lit even when the interlock is enabled. So a poorly inserted plate COULD explain the observed problem. Of course, I had satisfied myself that this was NOT the problem in my case before placing the call.Cuisinart manufacturing rates one star for poor quality assurance. This, of course, could be a statistical fluke. I may be the unlucky customer in 10,000 for all I know. But, with high confidence, Cuisinart customer support rates one star for a don't-bother-us approach to troubleshooting and for failure to offer the reasonably required apology for the ruined meal that would have been cooked on the grill.In retrospect, I find that Google discloses a fair number of reviews citing the same, or a similar, malfunction. One has to wonder whether the apparent quality problem extends only to initial use or to product life. I'm not sure I want to find out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2019
CommentsContent: Heats evenly, quickly.  Cooks steaks to perfection.  Very easy to remove and clean the Non-Stick plates for cleaning, with a little hot water, and soap, plates look like new again, ready for next use.  Would recommend for anyone that wants to grill on your counter instead of outside with the bugs!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this thing in spite of all the bad reviews I read, because Cuisinart has always been a good brand for me, and it was on sale at a righteous price.  Well, guess what?  The bad reviews are WRONG.  This panini press heats up promptly, has NO  trouble maintaining temperature, is EASY to operate, and clean-up is a breeze!  I'm very pleased with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2016
CommentsContent: LOVE this unit. Shopped for many others, owned a few George Forman's. This is easy to clean, easy to use, and consistently cooks well on a counter surface. The two different surfaces that come with it are great for different foods. We make everything from Paninis, Grilled sandwiches, pancakes, fajitas, quesadillas, toasted burritos, pizza, french toast, etc. We absolutely love it. It's our second unit. We used the other one SO much that it started to look and act like a piece of heavily used restaraunt gear. It was just time to replace it. Nothing was particularly wrong...it had just been over used by high school and college students ( friends of the kids at night and on weekends ) as well as a busy family. Would recommend to anyone -

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I can't say enough about this electric grill. There are three of us , cooks plenty of food for us. If you have a bigger family, I would get the bigger size. This grill/griddle cooks evenly and fast once heated properly. Food taste very good. We cook marinated filet mignon, Chicken, pork chops and grilled veggies . Everything comes out great!Easy clean up. Plates pop right out and drip tray catches the mess for easy clean up. I absolutely recommended this grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I know most people have more gadgets than they need for kitchen but I am SO HAPPY I made the investment with this Griddler.  I sware I use it daily.  Whether I am cooking hashbrowns (to perfection mind you), or smashing some veggies for a quick side dish to dinner.  I even reheated a rice and bean burrito.  And the clean up is a BREEZE.  LOVE IT

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2019
CommentsContent: All I was really looking for was a grill with removable plates for easy cleaning. I got that and more. It’s a breakfast griddle too and I went ahead and bought the accessory waffle plates. Looking forward to getting a lot of use out of my “Griddler.”I like it so much I eventually bought a Cuisinart toaster oven/air fryer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: I used this to make Cuban sandwiches and they were great.  My daughter uses it more than me now and says she is taking it with her when she goes to college.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2011
CommentsContent: I wanted this product for all purposes that it claimed (grill, panini press, and griddle.) The product did not even heat up proper temperature when I tried to use it for making my pancakes, which was my first use. The first batch cooked okay, but the temperature did not maintain desirable temperature. It went up and down. I could tell by the look of pancakes some area cook much faster than the other area of the surfaces. At this point, I was still hopeful that it could work for me, as long as it heats up. However, when I poured out my pancake batter for the second batch, it did not heat up for nothing! So I turned up to the highest temperature and waited for about 10 minutes and the pancakes were starting to dry out rather than cooking (like bubbles start show on the top). I wanted to know how warm the surface of the griddle; I decided to touch it with my finger. It was merely warm I could touch it without burning my finger! Needless to say that I returned the item the very next day. I think products of Cuisinart are not quality anymore. I had a similar experience with their bread machine, which was a junk just like this one. They make beautiful design but that is all, they were just expensive without quality. (Actually, both products from Cuisinart that I bought did not even function for me) I can honestly say that I will never purchase another Cuisinart product! I do not recommend this for anybody.

CommentsTitle: How great this product is for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2018
CommentsContent: Unbelievable, I read many reviews about folks that were tired of there George Forman grill. What honestly caught my eye was the drip pan on this verses the old style messy on on the George Forman grill so I was sold, to be completely honest this has so much more than that reversible plates easy cleaning and absolute true temperature settings. Do yourself buy this “WOW”

CommentsTitle: A comparison of foods w/ other methods of preparing
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2011
CommentsContent: I was pleased with the size of the unit which is big enough for aobut 4 hamburgers or grilled cheese sandwiches and yet small enough to keep on the counter full time.  Food cooks quickly enough that I can still get dinner for my family of 6 on without it getting cold doing it in two stages.So far I have prepared:  grilled pineapple (better than on outdoor grill - juicy);  grilled (pressed) mushrooms, onions and red peppers - (much easier than outdoors and healthier than stovetop frying);  quesidillas - same time & taste but more consistent results than frying pan  panini - nice - can't compare to a frying pan or any other technique as there really isn't one for paninis;  grilled (pressed) boneless chicken - very fast, quick way to cook compared to frying pan or oven.  stayed moist.  need to use more sauce or flavoring to keep from getting bland with the fat running off.  belgian waffles- with accessory - much quicker than my regular waffle iron and fabulousOnly downside is planning my menu.  I get to the point where I want to do everything with it for a meal but can't do to the cooldown and cleanup factor.  For example, I was planning a meal with grilled pineapple, salmon, rice and sauteed veggies.  I would have been able and interested in making everything but the rice on it but iddn't want my pineapple to taste like salmon or my salmon to have the pineapple goo all over it.  Ended up doing the salmon in the oven, the mushrooms on the grill press, then carefully wiping down with paper towel and doing the pineapple on the grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2017
CommentsContent: We've had this for two years and love it. It is very versatile and operates as described. It has a plate on the bottom and one on the top. One side of the plates is smooth and the other is scored. The scored side is great for cooking meat that tends to dry out during cooking. Smooth side is  fantastic for grilled sandwiches. Super easy to clean. The non-stick plates just snap in and out and will fit in the sink. When cooking steak or hamburger it emits a little smoke for the first few minutes. We solved that by sitting it on the stove and turning on the exhaust fan. Particularly good for family of two.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2014
CommentsContent: I have a restaurant and have used 6 different brands of Panini grills in the last twelve years. This little Cuisinart unit stands up to the very expensive commercial brands, especially for the price. None of the other consumer brands of Panini grills got hot enough to do the job efficiently, especially Breville and George Foreman brand. I bought this unit as a backup in case the first one wears out. We use it 8 hours a day seven days a week and it's been going strong for more than two years. I do not use the unit as an open grill, we use it closed, to grill sandwiches and to toast bread and bagels.04/2016 update: I recently tried the Hamilton Beach $25 panini grill out of curiosity and was very disappointed because it takes 4 times longer to heat up a sandwich, about 5 minutes which is way too long for my needs. If you're serving more than two people you will not like waiting so long. I use panini grills for my restaurant and so far nothing compares with the value of the Cuisinart Griddler. I've had $600 commercial grills that did not perform better than this unit. We still use them 8 hours a day, seven days a week and I usually get about 18 to 24 months usage from this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2015
CommentsContent: I absolutely *love* this machine! I've cooked so many things with this, I use it almost every day. I love it for breakfast items because the lip on the plate is short so it's easy to get a spatula in to flip pancakes or French Toast, and I love the grill plates for cooking chicken. I make my own bread and use this machine to make the BEST panini sandwiches; they come out perfectly pressed, deliciously crisp, and with perfectly melted cheese. I love that the plates are reversible so there's less to store and them being dishwasher safe is a huge plus, especially in the mornings when time is short. I purchased the waffle plates and those are amazing as well, definitely recommend them as an additional purchase. The top of the unit does get very hot while you're cooking so use caution, especially if you're cooking with little ones around. I usually place a pot holder on the top of it so if I don't accidentally burn myself. One of the best purchases I've made in a while!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2013
CommentsContent: I have been using the griddler since I got it many months ago, about 11 months ago.  It works great but we have these strange white spots show up on the flat side.  We baby those griddle plates when cleaning them.  Hand washed then only for the first couple months, but those white spots appear.  I now put them in the dishwasher and I get less white spots, weird.  The strangest thing if you soak the plates in hot water and soap, after awhile when you pull them out of the water those white spots appear even more with a vengeance.  I noticed that under those white spots the surface is not smooth anymore.  I bet it is the hardness/acidity in the water causing the issues.  I just sent an email to Cuisinart to see what they think.  I still love to use it but would like to know what those white spots are.  The food doesn't stick and I use the other side the most anyway.The white spots are due to the hardness of my water.  Cuisinart replaced the griddle plates. Since my water is so hard I do not let them soak in water, just wash and dry them right away.  I have had the replaced griddle plates for a couple months and no spots.I would definite recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2013
CommentsContent: I am very satisfied with the purchase of this Cuisinart product. I think I actually dreamt about the interchangeable plates! Not sure what I dreamt out those. I do fear dropping them and having them break! so.. could be that's what prompted the nighttime thoughts! I got a good price at Amazon. Like 30. less than the local factory outlet store that had one. So I did get to see what I was buying before I made the purchase. I had it shipped free and ground and it seemed like Fed Ex really took their time getting it here. Amazon predicted it would arrive before Fed Ex did and the post office delivered it the day before Fed Ex predicted it would arrive. It finally arrived and in great shape.. not a dent in any boxes it was properly packaged in and it now proudly sits in the countertop and IS in use every day, sometimes several times per day. I'm loving the food that I'm grilling with it.. and my pancakes came out beautifully on the griddle as well.. burgers are a bit slow to cook on medium so you don't make the counter messy but after being cooked you can shut the lid and put some nice grill marks on the top. Our first meal cooked on it were thin boneless pork chops and they came out excellent. I'm really happy with this grill. I have a George Foreman grill.. Large, Super Large Outdoor Electric Grill, and a small size Foreman grill and there isn't much comparison.. hands down this does what I expected and I would buy it again. Grilled onions and grilled mushrooms and asparagus are amazing! Yum!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2015
CommentsContent: Wow, I love this griddle. It's compact, and so far I've made burgers, french toast, panini sandwiches, and waffles - it's great for everything! It heats up very quickly. Other reviews mentioned that it doesn't get hot enough, but I definitely did not experience this issue. It heated up in a matter of minutes and the burgers baked fine. The grease wasn't a huge issue. I grilled 10 burgers, and by the end the grease tray had filled up and splashed onto the counter a bit - but I thought that was very reasonable for grilling 10 burgers in a row. It's easily detachable and cleaned, and I didn't have a problem with the grease draining. The Griddler is also very easy to clean! After it cools down, the plates are easily popped out and washed or put in the dishwasher. Overall a fantastic appliance that's easy to take care of and very versatile! I'm a college student and I definitely recommend this to others who want a variety of food but don't have a ton of space.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2019
CommentsContent: This was a gift for my boyfriend last Christmas. He uses it habitually for his sandwiches and says its his favorite gift ever lol <3 Great for that man in your life that doesn't "cook" but you still want them to eat healthy and make their own meals instead of eating frozen pizza! Lol I will be buying the other versions as he is obsessed with this. :) He says it works great and is easy to clean and easy to use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2019
CommentsContent: It is almost three months. I did a search before to make sure I choose the right one. Not much budget. I super like it! Easy to use and clean.  I bought wagyu to barbecue! Easy to switch the iron plate. Check the photo, super perfect for use at home. Barbecue mushroom is my favorite ! Juicy!

CommentsTitle: Clean easily but heat up slowly
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Product arrived on time and well packaged. I generally enjoyed using it since it is very easy to clean and maintain. The results (i.e.: my paninis) were generally successful. However, it does take some time to heat up and some spots heated up much faster/higher than other spots (therefore, constant attention is needed).

CommentsTitle: Cooks evenly and clean ups a breeze.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Absolutely love this griddler. I’ve used it almost daily since I’ve received it. Breakfast/lunch and dinner. Even a few snacks in between. It cooks so fast and cleans up so easy it’s my go to every time my stomach grumbles now.  There are also waffle plates that fit this perfectly but those you have to purchase separately, which I did. I just love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2011
CommentsContent: I just bought this from Amazon and tonight I grilled Elk burgers in it.  They turned out great.  The plates are easy to take out and replace.  (One side of each plate is a flat surface and the other is a grill surface.) It heated up quickly.  The cleaning up part was the best.  When the plates were somewhat cooled, I put a damp paper towel in between them. Once the unit was fully cooled (I waited 30 minutes), I wiped the surfaces and then removed the plates and put them in soapy water.  Using a dish cloth, I was easily able to remove anything still on them.  I like this so much better than the George Foreman grill that I had, which did not have removable plates.  The Cuisinart is also pretty on my counter top.  I have absolutely no buyer's remorse.  I bought the unit for about $89 on Amazon.  It appears so far to be well worth it.  It also comes with a 3-year limited warranty, and I easily registered the until on the Cuisinart website.  (But you don't have to register it, it says, to have the warranty.)  So far, so good!  Tomorrow I'm making more Elk burgers!  (One thing I learned is that I don't have even countertops.  I have tiled countertops, and so all four pedals of the unit did not rest evenly on the counter.  So the grease did not go into the grease catcher properly.  This is not the unit's fault.  I moved it around until I found an even surface and tomorrow I'll try it like that.  If it doesn't drain grease well I'll edit my remarks.)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this thing!  Food cooks fast and great!  The removable plates are great and simple for clean up!  Two things I had problem with were when making hamburgers, small burgers will get flattened. You have to make them big and thick.  Also the manual suggests using the seer setting for burgers. In my opinion, Seer is way too hot and "overdid" my burgers on top of setting off my smoke alarms in the house with all the smoke.  I will NOT use the seer setting again. ever. Don't forget to purchase the waffle plates if you like waffles - they are well worth it.  This appliance replaces my waffle maker and my George Foreman grill.

CommentsTitle: The worst product I have ever bought!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I was so excited to get the Griddler.  I spent time reading all the reviews and thought it was a great addition to my kitchen.  I used this product a total of 7 times for pancakes and once for grilled cheese sandwiches.  It stopped heating during the time I was making pancakes.  It never got hot again!  I thought Cuisinart was a reliable product.  I am very disappointed in this product.  During a pandemic, I spent $59.00 for a griddle.  What a rip-off!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2017
CommentsContent: Have only used this 3 times since it arrived...grilled pork chops, & hamburgers. Both browned well when top was lowered. Have to be careful not to overcook.
