Grilled cheese & tomato sandwiches oozed cheese onto the griddle...maybe less cheese and/or keeping the cover open would help.All in all, the grill performed as advertised, but be sure to read the instructions before using. Cleanup is a bit messy, but the removable grids make it easy, and food does not stick. Generally I am pleased with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Very disappointed in quality of the product...I never used the griddle, all in all to carry the cusinart name very poor quality as you would expect from CUSINART

CommentsTitle: This is exactly what I was looking for if only it worked like it was supposed to.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021
CommentsContent: The heat distribution can be a little uneven, my griddle plates fall out sometimes when using it as a waffle iron or grill because one of the latches doesnt seem to clamp correctly. It is easy to clean and store but I mostly use it as a pancake griddle since the upper plates moves quite a bit while in use.

CommentsTitle: 5 star in theory, but quality poor
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2013
CommentsContent: One item I had decided was a "must have" for the new kitchen, when the time came to replace my old countertop appliances was this grill/griddle combo... If only it had lived up to my expectations! I purchased it in January, and just used it for the first time 2 weeks ago,and again this week, both times as a grill. As far as cooking performance is concerned I am pleased. The cooking plates, and ease of cleanliness however are another story. The items I cooked were very low in fat, and in fact the removable drip pan has never even seen a drop of fat/grease, but you would not know it from the appearance of the grill plates. No matter how often I wash them, how hot the water, or how much Dawn dish detergent I use, they appear clean until they dry, and then they are covered with what appears to be dots of solidified whitish fat. Also, straight out of the box, the griddle plates had a random "snagged" feeling to the surface of both plates... Kind of like the old teflon coated pans would get if you used the wrong utensils. I suspect this is a second quality appliance being sold as first quality. Very disappointed, and certainly not worth the money I paid for itUPDATE: I did contact Amazon about the issues I mentioned in this review, and they replaced the appliance and the second one I received did not have the "snagged" texture on the griddle/grill plates.Unfortunately, It does still require multiple washings to remove the hazy grease marks on the cook plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I’m enjoying this griddle. I have had several different types of these griddles. This one is my favorite because you can lay out full strips of bacon without cutting them to fit. Also this griddle will fully open without the handle hitting my upper cabinet. No more turning sideways or pulling to very edge. The cooking surface seems to be evenly distributed, no hot spot found. The only thing I would change is the drip tray. It works great but you cannot see if it is getting to full without pulling it out. Small learning curve to judge when it is full! All in all very happy and I wold purchase again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2012
CommentsContent: I simply love this product. I've been using a George Foreman grill for a couple of years. It's an okay product except when it comes to cleaning it. THAT'S where the Griddler really beats it, hands down. With the Griddler, you simply press the two side "buttons," located on either side, and the plates pop out for easy cleaning either in the dishwasher or by hand.Plus, you can flip the Griddler's plates making it easy to prepare eggs, pancakes, etc. You can also use a grill plate and a griddle plate simultaneously, enabling you to prepare eggs, bacon, and pancakes at the same time: The unit easily opens flat.Using both griddle plates, you can prepare grilled sandwiches, thanks to the hinged top. Bring on the panini sandwiches!The Griddler heats quickly and evenly and the knobs light up when the temperature you've set is reached. You can even SEAR your meats with this appliance.The grease catcher is large and nicely located in the side of the appliance, but is easily removed for cleaning.And if that's not enough, you can also buy Belgian waffle plates for this appliance!BOTTOM LINE: You can't possibly miss with this appliance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2021
CommentsContent: I love this appliance and use it all the time.  This was a replacement for an old one that, stopped heating. I couldn’t wait for the new one to arrive.  There were a few upgrades, but I was basically the same.  So easy to clean! I just. Stick it in the dishpan and wipe it with a cloth.  At my old house I would just pop it in the dishwasher.p

CommentsTitle: This was bought as a Christmas gift
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2020
CommentsContent: My daughter loves it and has used it a couple of times already. She says it's the same one they used at work. She be very happy....so am I

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2017
CommentsContent: The best part about this machine is how easy it is to clean. It does a good job with. We use it often. Would have got 5 stars if the top grill got as hot as the bottom one. Not sure why it doesn't. When it is open all the way to grill on the top lid is suppose to stay flat. Mine does not. It's only a slight angle so it's not a big deal, but if it did stay flat and the top grill got as hot as the bottom that would be a great improvement. Still I'm considering buying a second one to make mealtime easier. With a large family only cooking 4 pancakes at a time is a bit too slow.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2013
CommentsContent: I got this hoping it would be good for cooking pancakes and burgers. While I loved it at first, the first time I tried to cook burgers on it, that love started to fade. I set it on sear, waiting for it to heat up (many minutes), put the burgers on, and the sizzling sound you would think would happen, was not there. I ended up stop using the grill settings and just did the griddle setting.While there was a work around for heating, the pan was never as hot as I would have liked. Pancakes took longer then they should have while still on the same temp I have cooked them on another electric griddle. And since there was no latch to keep the press closed, moving it off and on the counter to save space was a clumsy chore.A year later, one of the feet in the back have broken off because it isn't metal. The clasps that hold the plates on are not working withe buttons, and I now have to pull them open or push them close. It is still usable, but with all the fighting I have had with this item, it is going in the trash. I am really surprised at how much this item falls short of the normal quality of Cuisinart, and I was so excited to have it. But now, I will will just start using my cast iron stovetop grill/griddle combo, which is still a chore to move around, but at least I know it falling apart is not going to happen, and I know it will get hot.

CommentsTitle: Grills to perfection. Easy to clean.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2018
CommentsContent: This is the first indoor grill I have ever used. I wish I had bought one years ago! Absolutely love this grill! I use it at least 5 days a week. Easy to clean. I love that the trays easily pop out for cleaning. Top tray seems to be a bit hotter than bottom when using it in closed position, which is opposite of many of the reviews I read prior to purchasing. However it hasn't been an issue, I mostly grill chicken and the top seems a bit more seared than the bottom, but cooked perfect every time. My only regret is that I didn't buy this sooner. I absolutely love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2011
CommentsContent: This is the third panini-type grill I've owned. This is so far superior to the others (Waring and Sharper Image) it's unbelievable. The plates are easy to get in and out, and the non-stick finish has stayed brand-new looking after weeks and weeks of heavy use. The temperature gets hot enough to truly sear a steak (we used to joke that the S.I. grill "boiled" the steak). In fact, the Cuisinart has a "Sear" setting on the dial. It's also quite compact, which fits nicely onto my counter as I lack storage space. Highly recommend this product!5 MONTHS LATER...This is hands-down the best grill I've ever owned or even seen at someone else's house! The non-stick surface is fantastic! I use it at least 3x a week, sometimes 5 or 6 times, and there is not a single scratch or a single bit of residue on the grill surfaces. They look as new as the day I got them. Also, the grill plates are so much lighter than my previous grill, and the reversible feature (plus top/bottom interchangeable) makes them just perfect. On the grill settings, the SEAR function is awesome, use it all the time and it still heats like it did on Day 1. Filets get seared on the outside (with real grill marks) and are still warmish-red in the center. I have no affiliation with Cuisinart, but seriously if they want an enthusiastic testimonial, they need to call me! I love this thing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: First time we used it resulted in great paninis. And they get better every time as we get practice with timing and heat settings. Have not used it as a flat griddle yet, but can see where  it would work great in that application. Our previous panini press did NOT have detachable plates, which made cleaning a long and tough chore. Took the fun out of the paninis, and we found we used it less frequently. These detachable plates are non-stick which makes cleaning much easier and faster. Can only fit 2 paninis on the griddle at one time so may not be practical for large families. But we love it!

CommentsTitle: Doesn’t brown as much as I like
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2019
CommentsContent: In my tight space I wanted something versatile and upon reading many reviews online I purchased this griddler.  Cleaning is easy enough, cooking plates have a weight to them.  I find I don’t get the “grill” marks on the pork or chicken though and I have to cook them more to get done.  Lots of moisture released as they cook and not brown.  Pancakes cook well.  Am I totally happy with purchase?  half and half.

CommentsTitle: These are awesome with a hitch...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2019
CommentsContent: 4.5 stars  I've had two of these. The first survived about 10 meals before one of the heating elements went out. However, after using it for paninis, quesadillas, grilled cheese, waffles, eggs, pancakes, and every type of meat there is, we bought another while waiting for Cuisinart to honor the warranty. (We had to pay for shipping.) This past Christmas, we bought one for every household in the family. George Foreman, who??  (Side note: don't try to do scrambled eggs and make sure the griddle is hot before you do crack a "fried" egg on it. Otherwise, the liquid will just run to the drain. The flat griddle is slow to heat and takes longer to get your pancakes "golden". Waffles take about 4 minutes. )

CommentsTitle: Great Cooking Appliance while it worked
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2013
CommentsContent: We've had our Griddler now for a while and it's seen a lot of use.  We've used it mostly for paninni sandwiches and it works great for that.  We've used it flat for pancakes and a few other things and it worked just as well for those.  If your paninni's are real thick the 2 grilling surfaces might not be line up parallel to each other, but I wouldn't take away from it's rating for that.  You just need to know it's limitations.  The non stick surface on the flat side and grill side of the plates is exceptional.  Cleans up super easy with just water.  For flat grilling duty, some folks might be better suited to a full size griddle as this one limits you somewhat with 2 smaller griddles instead of a single larger one.  Would I buy another one?  In a heartbeat, but hopefully this one holds up for many years and I won't need to.I have to add a little to my initial review.  We've had our griddler since January, so right at the 6 month mark.  It has died and does not function any longer.  Six months it lasted!?  Really!!  I won't buy another one!

CommentsTitle: Has griddle and a panini switch
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020
CommentsContent: So easy to clean, takes a little to heat up but that time is spent assembling sandwiches. No problemsWe love this and it’s not overwhelming large for countertop. Fits two nice size sandwiches at a time

CommentsTitle: Broke in only 38 days of using it.  Warranty is worthless
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2012
CommentsContent: I purchased this unit from Amazon and received it on 10/23/12.  On 12/1/12 one of the plastic tabs that hold the top grill plate on the unit broke and would not hold the top plate to the unit anymore. We were only using the unit once or twice a week and were not hard on it.  When you took out the screws and opened the unit up there is a pin that levers the plastic arm to release the plates for cleaning and the plastic broke from around this pin and there is no way to fix it.  Amazon would only let you return the unit to them until 11/23/12.  So I had to contact the manufacturer about the product which is Cuisinart/Conair Corp since the unit has a 1 year warranty on it.  I contacted them and first of all they are not responsive and took a few  days to respond each time I contacted them.  They will send you out a new unit but they want you to pay for the shipping of the defective unit back and the $10 they spent shipping the new unit to you.  Their warranty doesn't cover shipping costs even when their product is defective and you can't find the warranty info before hand to know this.  I got them to waive the $10 fee shipping the new unit to me but they are still making me pay the shipping back which is $10!  I really had no choice since I would be out $90 to go get another unit.  Also they obviously know they are selling defective parts on the market!  The new one I just received has the plastic tab that broke and hold the plates replaced with metal ones!  Also they changed the grilling plates in my new unit too to drain better!  If this company was a respectable company they would have pulled off all these defective units off of the market or at least take care of a customer when selling defective units. Its obvious they are at fault and should not charge for shipping either way and provided a prepaid return shipping label in the box with the new unit!

CommentsTitle: Awesome Love it would recommend all day long!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2018
CommentsContent: We love this!!! Fast grilled cheese, great breakfast croissant, perfect pancakes, nice grilled chicken, fast kabobs and very easy clean up. For the price IT ROCKS!!!!!!!! I do wish it came with waffle plates but I see I can add them oxoxCon: It is a bit bulky, the outside gets so hot you will burn the $*#t out of your hand and it sits flat like pictured...my old one stood up like a suitcase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Great product. Especially good for cooking bacon on one side and eggs on the other. Great for just about everything. Especially good for places you don't have a stove just a microwave. You can cook just about any thing. I also bought the waffle plates. I would recommend this to anyone.

CommentsTitle: An excellent versatile unit for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my second Griddler. I love the unit and it is a staple in my kitchen. I primarily use it as a panini press and it does an excellent job. The plates come off easily and are dishwasher safe. It is a durable and well made and you will get years of use from it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I love love love this griddler, temperature is good bottom gets hotter than the top but you can always flip the sandwich or whatever your cooking, when you make something that’s not a sandwich. the oil catcher is very convenient , hasn’t spilled or anything like other reviewers say, most definitely easy clean up. Heats up fast. Basically the best griddler I own so far. Let’s so how long it’s good for.

CommentsTitle: Wow! what a Griddler, it's so well thought out, easy cooking, easy cleanup and you server food like professional
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2016
CommentsContent: Wow! Wow! And I love it, my wife loves it, and my family completely enjoys it.It makes me cook like a professional from steaks to burgers, to Panini to enchiladas and with theAccessory Waffle Plates, Pancakes to Waffles are all a breeze.It opens up and becomes a full open grill or snaps into place for grilling panini bread sandwiches with a perfection of crunch and munch.You get what you pay for this item, it's so easy to cook and clean and the grease collection plates make messes a thing of the past.I would recommend to anyone looking for a great all around Griddler and waffle and pancake maker.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2011
CommentsContent: I have two George Foreman grills that I like, but they aren't easy to clean.  I've been looking at stand-alone griddles, or griddle pans to supplement my limited cooking surfaces (I have a 24" stove/oven).  I looked at the video review for the Griddler and was pretty intrigued.  Grilling, panini-ing and flat surfaces, this seemed pretty versatile and easy to use.  Plus, much easier to clean than my Foreman grills since the plates are dishwasher-safe.I didn't even read the enclosed directions for the Griddler, its form and function are very intuitive.  I used it for the first time today to make a grilled cheese sandwich.  Yes, I'm so lazy I didn't want to make it on the stove and have to flip the sandwich over.  It was outstanding -- pepper jack cheese, bacon and jalapeno slices -- and the clean-up was simple.  The cheese had bubbled out of the sandwich onto the plates and it wiped up easily.  I probably won't put the plates in the dishwasher, but the fact that they're removable will make them easier to clean than my Foreman grill.  I can wash them in the sink and they dry quickly and easily.I have some slider hamburger patties that I will also try on the Griddler but based on this afternoon's results I expect to be quite pleased with the outcome.  Given the versatility and functionality of the Griddler, I suspect my Foreman grills will find their way to Goodwill very soon.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2020
CommentsContent: This product works great, but it is very unsafe. The power cords, is located behind the grill on the left. No matter how you cook, if there is more than on piece on the grill, the juices and grease run down the grill and get onto the power cord. So unsafe and bad design! Also, I notice how the plug gets so hot during use. It is made cheaply

CommentsTitle: Great deal and well made product.  Overall I'm very impressed.  Now I can't stop making paninis...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2014
CommentsContent: Some things are better left simple, and this is the prime example.  This griddler couldn't be easier to use.  The design is pretty much flawless.  The griddle/grill plates can be removed super easily and they are non-stick so they clean right up.  The heat adjustment is quick to master and the grills heat up very fast.  We were making paninis in no time when I removed this from the box.  Now I'm hooked on using it.  The only complaint that I have is that the top of the grill should be easier to unlock so it "floats".  There's a peg that holds it in place and there should be a way to press a button to release it.  You have to push the griddle top to keep it flat when closing on a sandwich and that's not easy when the grill is super-hot.  Overall I can't not recommend this. I'd buy this again in a second - it probably costs less than 1-2 nights out at a restaurant.  It's also nice and small and easy to store.

CommentsTitle: Poor Quality and not worth the money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I received this product on March 14th.  I was able to use it 3 times without any problems.  The 4th time it wouldn't stay hot long enough to grill the food.  I was trying to cook chicken breast and it wouldn't even sear them.  I tried it again over this past weekend with the same results.  I only had 30 days to return the item but of course it didn't start malfunctioning until after that time period had passed.  This is the worst purchase I've ever made on Amazon.  I'm now looking for another indoor grill but will NOT be buying another Cuisinart!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: The temperature around the edges of both pieces is much lower than the center. In addition, the top piece is at a much lower temperature than the main piece. The drip tray in between the pieces is only a small semi-circle in the middle so grease still got everywhere when we used it. Seriously disappointed in this product.

CommentsTitle: This is the product you want!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2015
CommentsContent: This product is fantastic.  I did some research and requested this as a wedding present.  I have seen different panini makers on peoples wedding registry's since and have liked this so much that I have called my friends and suggested they take their panini maker off their list and add this instead.  By purchasing the waffle plates you add even more versatility to this awesome machine and save having one other appliance.  I have had mine for 4 years now and still love it.  We use this the most to make pancakes and french toast but I also use it a lot to panini.  I have used the waffle plates several times with great results and have cooked burgers on it as well.  Don't make a mistake and get a different product.  This is what you want.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2017
CommentsContent: I have been wanting an indoor grill for quite awhile and did a lot of research before my purchase.  I have not been disappointed!  It is wonderful.  My husband and I enjoy our steaks done medium with a pink center and my outdoor grilling skills are awful!  With my Cuisinart Grill I get it right every time.  I love the ability to use both plates for fixing different breakfast items.  The grill is easy to clean, the plates snap in and out easily for cleaning and do well in the dishwasher.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2012
CommentsContent: I've had the Griddler for about six months now, and I use it regularly. I mainly had wanted a panini press, but figured the other functions could come in handy. I have a gas stove, and well, let's just say about now when it gets to be 90, I really don't want to use it. I also live in an apartment, so all I really have is communal access to a grill, and I'm not particularly ever in the mood to go down to it and cook for myself.For paninis, this is absolutely marvelous. Here's a hint though to make cleanup very easy: wrap your sandwich in parchment paper before putting it on the press. Within 5-7 minutes, you have a toasted sandwich, and you don't have to clean up melted cheese from the plates. I typically don't use the grill sides of the plates for sandwiches, but when I have with this method it hasn't been a problem...still get the lines even though they add nothing for me.I've found also it is very useful for cooking up a steak. Even a $3 steak tastes amazing after a couple minutes on the griddler. It creates far less smoke than my normal cast iron pan method, which is a serious bonus. Chicken breasts cook in an insanely short amount of time if you use the closed grill method. And it is actually like they have been grilled.The time it takes to heat up has never been a problem. I start heating it up before I get to work prepping, so while I'm still in the midst of sandwich building, the griddler will be heated. Definitely might be a good idea to give it a bit of extra time. I've never had a problem where the food seemed more like it had been steamed.Only dislikes really are the size...as in, there is no way I can really lay this open to cook on both sides of it. I'm also just one person, so I'm not cooking for a family. It just doesn't seem stable on that upper griddle either if I can find a way to spread it out across a countertop. After trying to cook green pepper slices on it once, I gave up on it altogether since they would just slide towards the end. But for one plate or in a closed position, which makes up 99% of my use anyway, it's perfect for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this griddler mostly to use an inside grill for chicken, steaks, shrimp, etc.  I like grilled food but the outside grill is just too much work and mess for one person.  The first time I used this I made homemade Naan bread.  It sat on the open grill plates for over 20 minutes on HIGH and barely got cooked.  I ended up transferring it to a grill pan on the stove which worked just fine.  Perhaps mine was defective, bu this guy is going back.....

CommentsTitle: Grill does not efficiently drain grease.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2014
CommentsContent: After reading lots of reviews and comparing this grill to others in this genre I made the decision to purchase this product.  As usual Amazon was prompt and efficient with delivery.  The grill seems to be well built and I do like the reversible and removable grill surfaces for variety and easy clean up.  The controls are a bit ambiguous but can be figured out with usage.  The reason for the two stars is what I consider to be a serious flaw.  The grill has a very small slit in the back for the drainage of fluids and grease from the grill. The Grill is level or even slightly sloped to the front.  This results in the pooling of grease in the grill; tilting the grill back helps but the slit is so small that it easily flows over onto the counter surface behind the grill.  A big reason for using this type of grill is to lessen the amount of grease that remains on the food.  If this is a prime consideration for you do not buy this grill.  Otherwise it is a decent product.

CommentsTitle: Easy for for whole family to make Paninis!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2014
CommentsContent: We love grilled sandwiches and up until we bought this unit, we toasted them in the toaster, then nuked them in the microwave.  That works but not always a great look afterwards.  I buy very few appliances since I generally find they collect dust after a very short time.  This unit isn't finding its way off the countertop any time soon. Everyone from our teenagers to us adults love making paninis with this.  It is so easy to use, just turn a button, set the heat level and wait for the light to go green and you are set. The result is lovely heated/melted inside of sandwiches and nice crisp exterior - so nice with soup, for after school snack or a weekend lunch. The non-stick plates are super easy to clean and dishwasher safe.  My teens have found this unit is great for heating and toasting burritos and other snacks.We might eventually buy the waffle plates since we love waffles but right now, we are just thrilled with the sandwich feature.  To each his own!!We bought this on sale and have no complaints at all, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for the features, the even heating, the ease of usage and cleaning and its nice compact size which prevents it from being a counter top space hog.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2018
CommentsContent: As a single woman living on her own, this is literally the most perfect product. I grill chicken on it almost every night (perfect size for one or two portions)- Not only does it heat up fast, but the food is cooked in less than 10 minutes. My favorite part though has to be how easy it is to clean. Once you let it cool down, scrap off the excess junk and wash with a sponge. I believe you can put it in the dishwasher as well if you wanted to. I have had it for about 3 months and not a problem yet.I highly suggest this product if you are cooking for 2 or less people.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2016
CommentsContent: My wife's grandmother used to have a waffle iron that had swap-out plates and could also be laid flat like a griddle.  My wife used to talk about how great it was then bemoan the fact that nothing like it was available now.  So when I saw this griddle for sale, I decided to give it a try, even though it cost more than other products that don't have removable plates.I am so glad I did.  This thing is so great that since I bought one for us three years ago, I have bought two more to give as gifts and this is now my go-to housewarming gift.We use it for:-bacon (closing the griddler on the bacon makes sure it cooks flat instead of curling up)-hamburgers-quesadillas-steaks-bratwurst-breakfast potatoes (when opened like a griddle)-pancakes-waffles (with the waffle plates, which are sold separately)-etc.It is on our counter all the time and gets used 2-5 times per week.  The controls are easy to understand, the removable drip-tray is easy to clean, and the ability to pop the grill plates out and put them in the dishwasher means this is even less work than cooking with a pan on the stove.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2019
CommentsContent: We like making sandwiches on here and have also used it to grill veggies when it is rains on our patio plans. We got the waffle inserts as well, making it more versatile.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2019
CommentsContent: Loving the Cuisinart Griddler 5-in-1 for making gourmet grilled cheese.  It's rather small for pancakes if you're making them for more than 1 person though.  I do wish that I didn't have to purchase the waffle plates for an additional $25.  For that price, they could have included them.  I can see us getting a lot of use from this for burgers, sandwiches, and more.  The plates are easy to clean and a lot easier to use than other countertop grill products.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2014
CommentsContent: Had a few older Foreman grills and loved them but it was time for a new grill due to the Foreman grills just being old and finally wearing out after years of reliable service. I was looking for specific features, size and styling since it sits on a counter top all the time. It was the customer reviews on Amazon and a few professional sites that I trust that made me give this grill a try.It has now been a few months and while that is not long enough to say anything about reliability and longevity I can certainly say this thing is fantastic. I love the versatility. It seems to heat up very fast which saves everyone time. Very easy to clean due to the what I think is innovative drip system. The only thing I don't like about it and this is nitpicking...The handle acts as a leg when fully open which is great but I think when its closed it needs one more layer of folding so it doesn't stick up so much.I would recommend this grill to anyone, at least try it out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2012
CommentsContent: I bought this grill about a month ago and I couldn't be happier. I wanted to wait some time to be able to give a good review.Cooking -Very easy to use and figure out the controls. Can fit two whole chicken breast on the grill no problem and the top adjusts so that your food cooks evenly. I did notice that if you cook frozen food the water coming off the food pools. I haven't had any over flowing to date. When cooking greasy food though, drains into the bottom catch no problem. Weird, I know...Cleaning -Two words; SO SIMPLY. Just take the plates out and put them in the dishwasher. Problem solved.Tool -Junk. Only down side to the grill. It comes with a little plastic spatula/scraper that lasted three days before my roommate melted it by trying to clean the plates off when it was a tad to hot. This could be user error (I'm sure), but it's not a big loss.Wear-ability -I do think it's to early to tell on this one, but so far so good. There hasn't been any loss of the surface(non stick coating) or scratches. I have three roommates, that's a big deal. I have read that some people had problems with the plastic clips melting, but that hasn't happened to me. They are in great shape so far.Overall, really happy. All my roommates want one. Would recommend to anyone.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2011
CommentsContent: I have to say I have wanted this little baby from the moment I viewed the commercial.  I have a Foreman grill and I liked it but I wanted something that could do more than just grill and did not take up a lot of counter space.  Enter the Griddler.  I have to say the price at Amazon was cheaper then anywhere I found it in PA and that was counting the Black Friday deals.  Back to the grill.  I have cooked breakfast on it for the past week, the time it has saved me in the am is worth the cost. I would advise it heats faster if you leave it closed then open it flat when the go light comes on  Clean up is a simple matter of placing a damp paper towel between the plates as it cools down lifting the lid wiping the plates and your done (someone here recommended that tip thank you).  I grilled steaks last night with onions and mushrooms perfection. Grilled sandwiches are a no brainier and now I don't have to try and figure out where I put my press! I leave it right on my counter top. Personally I like simple compact and professional this baby has it all.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2019
CommentsContent: It took me an hour and a half to make bacon and French toast on this thing

CommentsTitle: Best kitchen appliance purchase I've made in years!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2017
CommentsContent: This is a terrific kitchen appliance and we love it.  I use it for panninis, grilled cheese and quesadillas in the closed position, and I make perfect over easy eggs, french toast, and pancakes in the open position.  I sprang for the waffle plates, and it makes great waffles too!  Definitely the best kitchen purchase I've made in years, and since the plates are non-stick and removable, it's easy to keep clean.Word of caution: don't use cooking spray or "good for your heart" margarine on the non-stick plates.  Only real butter or real oil, and always hand-wash, and your plates will last a long time.

CommentsTitle: Very disappointed in the grilling issues
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2020
CommentsContent: This product looks good - the grille plates do not drain the fat off the meat at all - I used it for hamburgers and the grease went every where - The George Forman is a much better designed product - with the fat draining issue it can’t be used outside - and it doesn’t get hot enough for grilling - disappointing. - would not recommend it at all

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought the first one as a gift for my boyfriend 6 years ago. He became my husband and I had a chance to use it for about 5 years on regular basis. We love it so much that had to buy another one once the older one started not the heat the top plate. It's a great product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: Wow! Every day we think of something else to use this for. Very versatile. Stick leftovers between buttered “getting old bread/rolls/buns”.  Everything tastes and cooks great! Compact/neat looking. Buy the waffle plates and make homemade waffles.A wonderful purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2005
CommentsContent: I was looking for a reliable replacement for my Foreman contact grill that I always felt I had to go 10 rounds with in the ring to clean.  I was skeptical, but hopeful, when I saw the Cuisinart "GR-4 Griddler", and decided, despite the cost, to give it a try after reading some of the reviews.  I wanted removable grill plates, first and foremost, for ease of cleaning.  And ease of cleaning I got.  Dishwasher safe, but easy enough to clean right in the sink with a nylon bristle brush and detergent.  What a dream!Also, the hinged grill design is so inventive.  At first, it seemed like it would be hard to deal with, but it works so well because it  allows such versatility!  I've grilled vegetables like frozen hashbrowns and green beans in it and I've grilled thick Italian sausages and steaks in it. It can go from fat to thin and vice versa because of that unique hinge.I have just about every kitchen appliance imaginable.  Some I love, but use infrequently. Some I never use.  THIS ONE, I use ALL the time.  My husband can actually cook for himself and I don't dread the clean-up as I did with my previous grill.I can't imagine being disappointed with the purchase of this grill.

CommentsTitle: Have only had it a couple of months, but so far so good!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2014
CommentsContent: It works as advertised and is VERY easy clean up - just a wet paper towel immediately after cooking and then drying is all I've needed.  Have cooked paninis, hamburgers and finished cooking steak and veggies for fajitas.  The leftover steak for fajitas I had cooked to rare on a stovetop grill pan the day before and, let me tell you, that was a BEAR to clean off the grill pan.  But, when I finished cooking the leftovers to eat the next day, I put them on this Cuisinart griddler instead, and the clean-up was immediate and super easy.  HUGE difference from scrubbing for a very long time and with lots of elbow grease to just wiping off.  And, just in case anyone cares, the fajita steak mojo (marinade) I used was from Tyler Florence's fajitas recipe on FoodNetwork.com and it made the BEST steak (tri-tip) EVER.  Highly recommend that recipe for the marinade and can't wait to use it again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2010
CommentsContent: This griddler is simply amazing! It's extremely easy to use and clean afterwards. I've been using it every day since I got it 2 weeks ago.Both plates are removable (and reversible.) I clean them in my sink, by hand and have no problems.The drip tray also comes in handy. But one of the best qualities of this Cuisinart product is that there is almost no smoke coming out.So far I have used it as:1. A panini maker - it makes great sandwiches - crispy on the outside, but soft on the inside. The cheese melts nicely and doesn't burn.2. Grill - I made some chicken kebabs last week and they turned out great. The kebabs grilled evenly and didn't burn. They had the nice smokey flavor that many people like.3. I also grilled steaks. I was able to get some medium-rare AND some medium-well - as people in my family like them different ways.4. To grill burgers and Bulgarian meatballs. Again - the food turned out to be delicious.Everyone around here loves this product and I strongly recommend that you buy it too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm giving this 2 stars solely on the fact that I hate using it because it gets grease EVERYWHERE every time I cook with it. The food turns out delicious but its pointless if I don't want grease all over my countertop. It has a grease catch but its flawed and doesn't catch all the liquid.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2015
CommentsContent: I find this works very well for everything you can imagine.  Cleanup is a snap.  Just so people know...if you need to grill more than one session, you are going to get smoke build up in your kitchen if like me and others you have a vent that vents into the kitchen.  With a just a couple steaks it is no problem at all and I imagine it is the same for one session of burgers.  But I tried two sessions once and it was a bit smoky.  And contrary to one person said with regard to cook times, it does not go faster the second session.  I found steaks if they are not thin take anywhere between 5-7 minutes depending on thickness.  And you will want to keep any marinade to a minimum to avoid the smoke.  Paninis are a snap.  Trays snap in and out easily...not much more to say and it has all been said before anyway really.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2017
CommentsContent: This is a great multi-purpose grill. Panni's, vegetables, pancakes, steaks and other meats cook up great on it. Cleanup is quick with the removable plates, and a quick wipe down of the rest of the unit should take care of any splatters. The biggest "problem" I have is cooking steaks and other meats, as they cook very quickly on this grill. Less than a minute can be the difference between rare and way over done.

CommentsTitle: i use one for greasy meats / foods and save one for NONgreasy things like pancakes and waffles
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2017
CommentsContent: i have TWO of these grills.  i bought a second one for myself.  one was bought for me as a gift and then i bought another for myself.  i use one for greasy meats / foods and save one for NONgreasy things like pancakes and waffles.  ALSO bought the waffle plates.  the grease builds up so you need to have one for the non greasy foods or the pancakes are not smooth and clean.  LOVE that the plates are easy to remove and are dishwasher safe.  after time grease will really build up.  the oldest, greasy one will need to be replaced soon.  my first one was a birthday gift in summer 2012 and i have used it ALL the time and I am going to get another of the same grill to replace it so i can always have two grills.

CommentsTitle: Nice product but with some design issue.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I love the product, the only issue it's heats more towards front and a little lower towards the back. Also as there is wedge to the plates it forms a gap between the plates. This gap is bigger than the bread thickness. So if you are grilling a single bread or tortilla it does not work well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This little grille is a real upgrade from the George Foreman grille it replaced. It is used by my daughter's cooking class, and is a snap to clean and operate. Separate temperature controls for open or closed operation. Lights up when the correct temp. is reached.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2012
CommentsContent: After reading the reviews here on Amazon, we ordered Cuisinart's 5-in-1 Griddler.  We made it a 6-in-1 by ordering the Belgium Waffle plates. This appliance seems to be well made and it is the perfect size for two people. We are fulltime RVers and we like the fact that it doesn't take up much space. It does an excellent and quick job of grilling meats, veggies and fruits. I've already pressed several sandwiches, from Cubans to grilled cheese and it preformed beautifully. The griddle makes really good breakfasts too.  I use silicone egg rings to make the perfect eggs.  I've tried my hand at Belgium Pecan Waffles and they were delicious though I did cook them a few minutes longer then directed and they were perfect. It was a little slow at cooking pancakes at the recommended 400 degrees.  Next time I will adjust it higher which should do the trick.  The clean up is easy as well.  After cooking, I turn it off and place wet paper towels in between the grates and after a few minutes, it wipes clean.  It allows us to cook healthy but quick foods and is a great addition to our kitchen. I highly recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2006
CommentsContent: I got this grill/griddle after visiting my parents over the holidays and having a couple dinners made by mom on hers.Why I love it:- It's a very sturdy unit, and doesn't feel wobbly or junky like some of the cheaper versions made of plastic.  It's a nice, heavy grill and the grill and griddle plates are also very sturdy.- I LOVE that the plates pop out and can go right into the dishwasher or, if you're feeling handy, easily clean up in the sink.- It's two appliances in one - a panini press/grill and griddle - which saves space.. an important attribute for a kitchen gadget addict with limited storage space- The floating hinge ensures that when you 'close' the grill, it's still getting full coverage on the top and bottom of whatever it is you're cooking, and saves you from having to flip it- Convenience of a grill without having a big barbeque, and healthier/less messy than grilling with a charcoal BBQThere are many other versions of this type of appliance out there, but none matched the quality or the versatility of the Cuisinart in this price range.  Definitely more expensive than the typical Foreman-type grill, but the versatility and quality warrant the additional expense.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: The bottom and top grills do not heat evenly. The picture is of two chops showing the difference between the bottom grill and the top grill. I cooked a steak prior and hit had the same result. This is unacceptable and I can't believe this product was allowed to hit the market from an otherwise reliable company.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014
CommentsContent: This grill is one of the premier counter top grill/griddles on the market.  My father in law had one and now I have one and gave one as a gift to a friend.Pros:Clean up is simple!  The grill plates can be removed which makes clean up extremely simple. The grill plates can also be flipped over and turned into a griddle for pancakes or eggs or whatever you want to put on it.  The lid is situated on a pivot hinge which allows the lid to sit flat on whatever meat you put on it, thus giving you an even grill.  Unlike some others that have a flat lid which cooks unevenly. The unit is small enough that it fits easily in any pantry.Cons:NoneGreat product that will allow you to easily grill from your counter top in the winter or any time really.

CommentsTitle: Good Unit w/ One Serious Flaw for Burgers
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2006
CommentsContent: I've been using this item at least once a week for about six months now.  I use it primarily as a griddle for french toast or pancakes or as a grill for hamburgers.  As a griddle, it works fine.  I wish it were a little bigger, but with creative arrangement it will hold 6 pieces of french toast.  As a grill, it leaves a lot to be desired.  It has a drip tray, but the unit is not angled properly for the grease to drain.  I use 96% fat free ground beef, which is pretty dry, but the grease -still- runs out of the back of the unit.  I'd taken to propping it up, which helped but didn't solve the problem. Last night, I propped it on two inverted bowls--so much of an angle that the grease was running down over the controls in the front, and it -still- ran out the back of the unit. It isn't that I've overloaded the grill--we're only talking 4 hamburgers.  But that's done it for me.  I'm going to take a good look at the George Foreman GRP90WGR.  It also has removable plates, and maybe it's better designed.If you're looking for a griddle or a panini press, the cuisinart could be great.  But if you make hamburgers as often as I do, you  might want to look somewhere else.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Just got this 30 minutes ago,  and it came with these parts broken off.  Very unhappy as I  bought my groceries according to having thisOk, they replaced it with in 3 days.  +So changing this from a 1 star to 5 stars.  Love it.  Works great.  Very happy with the service and how good it cooks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2013
CommentsContent: Needed to replace a countertop grill I've used for years and years.  Wanted another one with removable plates.  Was hesitant to order after reading some of the reviews, but am so glad I purchased this.When it comes to my nature, I have to say I'm slightly on the critical end of the spectrum.  As someone at work once said, "We know you don't give praise lightly."With that understanding in place, I really do love this grill.  So far I've used it in the grill position to make steaks and burgers, and in the griddle position to make eggs easy over.  In the grill position, can easily cook 3-4 good sized burgers - where my last grill only made two.  The design of the drip tray openings has a lot to do with the increased surface area available.  Very thoughtful design in that regard.In the griddle position, was able to easily make 4 eggs at once with plenty of room to spare.  Six eggs at once (three on each side) would be no problem at all, and eight at once would be possible.  The slight slope of the "bottom" side of the griddle meant the egg white tended to run a little toward the back edge, so I was careful to "drop" the eggs slowly and allow the whites to harden as I was tipping egg out of the shell.  Some little rings to keep eggs contained and nice and round may be a purchase I'll make, but not a necessity in order to use the griddle for eggs.Love that the temperature knobs have green indicator lights to signal when the selected temperature has been reached.  I don't find the controls confusing, as a few have.  Select "grill" to use nominal settings (warm, low, medium, high, sear) or griddle to use temperature settings (in degrees fahrenheit).  Either setting can be used in closed or open position.Love the handle so we don't get blasted with steam when opening the lid.  The plates are lighter than the plates on my old grill - which I think is a good thing.  They are still plenty sturdy to do the job, but not a lot of extra weight.  In spite of the extra cooking area, this grill fits in the same space where I stored my previous grill.  Love that the plates reverse, so I don't have to have a place to store the "other" set of plates.Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.  It is a big improvement on my past two counter-top grills.

CommentsTitle: The Swiss Army Knife of Panini Makers.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2013
CommentsContent: I've loved paninis for the longest time, but didn't know I could make them at home until I saw this model in a store.  I knew I had to get it, or something like it, so I did the research and I became a huge fan of this contraption.The GR4N is like the Swiss Army knife of panini makers/griddles.  It really seems like the design team that produced this incorporated a number of different ideas and functions to produce a truly versatile unit.  And for the price (especially the Amazon price), it's a fantastic value.  I believe it's the best of its class currently available. The only way you could do better, in my opinion, is by buying a vastly more expensive, professional model used in restaurants.I don't own a toaster; so this even toasts my bread in a pinch.PROS:* Amazing, painless clean up.  With its nonstick surface, sometimes all you need to do is wipe it perfectly clean with a damp paper towel.  The detachable griddles are fantastic.* Ability to switch between flat surface and ribbed surface is great.* The ability to open it up flat, doubling your grill space, is very useful.* Temperature control allows you to fine tune your grill.* The floating cover allows you to pretty much panini anything, from very thick to very thin.* It's a light, compact, sturdy unit that stores very easily.CONS:* The weight of the top grill often isn't sufficient to immediately crush the sandwich like they do with the professional $500 models.  (This isn't insurmountable however; simply, manually press and wait a few minutes for the heat to take effect.)* Sometimes the heat applied is not completely uniform over the width of the griddle.* It is a compact unit.  This is for sandwiches, not for grilling large T-bone steaks.  (Its compactness is also a Pro, above.)* I think the power cord leaving the unit should have been shielded: on a crowded kitchentop countertop, one has to sometimes look for the cord before opening the unit.* And I do have a design quibble.  There are currently 3 knobs on the Griddler: 1 "Griddle" knob with temperature notations; 1 "Grill-Panini" knob with notations "Warm-Low-Med-High"; a 3-way selector knob that toggles between Off/Griddle/Grill-Panini.  All that was really needed was an On-Off switch and a single Knob with 2 bands of markings.  There's no real functional difference between selecting Griddle or selecting Grill-Panini.  Griddle at 200 degrees corresponds to Grill-Panini at "Warm."  Griddle at 400 degrees corresponds to Grill-Panini at "High."  I think this design is more of a marketing function than utility to the consumer, perhaps to sex it up and differentiate it from Cuisinart's cheaper GR-35 model.

CommentsTitle: On the positive side the burgers turned out good. Again
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2015
CommentsContent: I buy ground sirloin for my burgers or at least that is what the packaging indicates. When I made my first batch of burgers the grill overflow with greece. To be fair I do not know if the grill is at fault but IMHO it is not equipped to handle the accumulation of greece that comes from 90% lean 10% fat. On the positive side the burgers turned out good. Again...my opinion is that I would have to purchase HALAL meet in order to cut down on the greece. The only other grill I owned was a George Foreman which was a challenge to clean. I purchased this for the versatility and the fact that it has removable plates. It is also smaller than I imagined but the measurements were clearly displayed before I purchased.  As I continue to use it, I will report back and modify my rating if necessary

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2015
CommentsContent: This is my absolute favorite appliance! Given the choice between this and the microwave, I'd definitely choose this! I have bought two now, one for work and one for home. I use this thing for everything! Making pancakes, bacon, sandwiches, quesadillas. I've even reheated pizza on it to prevent the crust from going all soft like it will in the microwave. It heats pretty quickly and the plates are so easy to clean. I love that they have two different sides.The only con is that both the units I have purchased seem to be slightly hotter on one side than the other. Not a big deal, it just means my pancakes cook faster on the right side than the left. It's not enough of a difference to really be an issue.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2018
CommentsContent: It is okay...The button on the side to pop off the bottom plate broke within days of first use, annoying but not a deal breaker.The grill plates are flaking the non-stick, and replacements are $50 for each plate. It will cost more to keep using the old one then to buy a new one. I find that a disgusting use of our resources. The are not replace able because they are three years old.

CommentsTitle: A go to appliance in our kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2018
CommentsContent: This does a great job of grilling meats and fish, paninis, and pancakes.  Cleans easily and the controls provide easy adjustment and make it easy to know when the unit is preheated.  The build quality is less than  I expected for the price.  .  The controls are light-duty and the grill plates are lighter than I expected (they are replaceable).  I expect to use it frequently and hope it holds up over time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2018
CommentsContent: I had wanted a griddle since we arrived in Seattle and this seemed like it would be a great option. We have not been disappointed, the quality is first rate and the functionality is nice.  The best feature by far though is the removable plates that go straight into the dishwasher for pain free clean up (keep it pain free by not removing the plates when still hot, just saying)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this as a gift.  I have one I use a lot.  I have had mine for years now and have never had any problems.  Still works great and all parts are working.  I think it’s a good product and good value.

CommentsTitle: Great gift, since they needed a new one after ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2015
CommentsContent: We got one for my parents for Christmas after my husband did a lot of research online. Great gift, since they needed a new one after having one for many years. Since our weather has been nasty, I got my hubby one for his birthday, and he's been grilling everything from pork chops to small steaks to reuben sandwiches. I was concerned about whether the unit would be OK to use after finding that the actual product box had a very large  tear across the top, but the styrofoam "bookends" must have kept it safe.The grill plate can be a challenge to clean with the scraper provided, since we do not have a dishwasher. I'll have to check into other accessories for Father's Day, since he is the cook in our house. He says it's so easy to use that even I can cook on it. That, in itself, is quite a recommendation!

CommentsTitle: I'll never make another un-grilled sandwich again!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2014
CommentsContent: Bought this to replace a Foreman grill. This is so much better. The removable/reversible plates are terrific. They clean up well in the dishwasher after a cursory washing-brush swipe or two. I like the adjustable temperature settings and the floating top. Thick or thin, grill marks are made universally on both sides of whatever I'm preparing.  Heats up quickly and any drippings get caught in the hidden capture tray for very easy clean-up. Only thing I didn't like was the utensil provided. I suppose it's to be used for cleaning, but I used a few times to lift and turn food and it melted a bit. I would love to see a melamine turner with the groove-filling tabs. Something that let's you get fully under the food without melting from the limited contact. Otherwise, I love it. Time permitting, I'll never make another un-grilled sandwich again!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I was super concerned after reading all the negative reviews about the heat being inconsistent. I wanted an all-in-one breakfast machine for making pancakes, waffles and other items. I haven't really needed the grill plates yet, but it makes a solid waffle and great pancakes. There might be a slight difference in heating between the upper/lower plates, but nothing that impacts my own cooking. Love it, use it multiple times a week!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Cheaply made.  Not the product quality I expected.  Lots of thin metals and plastics.  That being said, it we works great!  The control knobs are confusing at first.

CommentsTitle: A great appliance that is very functional!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2009
CommentsContent: First off this is the first griddler/pannini press I have ever owned and I am not any a gourmet.  I bought this griddler/pannini press for my wife because she loves eating pannini sandwiches.  We have had it only for a month and to date have not made any pannini sandwiches but have used it as an indoor grill (steaks, hamburgers, vegetables, etc.) We have been very satisfied with the product.  It heats up in a reasonable amount of time, stays hot, cooks the food very quickly and clean up is a breeze.  The non-stick plates are excellent and removable for easy clean up.  One issue in the griddle/pannini mode when you fold back the top plate to handle the food and it is covered by oil or grease it does drip off the bottom (hinge edge) on to the cord and counter.  We addressed this issue by "molding" paper towels across this area to collect the drippings.  The press handle stays cool during cooking and it takes ~20-30 minutes for the plates to cool down sufficiently to be handled for washing.  The appliance appears to be well built and sturdy but lightweight and compact enough for storage.  One thing I personally don't like are the unattached drip cups which of course I have already knocked over spilling grease all over the place.  But from looking at the various brands out there this seems to be a fairly common set up.  The price is even lower now so if you are in the market for one right now I feel this is a good deal.

CommentsTitle: I am the Waffel master now, and my kids love it!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2016
CommentsContent: This was a present to myself that my kids love!I bought it so I can make paninis and grill at home at winter time. It is very simple and user friendly, have a lot of grilling space but on the other hand small enough to find a storage place for it. It come with a little cooking book that have some great recipes and ideas.You can basically cook anything on it with the multiple cooking options, grill and griddle.I would highly recommend to buy also the waffles plates as my kids absolutely love my chocolate chip waffle I make them on the weekends :)Very easy to clean, everything just come off with hot water, not need to scarab at all.All in all, simple to use and easy to clean, perfect fit for any kitchen.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2012
CommentsContent: I was talked into ordering this by someone who had a similar item but the plates didn't come out and was hard to clean. We talked a few times about him ordering one and I logged into Amazon..ta da they were on sale. So I ordered one...now that I've seen it in action I would have paid full price! This thing is awesome! I have a lot of kitchen appliances that get used once then stored but not this Griddler. So far I have used it 5 times and its only been a couple of weeks.Plus side: duel control for grilling or griddle. Easy cleanup...easy to use..oh did I say easy cleanup! The food cooks evenly, no squished side because the top floats on the hinges. I put frozen hamburgers on and they were cooked to perfection in about 5 mintues. Toasted pita..oh yeah! It does it all...plus for you who like waffles you can get the waffle plates. That is the only downside, you have to purchase them seperately.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a very unique appliance which is very versatile.  The top and bottom cooking "plates" easily remove in order to wash . Great for grilling anything  plus frying without a lot of grease or oil . When cooking meat with a lot of juice, the juices will automatically flow into a specially built- in receptacle which is easily removed for cleaning. Thumbs up on this new appliance.

CommentsTitle: If you don't have a dishwasher, not so easy to clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2009
CommentsContent: -Plus-(1) I've now owned the Griddler for two weeks. I've never managed to make a chicken breast in my life which wasn't over- or under-done. With the Griddler, I was able to make six perfect chicken breasts in 5 minutes. I was really, really pleased and they tasted fabulous.-Minus-(2) I just tried London Broil today - it turned out OK. What's confusing is that if you plan on using the double-sided grill, the Griddler only specifies Warm, Low, Medium, High and Sear, so you need to guess what the equivalent stove temperature would be (i.e. 300 degrees, 400 degrees, broil, etc.). I used High for 6 minutes and - while it was well done on the outside - the inside was still bloody. So, there's some amount of tweaking you need to do initially to figure out how to cook certain items which aren't explicitly covered in the Griddler cookbook that comes with the product.-Additional Points to Consider: Grease-(3) Definitely consider putting paper towels behind the Griddler. When you're done using it, if you let it cool down with the top plate suspended above the bottom plate, the top plate will have a tendency to drip meat juice and grease onto the countertop behind it.-Additional Points to Consider: Cleaning-(4) It's really not that easy to clean UNLESS you have a dishwasher or a lot of patience. You need to allow the Griddler atleast 30 minutes to cool down before you can detach the plates without burning yourself. If you prefer meat which is seared on the outside, you probably haven't sprayed the plates with non-stick oil - in which case they're probably crusted. If you try to wash them in the sink immediately, you'll spend *a long time* trying to scrape off the crust with the tool that comes with the Griddler, and you'll get wet and smelly while doing so. Today, I let them soak in the sink for about 15 minutes before washing them - this worked out much better. However, for all the time I saved using my Griddler for cooking, I lost in waiting for it too cool down and then in waiting for it to soak.Overall, I'm still happy with the purchase, primarily because of the chicken breasts. I'm hoping to try the panini feature tomorrow. But, the thing to recognize is that it's just not as quick and easy as everyone seems to say it is (atleast not in my experience) if you don't have a dishwasher.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2019
CommentsContent: This griddler definitely lives up to the hype. We have used both sides of the plates to grill/griddle and everything cooks evenly, in much less time than a regular grill. The grill Plate leaves beautiful grill marks. Meats grilled using the Griddler are juicy and tender. I would highly recommend the Griddler to anyone who wants to grill indoors.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2015
CommentsContent: I use this thing all the time and I have had it for over 6 months.  No issues.  If it were stolen or broken I would buy another one THAT SAME DAY.  I love this thing!  I cook sandwiches, chicken and meats, waffles, etc...  The plates are removable and I put them in the dishwasher to clean them.  I bought the waffle plates, which are extra, and I am not disappointed at all.  Everything cooks and tastes how I expect it should.  Sandwiches (panini, grilled cheese, quesadilla, etc...)  are cooked in less than 3 minutes.  Chicken and other meats take longer to cook thoroughly of course, depending on how thickly sliced it is.  The lid will self adjust to the height of the food you place in it up to several inches up, it is on a pivoting hinge so that it will lay flat on bulky objects placed within it.  You can use this thing like a grill and lay it flat (top and bottom are both cooking surfaces) or use it like a george foreman grill (it has a drip pan to drain the fat that cooks off).  I never use metal utensils on it in fear of scratching the surface ( I don't even think it has a coating TBH), but so far I haven't had anything stick to it nor have I seen any signs of wear.  The temperature adjusts as needed and is as easy to use as a stove top, but frankly I always use it at high heat because I like my food to have some browning and crispy edges.  It is large, you can cook 4 sandwiches at one time;  I have cooked one, two, three and four sandwiches at once on this thing and it has cooked them all evenly and thoroughly no matter how i place them or arrange them on the grill. The heating is even and consistent.  Just a little (and i mean little) butter and stuff tastes awesome and does NOT stick!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2018
CommentsContent: I love the flip over griddle pans that are removable and dishwasher safe.  My previous one "Belle at home" dies on one side after 10 years so I was looking for a replacement (wanted the same bud found this while looking.  I chose this as my last one had two separate griddle and grill pans which meant you have to find somewhere to store the spare one.  Much prefer this flip over design.  Good hinge for fat panini's.

CommentsTitle: We thought it was going to be great, and that feeling was reinforced after the first ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2017
CommentsContent: We thought it was going to be great, and that feeling was reinforced after the first use. However, the lever that releases the top for using the griddle feature snapped off the very next time. This is the one characteristic of contemporary manufacturing that has continued to spiral out of control; nothing is made to last. We go through a space heater each season, and I'm not happy about that, but when I pay 70+ dollars of my hard earned money I expect the thing to last more a single use. I will be initiating a return right away.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2013
CommentsContent: I'll echo the comments of a couple of other reviews further down... this is a great idea with poor execution. We purchased this grill primarily for use as a griddle, and we had high hopes for it. The panini/grill functions would have been a bonus for us. What we found is that it's pretty much useless as a griddle. The thermostat shuts completely off and the plates cool down so much that the food stops cooking - bacon stopped sizzling, and pancakes stayed very light. Even turning the thermostat up didn't immediately seem to turn the heating elements back on. We tried it twice over the course of a weekend, and gave up on it. Too bad, this seemed like such a great concept.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2017
CommentsContent: WOW!!!!!! I think this is the BEST small appliance I have bought for my kitchen! We use this almost every day! its cleans sooo easy and cooks beautifully too! We have made burgers, chicken and salmon in this so far! and they all come out sooo juicy and very well cooked! Never will I cook chicken in a pan again! this is the best way to get juicy chicken! Looking fwd to try steak and maybe lobster too???dont hesitate BUY IT!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2013
CommentsContent: I bought this product a couple of months ago and I have come up with many problems.1. The top plate is not being held fully and because of that I will be using the 3 year warranty and getting a replacement. (I still have to pay the $10 shipping fee back to them)2. Started off doing great in terms of cooking and evenness, but cooking multiple meals means time is increased DRAMATICALLY.  This is good for a couple.  I don't recommend trying to cook more then that if you are in a time crunch.3. I bought this because removing the plates would make it easy to clean and they do.  however, it seems that this product has built in draining that only works if you are on a PERFECTLY flat surface.  I end up having to tilt to drain properly.All-in-All I would still get it again but not for the purchase price of $100.00.  Maybe more in the range of $60.00.

CommentsTitle: Heats very unevenly and much lower than control settings
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2019
CommentsContent: We've had several of these in the past. This newest one heats evenly between the 2 sides and I tested it and found one side 125 degrees lower than the setting on the other about 50 degrees lower than the setting. Very hard to use with this inconsistent heat and differences between the sides.

CommentsTitle: One of our favorite things in the kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2014
CommentsContent: I bought one of these in late February and it has greatly exceeded our expectations. My wife and I probably use it 5 days out of 7. It is great to cook sausage (4 minutes) and bacon. After you finish the bacon, you can plop down your eggs to fry. Sandwiches good great and fast. I did a steak the other night and was pleasantly surprised with the great taste. My wife and daughter love to cook pancakes on it too. They say the pancakes are a lot more fluffy than when cooked on our old griddle.One important thing is when pre-heating make sure it is closed. It preheats much better that way.We have enjoyed it so much, we got my mother one for her birthday.Clean up is a breeze. It says it dishwasher safe but to extend the life of the plates we wash by hand. After it cooks, it takes less than one minute to clean them up. They clean very easily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2012
CommentsContent: When I saw the pics & previews in the ad this thing looked soooo awesome so thought I'd grab one on on the special deal pricing that Amazon was offering. It came packed in the usual great Amazon fashion & looked as good in real life as the ad made it look. Couldn't wait to use it and the first time out, it worked perfect, a real pleasure to use. Thought it far superior to my trusty old George Foreman because of the easy to remove for cleaning grill plates, and the expanding grilling area feature. But the next time my pride in this machine was shattered when I went to turn up the temperature on it and the knob fell off into the floor. Well that was unexpected, but thought it would probably be easy enough to reinsert, but not the case. It wasn't broke, but rather some sort of press fitted arrangement, and it refused to stay in place making the temperature control totally inoperative as it was stuck in the lo heat position.When I called the Cuisinart toll free help line I was placed on hold for nearly 10 minutes and finally after reaching a rep was told that it would cast $10. for them to ship me a replacement and after I received the replacement that I would need to return the defective one to them again at my cost of course. While I like the grill, I must say that given the quality of Cuisinart's service & poor warranty, I really don't think that in all fairness I could recommend this product above the much cheaper George Foreman. I was willing to pay more because I perceived this to be a better product, but it isn't. I't just another built in China as cheaply as possible item.12/19/12 - Thought I would update this review to lety you know how this matter is progressing. I received a replacement for the original broken griddler today on UPS, postage pre-paid after some heated negotion abot why I should have to pay to ship the thing to me, and have to pay to ship the original broken one back as well. Anyway, when I pulled the replacement out of the box, parts started to fall off it as well. I immediately called Conaire which is the company who makes Cusinart and complained that the replacement unit was also broke, and they agreed to send a will-call tag for it. UPS has picked up the second one, and at this point, I think that it would probably be best if I just sent this back to Amaon, and called it quits. I own quite a number of cusinart products from skillets, to coffee pots, blenders, etc. but after dealing with this product, I'm not too confident in the brand any longer and would not be comfortable recommending it to a friend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2017
CommentsContent: I was really excited to get this but it's not living up to my expectations. I wanted it to replace my big electric griddle. I knew this would be smaller but would store easier plus the waffle attachments meant I could get rid of my waffle griddle too. Cons The button is hard to get the griddle to open flat. I feel like I'm breaking it every time. The edges of the griddle are very short so no cooking scrambled eggs unless doing them 1 at a time.Pros so easy to clean, love the multiple functionalityOverall, I like it but I liked my big electric griddle better 😞

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2013
CommentsContent: This is a really nice grill. I have used it twice to cook skirt steak and flank steak. I used the "sear" temperature on the grill and it cooked the steak pretty fast. I used the press to cook the steak. You have to keep an eye on the food the first couple of times until you know how hot the settings are. My steak was seared nicely. Nicely browned. All the fat and juices went nicely into the drip pan...no mess either. Easy to clean and a very nice sized grill. Not as big as I thought it would be. I cooked a medium sized flank steak on here. The only problem I had was that the steak was unevenly shaped in thickness so it didnt sear the entire steak when I used the press. No big deal though. I'm really glad I bought this item because of the temperature controls. And I the grill pans are soooo easy to remove and clean. VERY EASY. I had a lot of marinade on both my steaks and it left quite a mess on the grill pans but it was really easy to clean. Very nice looking grill too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2010
CommentsContent: I am very satisfied with my purchase of the Griddler. I've cooked burgers, steaks, panini's, bacon, sausage, potatoes,& pancakes on this machine & I'm very satisfied. I bought this machine to replace my old George Foreman machine. The Griddler makes great tasting burgers & steaks. My George Foreman would "steam" my meats & I hated it. The Griddler heats up quickly & is very easy to clean. I let it cool down, remove the plates, & wash them by hand. I NEVER put any teflon-coated product in my dishwasher. I only use plastic utencils to remove food, etc. from my Griddler. My only complaint would be that I wish Cuisinart had designed the unit to tilt to let the grease from meats run into the spill pan quicker.The little recipe book that comes w/the Griddler has easy & good recipes. I own a Jenn-Aire grill & I seldom use it because it is impossible to clean. My Griddler has replaced it because the food tastes just as good & very little clean up. I can cook 2 large sandwiches or 2 large pieces of meat (such as steak) in the Griddler. It will cook 4 burgers.You can cook on it with both sides down such as bacon or sausage on one plate & eggs or potatoes on the other plate. That makes for a quick, tasty meal!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2013
CommentsContent: After a year of light use, without ever scratching the surface it is time to replace the plates... the cost AMAZING USD 59 !!! OUTRAGEOUS.Besides it is terrible for grilling burgers… It does not get hot enough to seal the juices inside the burger… the result is that the burgers get dried on inside and in the meantime the outside is "boiled on water"as the juices escape and once the plate is not hot enough it also takes forever to evaporate… result over cooked and dried… will never make a medium or medium rare burger. 2 star only because it really makes good cheese sandwiches and the teflon is good.

CommentsTitle: Failed after a month and a half
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2013
