CommentsContent: We bought a GR-4N via Amazon on February 10th 2013 and it has failed on March 22nd, just out of the Amazon return period.When we try to use the grill it heats up, the temp light turns green as it should.  But when we put a steak or hamburger on it the sizzling stops and the temp light starts to blink repeatedly.  The cooking stops until we unplug the grill from the wall and plug it back in.I am going through Cuisinart now to see about swapping it out.--------- Update ----------Swapping it out is a hassle, and involves a couple of steps.You have to get ahold of someone from Cuisinart and give them the serial number.  Then wait a month for a replacement unit to arrive.  Once it arrives, put your old one in the box and enclose a check for $10.  Take it to UPS or FedEx and ship it back to them.Including shipping it costs about $25 to get the new one.  For almost 1/4 of the cost of a new one, it is a pretty big hassle.  I expected more from Cuisinart, but they are charging top of the line prices for crap now.

CommentsTitle: Love it! Use it every day
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2015
CommentsContent: Love it! Use it every day. Great for small living space. Great for quick meat and veggie grilling for 1 or 2 people.  It does make a mess as food juice splatter around the grill. So make sure too put something underneath it for easy clean up or just prepared to wipe the area where the grill is used.  However, it is a small connivence appliance therefore it does show its wear and tear in short amount of usage period. I have had the grill for about 6 months and have used it 3-4 times a week and the grill is definitely showing signs of use and I can see I may have to replace the grill parts sooner than expected.  The grills clean easily and as long as you clean it soon after usage.  I have hand washed the grills and all of the food from grilling comes off easily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2017
CommentsContent: This is great !  Very verseital. We wanted it to make bacon , sausage or eggs on one side pancakes on the other.This a smaller unit them our pancake grill we had prior.Thus it takes up less room and can still do it all. Plus my husband just developed a liking for making  panini . We love this griddle.as we know  all this  man made items can break at sometime , We took the  warranty  offered, so now no worries . Thank you Amazon for one stop shopping ,,

CommentsTitle: Perfect kitchen addition for Singles or a couple in an apartment
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2012
CommentsContent: I am a single guy, who up till a few months ago, had never tried to "cook". By cook I am referring to a dish with more than 4 ingredients, and mustard and ketchup don't count. I started using an online meal-planner and found quickly, that grilled food was done 1-2 times weekly. I needed to find an indoor grill that met my needs. This fit the bill perfectly. I scoured the internet and Amazon reading reviews about several indoor grills, and to be frank I was leaning towards a cheap George Foreman grill. I'd heard a million stories from everyone I knew and how simple and great they were. Well, that appears to be a thing of the past. It would seem that the great G.F. grills of 10 years ago, aren't made like they used to be. Moving on, I found this griddler at a great price here on Amazon. I did see that there were some bad experiences, but I felt like, more people are inclined to write a bad review, than a good one, so I gave it a shot.I've used this to grill several different meats: Salmon, tilapia, chicken, pork tenderloin, several cuts of steak, and burgers, of course.All, and I mean ALL, of the food has come out delicious, and good looking at that. I checked the food each time with a digital thermometer and all were well within the "Safe zone" for eating.The plates on this couldn't be easier to take off and put back on, and they clean, even after sitting for a day, with warm soapy water. The grease trap works well and cleans easy enough too.I have yet to use the flat side of the plates, nor the waffle plates that I purchased separately. So I can not comment on those. The griddler heats up in a very short time, and cooks very quickly. Two large salmon fillets were cooked thoroughly in about 4-5 minutes. The large pork tenderloin was 18-20 minutes.This grill is perfect for single servings or two people and I can have most of these grilled meals done in less than 30 minutes total time including prep. It has certainly expanded my options for great tasting meals and I am only upset that I didn't buy this earlier.One last thing to note is the size. The size of the grill is fairly large. I pack my grill away after each use, however, I also don't think it would be an issue keeping it on the counter at all times. It is a good looking piece of equipment and would look great out.I speak very highly of this product with friends and family, although for those lucky enough, the food speaks for itself.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2018
CommentsContent: Very nice but do not cook anything that will be greasy as the grease run over is small and grease will get everywhere.  Grilled cheese is the best  pancakes are good to cook on there as well. I like that you can change the surface. ITs small though looks bigger in the  picture. I dont know what the 5 in 1 is as I can only flip from grill to flat service.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought my 5-in-1 Griddler about two years ago.  I don't use it often so it took a while to figure out that it wasn't heating to the degree I would have expected.  I pre-heat it on high so figured my hash browns would brown, the hamburgers would have grid marks on them, etc.  It will be hot for about 3 minutes and then seems to shut down after I put food on it.  Very disappointing as I have several Cuisinart kitchen appliances that I love.  I see Cuisinart has now come out with a Griddler that has a "sear" function, which Is what I wish I had.  Too expensive to just chuck, but the concept was just what I wanted.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a useful product that takes some getting used to. The booklet that came with the griddler was not helpful. Fortunately, I found online instructions that I was able to download. It included needed info about temperatures needed for making various foods. It cleans very well and I appreciate that.

CommentsTitle: A real time saver for quick meals
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2012
CommentsContent: We use this to quickly grill hot dogs, veggie burgers, quesadillas, and sandwiches. It heats up quickly, and cleans up in a snap. I also purchased the waffle plates for it and they work very well, so I don't need a separate waffle iron. The plates secure firmly and the indicator lights let you know when the griddle has come up to temperature. The top gets very hot, but the handle remains cool. The only quibble I have is that plates aren't level when you open it up and lay it flat, so you can't really do eggs or pancakes or anything that's a little runny because it runs toward the grease drip pan. Also the top is quite heavy, so if you're making a pressed sandwich that you don't want mashed really thin, you need sturdy bread (or use tortillas/deli thins).We tried a different model (GRID-8PC) and immediately returned it. While the plates seemed heavier and the overall quality seemed better, the mechanism to secure them wasn't as good and the top plate kept falling off which was dangerous. Also, the plates weren't reversable, so if you had to store the extra plates to have both a grill plate and flat plate.

CommentsTitle: Chemical flavor in food when cooking, definitely NOT level
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I had high expectations with this item with all the reviews and the other cuisinart appliances I have. I washed by hand and there was this strange white goo that appeared and I can't get it off. It's like duct tape goo left behind and slightly melted on. It's not level when laid out despite being on a measurably level surface. When making breakfast sandwiches, it all heads to the drip tray and leaves a snotty mess. Find a better product and skip this one!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I love this griddle. I make it panini sandwiches, grill salmon, cook burgers in the press for faster cooking, make pancakes. It's awesome and easy to clean. I purchased the waffle iron and am on the fence with that, but otherwise, it's a great purchase!

CommentsTitle: Holy Coals Batman, It's the Griddler!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2007
CommentsContent: This has worked well for us at least a year.Yes grilling outside is better but this can be very nice.It seems to get as hot as I want at the highest but it still isn't quite a grill -- besides you don't want the super high temperature cooking inside unless you have very very good ventilation.The absolute best thing is that the grill plates detach instantly once cold, and they go right into the dishwasher!  If you cook a steak or something at a very high temperature (or for a very long time) you might need to soak and lightly scrub for a minute or two before popping them in the dishwasher but if you do chicken breast or sandwiches, the grills are going to clean up perfectly without a hand wash.Sturdy materials -- good craftsmanship.  The cord is never long enough (I think for safety reasons) and the cord doesn't have a super easy wrap and forget in the back but it is close.Grilled cheese sandwiches are great just as panini.I haven't seen anything out there yet that beats this brand and model.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I am on the keto diet and needed something to easily make chaffles to help me stay on track with my diet.  I also bought the waffle plate that goes with this.  I love this.  I have made chaffles and burgers on it so far and my food has turned out great.  The plates come off and are really easy to clean.  It's large enough to make 4 decent sized burgers and small enough to take a trip.  This is one of the best purchases I have made this year!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Love this little grill.  We're currently in an apartment and it is compact enough to not be bothersome.  I told myself I would never buy a George Forman grill again due to the insane clean up process but this has been a breeze to clean up since you can just pop off the plates and place in the dishwasher.  I love that the plates are interchangeable as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought for my fiancée for Christmas and got this one because it wasn’t a “cheap one”. It works, I’ll say that but the surface gets scorching hot! Keep kids and pets far away when in use. It’s almost hard not to burn yourself using it. I expected better from cuisinart

CommentsTitle: Use this every day and it saves so much time and easy to clean!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2014
CommentsContent: You will love this Griller.  I bought another as a gift.  I hate washing pots and pans and this is so cool!  I thought it would be like the lean grillers but it is so much more.  I cook and grill everything on it now and it cleans like new every time.  I can make it through dinner and cleaning in an hour with what used to take two hours.  I bought the waffle plates and man! I love this thing!  I am buying my brother one for Christmas.  So convenient and did I mention easy to clean?  Sandwiches look and taste better than restaurant sandwiches and I have even posted pictures of how pretty m food looks on social media.  People want to come enjoy it with me.  It tastes so fresh and veggies are awesome on it.  I turn over the grill plates and make eggs, bacon and pancakes and then grill lunch and dinner on the grill side.  It would be perfect for an elderly person or college kids for the dorms.  Much better price on Amazon than anywhere else!  1000 Stars, favorite kitchen appliance!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2016
CommentsContent: Absolutely love it! I use it all the time. Even used it recently for hot dogs when it was too hot to grill outdoors. They plumped up perfectly and tasted great. I've also used it for steaks in the winter. My son loves to cook so I gave him one. He swears by its versatility and uses it frequently. I love the easy cleaning. The build and quality far exceeds the competition.

CommentsTitle: Cuisinart 5-in-1 Griddler is a perfect panini maker for a family.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the second one I just bought since the first one my wife broke the on and off switch and I gave up to unplug it after every usage. We use Cuisinart 5-in-1 Griddler every day twice to do sandwiches to our kids.  It is a very durable machine also with the waffle plates (sold separately) is a perfect Griddler for a family with kids.

CommentsTitle: Buy it for the grill not the griddle.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2018
CommentsContent: I recently started trying to eat better and cook more of my meals instead of eating out/ordering in and this was exactly what I wanted. A good sized cooking surface that is easy to use and clean.The grill is the best part. It's works like a dream. Little to no smoke, heats up quickly, cleans very easily, and cooks things very well.The griddle option is not that great. Either I'm underestimating the tempertaure of a stove or this thing just doesn't cut it. I've tried it once and I won't be doing that again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2015
CommentsContent: I've had this for a little over a month and have used it 6 or 7 times., for waffles paninis and burgers. Paninis and burgers came out great!  I made the very thick tomato, feta and spinach burgers from the Atkins diet recipe and they were cooked completely through and still juicy in 9 minutes, on "sear" with a nice brown crust. Waffles, using the waffle griddles sold separately, have been a little less successful but I'm improving.  I find i have to turn it to the highest heat setting and let them cook 4 minutes, that seems to be doing the trick now.  It has been sooooo esy to clean, and the drip pan works fine. No sign of any problems with the coating. Would definitely recommend this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2018
CommentsContent: Didn’t get hot enough for a good sear. Top especially didn’t cook well. Also, couldn’t get the top plate ro snap in securely, so it was always sagging. It’s ok for panini, but not for steaks.Sorry I gave away my panini press before I tried this. (It cooked well, but didn’t have removeable plates and was a nuisance to clean.)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2005
CommentsContent: Well, my son and I love this item so much that after breaking our unit because it was dropped accidentally on concrete, we are ordering a replacement.  After last year's hurricane Jeanne we had to move from our home for 9 months to rebuild.  This was a wonderful splurge and we used it very often.  We were away from home in an apartment and used this to make many of the meats we would usually grill in our backyard.  My son learned to make grilled sandwichs and has become quite the Cuisinart chef.  Too bad he broke our first but we are ordering another without regrets.The unit heats up quickly, retains its heat setting, is very versatile and cleans up in a snap.  The interchangeable griddle/grill plates easily release melted on cheese and fats and they can be popped into the dishwasher as well.We love our griddler and are looking forward to receiving our replacement unit!  And as with all other Cuisinart products we own, it is well designed, is highly reliable and uses high quality components.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2010
CommentsContent: We received our Griddler at the end of November, 2010 and have used it twice a day since and love it.  It makes great paninis, love the peanut butter and banana paninis, as well as grilled meats and chicken.  We turn it on, and by the time we prep our food it is hot and ready to go.  Have had no problems with grease spillage thus far. Grilling skinless, marinated chicken works great, with the grease tray catching any juice/fat, which we then use in gravy or stuffing.  We liked it so much that we ordered two more for our daughters, who absolutely love theirs.  I have never had a panini maker before, so can't compare versus others, but this works great for us.  Cleaning is a breeze.  Placed it under hot water faucet to clean off burned on grease residue, and it rinsed right off with a light wiping using a wet paper towel.  We live in an rv and this is rapidly becoming our favorite appliance.

CommentsTitle: Marginal Performance Resulting in Poor Value
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2013
CommentsContent: The thermostat on this unit seems to have great difficulty moderating and maintaining temperature, which makes it nearly impossible to adequately prepare any temperature-sensitive foods. For example, preparing something as simple as a grilled cheese sandwich is a lesson in frustration as at a moderate setting the bread is not grilled enough, but at even a slightly higher setting the cheese becomes too-well melted and oozes all over the platen. Similarly, attempting to prepare a simple salmon fillet generally results in an almost crust-like exterior with a marginally cooked interior at one setting, but is entirely undercooked at a reduced setting. There just doesn't seem to be much of an "in between" with this unit---it's either "on" or "off," which is far from ideal. Steaks? Forget about it.I would not at all recommend this unit nor will I be using it with any frequency in the future, if at all.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2021
CommentsContent: I had been eyeing this for years and was surprised with one as a gift. Fantastic! Makes wonderful waffles and chaffles, and super easy to clean. Also got the interchangeable plates -- great as a griddle, for quesadillas, and paninis!  All plates go in the dishwasher. Huge bonus!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2012
CommentsContent: This is the third indoor grill I have owned and it is hands down the best of the three -- I couldn't be happier.  I bought this grill to replace a George Foreman grill that I just couldn't get clean any more (and which didn't do the best job anyway).The Griddler does a better job of cooking evenly and is far, far easier to clean than either of the other ones I have owned.  I live in a basement apartment with no stove and rely on the Griddler for dinner just about every night.  It works great for salmon filets, chicken breast, hamburgers, pork chops, chicken burgers, turkey sausage and steak -- basically everything I have thrown at it.  I haven't tried the panini function or the open grill function yet.  The floating lid keeps your food from getting squashed on one end and undercooked on the other (a problem with the GF grill I used).  The variable temperature lets you cook fish properly but still be able to sear chicken, hamburgers, and steaks.  Cleanup couldn't be any easier.  The grill plates are removable and wash up clean with a little soap and water.  Fat drains off well, even though the Griddler does not sit at an angle like the GF grill.Bottom Line - I don't generally write reviews, but I was so impressed with this thing I decided to let others know.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2010
CommentsContent: I've owned this grill for about 4 years now & we're about to replace it. It's been a good little grill. Makes the best grilled cheese sandwiches on the planet. Cooks steaks quickly so you have to watch them or they can go from undercooked to overcooked very fast & you'll miss the "just right" window.So why replace it? Well, grease build-up over time has caused the plates to smoke. No amount of cleaning will prevent this. And the drip spouts & plate hinges are fixed so that you can not rotate the top & bottom plates. This causes more wear on the bottom plate. Lastly, one of the plastic spokes that allows you to wrap the cord up broke long ago so the cord is always trailing around.I think this is just one of those neat little appliances that must be replaced from time to time. I could run it for a longer period of time, but it's gotten a little gross, so I'm opting to find another. But after reading reviews I may just pick up a newer model of this grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2013
CommentsContent: I am impressed with this griddler; I have a few other Cuisinart kitchen items and a few are a bit unsteady, or they wiggle on the counter when moved.  Not this one; I tested out the folding handle and the drip pan insert just to make sure everything worked as described.  The folding handle has no looseness in it at all so you get a solid cooking platform for griddling, and the panini function I tested out by making a sandwich......... awesome!  I used to use a countertop convection oven, but I had to make little changes in the sandwich to get the heat all through the sandwich, but the panini plates do their job quite well.  Makes me wonder why I didn't get one of these to begin with.  I would rate 5 stars, but for the price vs. the competition, they should have included the waffle plates, which coincidentally, are out of stock on the company website until May 2013

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2018
CommentsContent: I am a beaver hunter; I use the entire body of what I kill, which means I eat beaver.  I cannot have a traditional outdoor grill because of where I live, so I have spent considerable time researching and testing indoor grilling products.  It was a long and sometimes painful journey to find that indoor grill capable of rendering me the perfect beaver steak, always pink in the middle with a light grill sear on the outside.  The Cuisanart grill gets two thumbs up from me!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: Had some time to make a few things on the grill and my wife and I are very happy with it.  Very easy to clean as well.  Going to use for at least a month more to see if the waffle plates are something that will work for us.

CommentsTitle: Not worth the price for only 7 uses.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Lasted six months, used a total of probably 7 times. This time while I was cooking, the thermostat apparently went haywire. It kept shutting off except at the lowest setting. Now worthless. I have contacted the manufacturer; so far, no response.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2019
CommentsContent: We love this grill, we used this to cook chicken, shrimp and vegetables. Easy to clean, wife's approved.  I recommend this product, you won't be disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Unlike my previous model this ones grease trap design is not so good.It is hardly big enough for a even a single pound of bacon and allows grease to escapefrom the top grill when you lift it and leaks onto the counter.The counter needs cleaned up after every use. More messy than it should be.

CommentsTitle: Love this new and improved version
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2013
CommentsContent: This is our 3rd Cuisinart Griddler. We live in a condo, so the Griddler is our only option for preparing grilled food at home. We literally wore out Griddler # 2 (Griddler #1 was returned with a defective part and replaced, no questions asked). We love this new and improved design. Only 2 plates - instead of 4 - which counts in a small kitchen. The grease trap is a real improvement over the little cups that were sometimes forgotten and sometimes turned over! We decided to cook less with the cover closed, which seems to dry food out quickly, and we really like the result. The "sear" setting works great too. We use our new Griddler for fish to Cuban Sandwiches and beyond. I highly recommend the Griddler!

CommentsTitle: Better than the other grill we had
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2007
CommentsContent: I purchased the Cuisinart Griddler after getting tired of trying to clean our other grill (George Foreman) without removable plates.  It was always a chore & difficult to try to get the grill clean.  After receiving the Cuisinart we made our first meal & it was so much easier.  When we were finished eating we removed the grill plates, just pop them out, & put them in the sink with soapy water.  They washed up nice & clean, all the way clean, & then when dry popped them back in.  Love the fact that the top flips open to double the grill size & the griddle plates that can be interchanged to cook things like pancakes & other items you don't want to press between two plates.  It's also nice to have adjustable temperature control for items that don't need to be on high.  The size it just about right for our family of 3 but if you needed to cook for more it's quick enough to cook additional right after the first batch.  I would have liked it to be a little bigger but it is sufficient & takes up only a small amount of space on the counter. Love this grill!  I would definitely recommend.

CommentsTitle: 5 in 1 Allstar Griddler is A Better Grill upgrade Griddler
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2013
CommentsContent: I decided to try this Grill for it's all purpose functions, easy to clean, and ability to grill a varity of different foods. As a Grill in the closed position the Cusinart Gr-4N 5 in 1 works well on the foods I have tried such as Shrimp skewers, Hot dogs, Hamburgers, Chicken Breast, And a varity of steaks. As a grill in the open position I tried Shrimp Skewers that created a mess to clean up. The top of the grill does'nt regulate heat as hot as the bottom as a griddle. When I made Pan cakes the bottom griddle did great, however the top cooked them vary slow and I had to rotate from top to bottom to get them cooked. This is the reason I gave the Griddler 4 stars not 5 stars. The main food I use the grill for are salmon fillets in the closed position and they cook up great. The drainage system is not very good when using marinades. I use canolia oil to season the grill in between uses and they clean very well. I will probably buy a large griddle for pancakes as you can only cook two large pancakes at a time and the griddle takes forever to cook them. I turn down the heat 1 setting as a closed grill to start my food and turn the grill up to high or sear the final few minutes two keep marinades from burning to the grill. Cusinart needs to go back to the drawing board on this product and come out with an improved version. The Warranty covers 3 years but as we use the grill at least 5 days a week for our diet I would be happy if it last for two years!! I read reviews about the grill pealing but if you season the grill with olive or canolia oil in between uses the grill's non-stick surface does not peal. I hope this helps others who are thinking about buying this grill. This was a good buy but not a great one. However I am just happy to have it as its 101 degrees outside here in Florida and the grill does come in handy for quick cooking in the closed position. I like the removable plates which I soak for ten minutes and they come clean very easy. The grill is fun to use and I don't get over heated like when we grill outside. The grill cooks fish, steaks, Hamburgers, Hot dogs, and shrimp very well. Easy to use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2018
CommentsContent: This has proven to be one of my favorite kitchen appliances.  From grilling (burgers, steaks & chicken) to griddle (pancakes & French toast) to Panini press, it is a very versatile and easy to clean item.  I just wish it were bigger.  My only negative comment is that the non-stick coating on the raised ridges of the grill side of the plates is already starting to come off.  But I'll take partial blame for that, as it may be from being a little too aggressive when cleaning it.  Overall though, this is a great product that gets a lot of use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I grill chicken and salmon. They always come out delicious. This is my second Cuisinart grill ( the first one I ruined it by putting in the oven during self- cleaning) very bad idea as it lost the non - stick layer. Then it was difficult to clean.

CommentsTitle: Cuisinart GR-4NP1 5-in-1 Griddler, 13.5"(L) x 11.5"(W) x 7.12"(H), Silver With Silver/Black Dials
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a grill and griddle. It is easy to use and simple to clean. The controls are easy to operate the knobs are big. I had the older version of this item and am glad that the redesigned it and now the drip tray is underneath.

CommentsTitle: Great Addition to the Kitchen with Minor Problem
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2014
CommentsContent: Our twin toddlers are picky eaters but we can get them to eat a variety of paninis. For ease of cooking and ease of cleanup, the Griddler gets 5 stars.One of my favorite features is the plates come out of the machine and can be put in the dishwasher. Also if those plates lose their non-stick surface, I can replace the plates without having to buy another Griller.One criticism. The hinges which allow the Griddler to open wide like a snake's jaw do not open easily. You have to press a button and then when you get the sides pressed, you'll often find that oil has dripped onto the counter. But I suppose without this "snake jaw" feature, you wouldn't have the "open wide" option, so the strength contains a bit of weakness.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Overall I really like this product.  I mainly got it because the grill places are removable for easy cleaning.  The only thing that I don't like is that the top cooks slower that the bottom. I had to flip my sandwich to get an even "brownness" on both sides.  It is a little tricky to try and flip a waffle.  It takes longer than my old waffle iron.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm sending this thing back. To me there's a major design for with a lip on the bottom heating element being to small causing grease to over flow the sides and if there's any grease on the top heating element it will leak onto your countertop when you open it.

CommentsTitle: We use it several times per week.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2016
CommentsContent: The old G.Forman was to small to cooks 2 burgers at one time so we had to upgrade.We searched and researched until we found this.It works great for up. Just what we need. I really enjoy the removable plates, so much easier to clean then the attached old G.Forman.It is also much more versatile. We were even able to save space and get rid of the flat grill as the top swings open to lay flat, how nice.We use it for beef burgers, Vegi burgers, turkey burgers, Chicken breasts, Paninis, grilled-cheese, and Pancakes.

CommentsTitle: My favorite part is that the plates are dishwasher safe - ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2015
CommentsContent: I have had this for about a year now, and this is definitely one of the many kitchen gadgets I own that I still use regularly.  You could use this to make every single meal of your day on!  We mostly use this for pancakes on the griddle side, and grilled sandwiches on the panini side.  I also occasionally grill chicken on this thing.  My favorite part is that the plates are dishwasher safe - and they have held up well after being in our dishwasher over a dozen times.  I would highly recommend this to anyone, especially if you are limited on kitchen space, but want a griddle, panini maker, grill, etc.  (Getting ready to purchase the waffle plates next!)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2005
CommentsContent: As for the Cuisinart GR-4 Griddler, the first one I received was defective (more on that at the end of this review). The replacement product I received works fine.  The Griddler is very stylish-looking with brushed stainless steel and "retro" styled knobs.  The top of the unit gets very hot during cooking and should not be touched without a protective mitt.  It takes several minutes to heat up, no matter what temperature you select, which I found a bit surprising.  It also takes a very long time for the unit to cool down once you are finished cooking.  It helps to leave the unit in the open position for faster cooling, but you can plan on waiting at least 30-60 minutes for it to cool down to where you can safely clean it.  A light on the grill/griddle selector knob turns red when the unit is switched on, and a separate light on the temperature knob turns green to indicate when the desired temperature is reached.  The product works as advertised.  It can be used as a panini press or opened flat for a two-section open-faced griddle.  There are two sets of metal plates that come with the Griddler - a flat set and a set with ridges.  They are coated with non-stick material and therefore only plastic or nylon utensils should be used with the Griddler to avoid scratching the plates.  The plates are easily interchanged and washed.  They are also dishwasher-safe.  You don't want to break or lose them - they cost $30 each to replace on Cuisinart's web site.  There are two cheap plastic collection cups that can be placed at the corner of the griddle to collect grease.  They are quite small, and do not hold much.  A cheap plastic cleaning tool is also provided to help clean the grill plates.  I have not needed to use it.  Overall, I am happy with the Griddler.  I paid $109.95 for it, which I believe is a good value.  It would be over-priced at the $199 suggested retail price.  Cuisinart's quality control and customer service with this product was surprisingly poor.  Before having to return the defective unit I tried to get a replacement manual from Cuisinart.  They promised to send one in 7-10 days which never arrived.  That's the only reason I docked the Griddler a star.Speaking of poor customer service, my first Griddler arrived from Amazon.com in an open shipping carton with the flaps loosely closed rather than taped shut.  The manufacturer's box for the Griddler, however, appeared to be unopened.  Nonetheless, the product arrived with no instruction manual or registration material, and one of the switches on the front of the product was loose and sparked when the unit was plugged in.  I returned the product for a replacement.  Amazon's customer service is terrible.  There is no telephone number to explain the problem to a customer service rep (I challenge you to find any phone number of this nature on their entire web site).  Instead you must request a refund or replacement by email.  They direct you to download a form to cut & paste onto your package to return the product by USPS (with no tracking) at no cost.  Alternatively, you can elect to send it by other means, although there is no mention of how they will reimburse you for the shipping cost (although they claim they will do so).  Since there is no telephone number to call for clarification, I would be very skeptical about it.  I sent my package back by USPS, but I have no way to prove it.  A company the size of Amazon.com should have far better customer service than this.  They should at least have a phone number you can call about problems with your order.  It is clear they would rather not have to deal with their customers about problems.  Having ordered thousands of dollars worth of merchandise from Amazon over the years, it has really made me think about ordering anything of major value from them in the future.Addendum (3/21/06) - since I wrote this initial review Amazon has added a link to contact a customer service representative by telephone.  To access it, click on "Help" in their main menu and click on the "Ordering" link.  To the right is a link to request a telephone contact.  I used this link for another order issue, and it worked very well.  The representative called me back immediately.  Clearly, Amazon has made an effort to improve their customer service.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: This grill/griddle is awesome. Easy to use, easy to clean and a space saver.  I’ve cooked sausage, eggs with veggies for breakfast. I’ve grilled fajita chicken. Cooks in half the time because it’s being cooked top and bottom at the same time. Nice invention.

CommentsTitle: I like the model but directions are lacking.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2019
CommentsContent: The directions are lacking. I like the model but what settings do I use to cook a steak? I want the top and lower plates to cook at the same time.  Can anyone help?Now if only they could make this model into induction type heating that would be excellent.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2014
CommentsContent: I enjoy the panini sandwiches I've eaten at restaurants so did some research and decided that by buying this Cuisinart Griddler, I could make my own sandwiches and so much more!  I've only used it a few times so far but the results have been excellent.  In fact, my husband was the first to use it for a New York steak, and he was very impressed with the results.  It seared the outside of the steak and the inside was nice and rare the way he likes it.  I've made two panini-style sandwiches on it, and they turned out very well.  Cleanup is a breeze--the non-stick cooking plates are lightweight, easy to remove and clean.  The built-in drip tray is a big plus for catching and removing oils and grease.  The "floating" cover is great for putting even height on thicker items.  Haven't used all of the available functions but look forward to making full use of it.  This griddler does the job of several small appliances so I'm able to do more with less!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2018
CommentsContent: I like this thing. Easy to clean. Works fairly good but there are a few downsides. It takes a decent time to heat up and also does not hold the heat. Especially while in use. It has light indicators that say when it's at the temp you set it to. These are almost always off once you have any form of food on there. So I have to constantly set it to sear to keep it hot. But it works nonetheless.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2013
CommentsContent: This grill works great!  I've used it many times grilling and also making sandwiches.  It's a great size for small family and it's easy to use.  Cooks food fast and the top allows you to press your sandwiches, just right.  I actually use it all the time.  Taking out plates and cleaning...a brush is an absolute must, is very easy, BUT as much as i love it, I absolutely HATE that the thing has the worst draining system for excess grease/fat/moisture.  Next to nothing drains away and therefore is cooked onto the plates or, the one time I used regular hamburger the grease spattered all over the counter.  The drainage holes in back are too small and not in right place so it doesn't drain properly or at all!.  I've only had to wash/empty the drainage 'pan/dish' a couple of times.  Would suggest using only lean meats with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2017
CommentsContent: I absolutely love this! The plates are removable so it's easy to clean. It cooks evenly and all the different capabilities and the control you have over everything makes this an all in one kitchen gadget must. Perfect for small spaces when you want a griddle, grill, panini maker, etc. It's like a new toy at Christmas that you just fall in love with!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2015
CommentsContent: Maybe mine is defective.  Will return.  With the heat all the way up it is almost hot enough to cook pancakes.  But not quite.  It doesn't brown, even with added oil.  I made a gray soft turkey burger and some white pancakes.  I don't get it.  I've had griddles before (one with teflon one ceramic) and have never had this problem.  I did let it warm up for about 10 minutes.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2018
CommentsContent: I waited a long time to buy this griddler. I shouldn't have. It's amazingly versatile. It cooks perfectly. And the non-stick grilling plates go right in the dishwasher. My only caveat is that the grease tray is devilishly hard to position perfectly. Drippings almost always end up on the counter. But that's not enough of a complaint to give it fewer than five stars.

CommentsTitle: The Best Appliance in Our Kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2017
CommentsContent: I waited a few weeks before writing this review on the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler. I wanted to make sure my first impression lasted and that I could give it a fair evaluation.In a nutshell, here is my evaluation: It is without a doubt the best appliance we have in our kitchen. We wanted a Griddler that could make panini sandwiches. It is a terrific panini maker. It is fun to experiment with different sandwiches, and we have yet to make a bad one.We wanted a Griddler that makes great pancakes. It is a terrific griddle that makes incredible pancakes.We wanted a grill where we can make bacon, eggs, hamburgers, hot dogs and other food you normally put on the gas grill. It is incredible in all these features.This is the best kitchen purchase we've ever made, and we have talked some friends into buying it.If I could mention one slightly negative feature to this Griddler: The top grill's temperature is slightly below the main grill/griddle. But, not enough for me to drop my 5-star rating.I can't recommend this Griddler enough. It has made our life so much easier, and has become our go-to appliance in the kitchen. Absolutely LOVE IT.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2012
CommentsContent: We bought this 5-in-1 griddler to replace 2 George Foreman grills and a griddle that were taking space in our cupboards. We were really pleased with how it worked as a Panini press/grill, but when we made pancakes on it we were sorely disappointed. It doesn't heat up as well as our regular griddle does. On our regular griddle we usually turn the heat to 325 and we get perfect pancakes. With the 5-in-1 griddler we had to close it to preheat to 375, open it up to the griddle, and then adjust the heat from there. Our pancakes weren't as well cooked and didn't have as nice of a color as they did when we cooked them on the griddle. We definitely won't be replacing our griddle, but have replaced our two grills with this product, as it works great as a grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I changed my review from the earlier post. This grill is terrible! The top does not cook so I had to turn my food. Waste of time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2019
CommentsContent: Didn’t heat properly on one side, so I had to turn meat manually when using grill. Didn’t even cook eggs on griddle. Too late to return to Amazon and Cuisinart will not return my calls or emails. Very disappointed ‼️ Only had it a little over a month.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Excellent product, it takes a few minutes to heat up but it does a great job. Cooks food perfectly, makes great sandwiches too. I’m looking forward to getting the waffle plates. Would definitely recommend it. Great price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2017
CommentsContent: This is the best Griddle Press I have bought and I got 2 at stores and 2 on here it was not until I got this one, that I loved making pressed sandwiches paninis and it is easy to clean with removable plates, also you can by waffle plates that are great. I love this and it works fast, its construction is solid and easy to clean the cord, like some, dose not over heat it has several different settings unlike some Presses.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2015
CommentsContent: I use this griddler mainly for grilling hamburgers. Construction and operation is top-notch except for grease draining. While the meat is cooking, the drain effectively captures the grease runoff. However, when cooking is finished and you open the lid to remove your burgers, the top cooking plate swings out well behind the small grease catcher opening at the rear of the unit, and you end up with a line of hot grease on your counter top. Once the burgers are removed, it's best to close the grill until cooled to reduce further grease runoff to the counter. This obviously lengthens cooling time until you can remove the hot grill plates for cleaning. Other than that nuisance, the unit works fine.

CommentsTitle: Great extra kitchen item to have on hand.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I really like this kitchen appliance. I been wanting one;I seen one at Wal-Mart for $79 and I found it on Amazon for $56,it's hard to believe it was cheaper on Amazon. I cooked breakfast it worked good and my mom's boyfriend cooked hotdogs on the grill side of the removable plates they turned out good just like on the grill. I also made waffles with the waffle plates:something ordered extra,since I like homemade waffles,but they turned out good. I love this appliance,it comes in handy.

CommentsTitle: the grease trap is pretty yuck. The plates are level with a little ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2015
CommentsContent: You'd think after all the george foreman's I've purchased I'd know that even if it shows 4 burgers on the grill then it can only really handle 2. That said, it works well, the grease trap is pretty yuck. The plates are level with a little divot out of the back so you constantly feel like it's about to over flow with grease and the divot isn't going to drain properly. It seems to drain ok, but after every burger you feel like you need to scrap some of the grease out rather than with the GF, it just drains out as it cooks.The different settings are complicated, but I wanted more control over the temperatures so I guess be careful what you ask for.

CommentsTitle: Good Countertop Cooker for Sandwiches & Waffles
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Easy to use for cooking and the clean-up is also easy.The cooking surface is sloped to allow for the drainage of grease into a trap.  You have to be aware of that when cooking certain foods which tend to spread out when poured onto the surface.

CommentsTitle: Don’t know what the hype is about
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Not sure why everyone thinks this is so great. It takes a while to heat up, doesn’t always sear the good enough, and I found the food from my old George Foreman to be more flavorful and juicy whereas it dries out sometimes in this. It does it’s job but for me it’s nothing to rave about

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2021
CommentsContent: This is an all in one! 3 months prior, we received a typical flat griddle. It was great. But we wanted something that could do more - we wanted to create our own sandwiches, grill, make breakfast... you name it, this machine can probably do it.I’m always looking for a “forward thinking” item... one that can take the place of multiple machines, in turn taking up much less space around the house.I’d highly recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2020
CommentsContent: We love this little grill / panini press. We grill burgers, chicken, sandwiches, quesadillas, almost anything. Perfect for our two person household. The removable plates makes it very easy to clean, just pop them out (when they cool off) and put them in the dishwasher. We use it weekly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2017
CommentsContent: Let me start with the fact that it wasn't cheap.  I gave it to my wife for Christmas to add a Panini press and replace a griddle.  I would have given this 3 stars as it works "okay" although to get it to cook anything I have to set it on high; for example on my old electric griddle I used to cook pancakes at 350, on this one it needs to be at 450 (as high as it will go) to get them to cook at all.  I gave it one star because it is 20 days later and under average use with no abuse one of the support legs on the back is already broken... the cast iron is that brittle.  I am hoping that Cuisinart will replace it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2019
CommentsContent: If you have a problem with this unit, Cuisinart tells you to cut off end of power cord, box it up, ship it to them, pay for postage. The will replace unit with new one and charge you $15.00. SO MUCH FOR WARRANTY

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2010
CommentsContent: I bought this grill a couple of months ago. The first thing we made was bacon and eggs on the griddle. They were ok, but they took forever. I would prefer to do bacon in the microwave and eggs in a frying pan. I used it for grilled cheese on the griddle. It was great, and fast on sear so don't leave it on too long or it will burn the cheese. I've made steaks, and again, watch them. I like mine rare, but it cooked so fast I got it well done. I know better now.I love this grill. The grills are so easy to clean right in the dishwasher and the built in grease catcher is great. It doesn't take up any extra room because it is under the grill and does catch all the grease so there's no mess. I like the idea that there are temperature controls so the temp you select is maintained throughout the cooking time.Great product. Would recommend it way over George Forman grills.

CommentsTitle: Not what we had hoped it to be...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2011
CommentsContent: We thought and hoped this would be a good replacement cooker for the WolfGang Puck Griddle we had got from HSN close to a year ago. We had been very satisfied with the WGP Griddle which is a similar multipurpose griddle to this one.  But the WGP Griddle was being recalled due to safety issues so we were looking for something at least as good as or better.  When we saw the Cuisinart griddle on Amazon and at a great price we thought this was it!  Also the vast majority of the reviews were 5 star...  Well....  It turned out to not be that good after all and is being returned as I write this.  We love pancakes and this griddle makes terrible pancakes...  Even after it is heated up on high temp and appears and smells like it is smoking hot, the pancakes seem to take forever to brown up...  They turn out a pale yellow and stale looking..  Normally pancakes will bubble up on a hot griddle almost instantly and if not turned over soon they will get quite dark...  You dont have to worry about dark pancakes on this griddle.. We think the problem with this unit is that it heats up ok but doesn't maintain the temp.  When the pancake batter is put on it cools the griddle plates down and takes too long to heat back up.  It probably works ok to heat up sandwiches...  We are wondering how well the "waffle plates" work on this??? Can't imagine it would be any better and probably worse..  Also we didn't like that you can't control the temp of the top and bottom plates separately...  We want our WolfGang Puck Griddle back and Cuisinart can keep this one..

CommentsTitle: Cheap and brittle hinges, otherwise great
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2016
CommentsContent: This is my second grill of this type. I loved the first one but while opening it somehow the hinge on the back broke. The hinge is made of a cheap plastic type that is very brittle. Cuisinart did say they would replace it, once I sent it back at my expense and included a $15 check to have it returned. They do not sell the piece separately because the other end is inside the frame and you would have to take it apart to get to it.  Aside from that, I really like this little grill. I can fit two medium sized steaks and asparagus on the grill (one side, using as press grill) easily, but it isn't HUGE on the counter.  It heats of quickly and cooks evenly. You can also get a waffle grill which I wish I had known before buying a separate waffle maker, but I haven't bought the attachment.  This is a great little grill if you are just VERY careful with the hinges when you are flipping the lid around. The plates are easy to change also, non stick surface is good.  This is a 4.5- 5 start product if they would put good metal hinges on it instead of the brittle  plastic /metal composite that it appears to have now.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2019
CommentsContent: I really do like this griddle, but there are a couple of things that aren't as good as my old George Foreman. First, the grease from bacon does not drain as well and I find it on my counter more often than not. And it is not as big as the GF. Other than those two issues, I do like this griddle and use it often.

CommentsTitle: Great smokeless indoor grill that works as good as the best outdoor grills'..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2017
CommentsContent: This grill works great, actually I should say perfect'..On sear setting it grills just as good as any charcoal or outdoor gas grill. I used to really like the George Forman grills. Still do. I have several of them.  I just like this Cuisinart a little better...Easy clean up and doesn't take a lot of space on the counter.  Also, it does not make smoke when cooking like so many other indoor grills. Real decent product'. Highly recommend'..

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2009
CommentsContent: The Cuisinart GR-4 is simply the best grill/griddle I've owned. It is easy to use and so versatile we use it every day. It has convenient LEDs to indicate when the surface is at the temperature you selected. Instead of three static temperature selections (HI-MED-LO), the Griddler has a rotary dial so you can fine tune the temperature. It comes with both ribbed and flat grilling plates that are a snap to change. It comes with 2 drip cups and a nice scraping tool that is molded to the contours of the ribs to make cleanup a breeze.This particular model is perfect for 2 person households. If we're in a hurry and want a quick tasty meal, the Griller cooks both sides at once so we're only minutes away from grilled sandwiches with melted cheese and soup, quesadillas, a quick burger, the possibilities are endless.Suffice it to say this is one of the most value-added, time-saving purchases I've ever made.

CommentsTitle: The grill you just want to like so, so much ...  but you just can't. And it makes you so terribly sad.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2015
CommentsContent: I wanted to like it. I wanted to like it so badly. I kept it for over two years and kept attempting to use it hoping that it was just in a bad mood, or I didn't have it turned up high enough, or it would work better this time.The thermostat: a major, major problem.Expect all cooking to take forever. It'll reach the correct temperature, and then turn off. Wait five minutes for it to figure out the temperature's dropped, and then it'll turn back on. Wait another five minutes for it to get increase in temperature, it'll get where it's supposed to, and it'll shut back off. Imagine the world's worst electric stove top and you get something close to this experience.The reviews were so good I really thought it was something I'm doing wrong, or I had a bad unit. I really thought it had to be me and not the product. But it's not. It really is that uneven.The features are fantastic. At first glance looks like the best option on the market (especially when you add in the waffle irons). But it's not.

CommentsTitle: I would buy this product again.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2018
CommentsContent: This is small grill that doesn't take up much counter space and fits under the cabinet on the shelves. It is big enough to do 4 medium sized burgers. Make them as thick as you want but keep the diameter a normal size or they hang over the edges. I do have to flip things over once while cooking. For some reason the top part of my Griddler cooks way hotter then the bottom. Overall I am very pleased.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Very please, been looking at it long before I actually purchased it and finally pulled the trigger and got it. It looks very good in kitchen and works great! If your considering it GET IT, you won't be disappointed

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2015
CommentsContent: I was in the market for a contact grill since my family loves panini. When in a local department store I had the opportunity to compare this Cuisinart grill to the Villaware and several other brands. I chose the Cuisinart... even though it was the most expensive model! I love the retro design, the removable cooking grids, and the front-mounted controls. It is heavy and well-constructed. The ultimate test came when actually using the grill, and it delivered! Heated up quickly, cooked perfect panini, and cleaned up like a dream...even the puddles of melted cheese wiped off with no effort. I highly recommend this item.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2017
CommentsContent: We do a lot of RV traveling and have typically always carried a small (messy, stinky) BBQ. We thought we'd try this Cuissinart as a new approach to grilling and, so far, are VERY pleased! Last night we cooked fresh asparagus and turkey patties on the grill plate side - DELISH! Tomorrow we plan to make pancakes and eggs on the griddle sides. We can cook easily outside with it (so no odors inside) and clean up is a BREEZE because, once cooled off, the plates come off for an easy wash up in the sink! We're VERY happy campers! 😊😊

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: Quick and easy to use. We now use it 3-5 times a week. I am a hot sandwich guy and this makes it easy. The griddles clean nicely with little effort. And it adjusts to different sandwich heights nicely. I like it a lot!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this thing! I use it daily. Easy to clean. Cooks nicely.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2020
CommentsContent: We’ve used it at least 3 times a week for the past 2 years. Cooks evenly and easy to clean. Note* If food dries on heating plates, let them soak in water and dish soap wipe  w/ a sponge. Never scrub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2015
CommentsContent: If you fry anything greasy and lift the lid, the grease on the top panel drips all over your counter top.  The George Foreman type grills are designed much better.  In addition, the bottom and top heat unevenly ALL the time, no matter what settings you use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2015
CommentsContent: I was envisioning a larger grill (I know, I know, read the measurements...) and was a little disappointed when I first unpacked this.  I've found that it does exactly what I bought it for, though - I've used it several times a week for anything from breakfast sandwiches to burgers to grilled cheese.  You wouldn't be able to make very quantities of eggs or lots of pancakes; if looking for a griddle to do that, you may be better buying a single griddle machine instead of an all-in-one.  The plates are VERY easy to clean and one of the main reasons I grab this instead of a pan when cooking - I just throw the plates in the dishwasher, and often they come clean without any pre-rinsing or soaking.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2011
CommentsContent: 1 star is too many for this product. We have Cuisinart pans and we are happy with them, but this was their first small appliance we bought - total disappointment. The plastic knobs do overheat, but what made us mad was that it totally ruined Mother's day - it decided to not work, and it was just the third time we used it. So no grilled stake on Mom's day.Warranty is of no use giving all the trouble to send it and pay shipping; the griddler part still works so we decided to stay with the half product we've got for the whole price. I opened it to see if it was fixable and saw that right under the heating element they have all the electronics - easy to see why it breaks so easily with all the heat burning the circuits. What kind of engineer designs something like this?Cuisinart is definitely crossed out of our list of quality suppliers. I recommend you do not buy this, it is a piece of junk.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Is very easy to use. Hard to clean grease and dirt out of grooves sometimes. Some spots get much hotter than others so you have to move food around to get it cooked evenly. Heats up fast and is best option for quick inside grilling. We enjoy it and would recommend. Bought a second one as a gift for someone.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This product is awesome!Great for burgers hot dogs steak any meat product. Easy to clean and store away. I quit grilling last year and missed the flavor of food on the grill. This has made a nice replacement.Buy this

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2020
CommentsContent: We made pancakes and found the upper side of the griddle to be less hot than the main one.  No big deal, just know those pancakes take a little longer.  Excited to grill chicken tonight.  Love this one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I am updating my review. When I loud noise I heard was the circuit blowing. I am not sure why that happen. The grill still works good. I would recommend making sure nothing else is plugged near it. I do recommend buying Crusinart 5 in 1 grille. It is great for breakfast meat or veggie meat. And it is great for seafood and vegetable!

CommentsTitle: BEST INDOOR GRILL I'VE EVER OWNED!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2019
CommentsContent: Temp control & indication of heat level is fantastic! Cleans up like a dream with next to no effort! Rinses everything right off. 100% love this (griddle) grill!! Highly recommend to anyone who just wants good food cooked quickly, correctly, easily & doesn't want to have to worry about a ridiculous clean up. Seriously, with warm soapy water everything pretty much rinses right off.On a side note: this is the longest review I've ever written about anything. I believe in & recommend it that much!

CommentsTitle: Will see if I can use it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2018
CommentsContent: When I purchased this item, I had planned to grill lamb chops and rib eye steaks. However I  realized you could not grill meat on this griddler if the meat had bones in it. However, I will keep it for grilling hamburgers and steaks with no bones.It is a little heavy for me to use now because I had surgery on one of my hands. However, when my hand heals I will use it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Third one of the same kind I have bought, use it a lot to grill food.  It does a great job and is easy to clean. Faster and cheaper than an oven and makes the food, no matter what you are cooking, taste great!

CommentsTitle: I wanted to make waffles and be able to poor plates in the dishwasher
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2015
CommentsContent: I had a nice Krups waffle maker. When it came time to clean up, because the plates were stationary; I worried about ruining it. So thankful when I received a notice from Amazon about this. I wasn't even looking, but when I got the email I couldn't pass it up--I got this because it has changeable plates. I wanted to make waffles and be able to put plates in the dishwasher. I bought the waffle plates, a cook book, and some grabbers. I didn't need the book or grabbers. It came with some recipes and a sm remover that worked just fine. Were not panini people, but looking through the recipe booklet that came with it, I'm thinking this will be great for grilling steaks inside.

CommentsTitle: I use it, begrudgingly.  Can't wait for the weather to warm so I can use my regular grill again.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2018
CommentsContent: I have yet to make a good burger on this grill.  They always come out tasting dry and flavorless.  Granted, I use a leaner meat....  I will revise once I have a change to make a really fatty burger, but if you are trying lean meat, this just cooks all the juiciness and flavor right out of it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2013
CommentsContent: I waited to make my comments after I have used it for awhile. I can tell you our Cuisinart Griddler is a handy unit! Quick BLT's Cook Like 4 slices of thick bacon in about 7 minutes. No splattering grease everywhere. Of course you must let the unit come to heat first.Slap the bacon in there close the lid prep the other goodies and wa-la! bacon is done.Talk about a nice quick burger maker. Pre-made burgers cooking time is around 5 minutes on middle of High on the dial.The cooking time is less than 1/2 the time verses using a skillet on a burner having to flip your food over. Cook your fresh caught Alaskan salmon or halibut steaks in like 3 minutes! Yum.....Oh yeah you don't need any oil on the surface-It's non-stick unit. One could still apply their favorite oil, butter, mayo, or spray on stuff.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2014
CommentsContent: Hinge is magnetic, so it does open to lay flat on large sandwiches.  My old one was permanently hinged which made the stuffing of my sandwich squeeze out - not with this one!  Did fish fillets with grilled fries last night.  Having the temperature control is excellent.  Only wished that each half could have individual temperature controls though, but its good enough.  Drip pan is a very ingenious design and doesn't require wiping down the appliance itself at all.  just pop the grills, drain the drippings from the pan and slam into the dishwasher - cleanup it done!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2018
CommentsContent: I just started using this perfect grill!  It cleans very easily and cooks perfectly!  Cuisinart is very good quality!  I already had the Panini maker that I liked very much., so when I decided it was time to replace my indoor grill, I knew that Cuisinart would be the perfect choice!  I brushed the grill with a light coat of oil before I used it because I have ruined other non-stick appliances by using cooking spray.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2013
CommentsContent: Just used my grille for the first time last night. Cooked 6 - 3/4inch boneless pork chops. The book that came with it said to cook the chops for 4-9 min. Took all of 7 min and they were perfect. I let the grille heat up for 10 min and when I dropped the chops on it, got instant sear marks both top and bottom. The controls also have a green light that comes on when it is hot and ready. Was going to use pam non stick spray but forgot to. Didn't matter. Nothing stuck to the grille. Had a George Foreman one and it cooked good but clean up was horrible. This one was so easy as the cooking plates come off of it and are reversible with a flat side.  Love this grille/griddler !!!!! Defiantly recommend if you are looking at it, buy it !!!! You will not regret it. You can also buy waffle cooking plates for it too. Wish I had known that before I bought a waffle cooker. Oh well. Now I can make more waffles faster.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2020
CommentsContent: This toaster is a gold for my breakfasts every morning. Love it. Only think I’d complain about it the exterior cover gets ridiculously hot even after you are done using it. I have burn myself with it several times. Other than that has been working great

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a christmas gift & I am very happy with it. I had to send the Hamilton Beach indoor grill back because the lid wouldnt close all the way & it was not well made. This panini maker is very nice & will make a great gift.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the best grill/griddle that I have purchased.  Very easy to use and clean.  The plates wipe clean with little effort and snap back into place easily.  I had a George Foreman grill before and definitely recommend this one instead!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this to replace our long flat griddle. I love that the plates come off and can be put in the dishwasher. I do wish it was a little bigger. My daughter thinks it doesn’t heat up as well as our old one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I just used it for first time and, child, let me tell you-this is the best investment I mede for the kitchen.I would give 4 and a half stars only cuz the bottom grill heating stronger than the top one, but not significant difference.Buy it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this product. I bought two for both of my sons while they are at college in their apartments.  VERY easy to use. They give great instructions for all kinds of food. Super quick and easy and it cleans up so nicely!In the future, I may get myself one when I don’t have an outside grill. It’s great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2016
CommentsContent: This Cuisinart Griddler is a great product, similar to a George Foreman grill. It's not too heavy, but is durable and seems like it would be very long lasting, especially if you take proper care of it. It's quick to heat up and very easy to use. You could be the worst cook and still fair well with this! It's also very easy to clean with removable plates and a removable drip tray. I love that new and other types of plates (think waffle) can be purchased for this Griddler too! Lastly, the system can fold as you see in its product picture or easily transition to a flat griddle surface for pancakes or crepes. Everything with this Cuisinart Griddler is easy and pretty self-explanatory. It was an awesome purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Easy to use, easy to clean and works well.A few reviewers mentioned the plastic buttons that release the plates breaking after a few years of frequent use.Hopefully I'll get more than that out of mine because I plan on using it perhaps 2-3 times a week.

CommentsTitle: Didn't get to use it myself...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2015
CommentsContent: I got this on sale, and I really liked it...although I never got to use it...My daughter and son-in-law visited from out of state, and they really liked it too, so I sent it home with them.  She loves to cook healthy, and since she feeds my granddaughter healthy meals, I knew she'd use it a lot more than I would...since I really hate to cook.  I'll just keep using my little George Foreman grill since when I cook it's just for 1.  It did appear much easier to clean and it has 2 sides to each element.  It's dishwasher safe and has a very good cooking area.  If I find it on sale again, I just may have to buy one for me!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2012
CommentsContent: The griddle has PLASTIC clips that hold the grille plates in place.  When I lifted the grille cover the HOT grille plate fell off completely.  The plastic clips had melted and allowed the plate to fall. Thankfully I was able to catch it with silicone tongs before it burned me or my brand new countertop.  I have other Cuisinart products and never had a problem with any of them.What type of engineering design would put PLASTIC clips on an item that gets hot!!If I could have given this a negative star rating I would have done soI am just grateful that I did not get severely burned or that my countertops did not get burned.  Right now my house SMELLS of burnt plastic.I will look for another grille.  Rest assured it will NOT be a Cuisinart

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2021
CommentsContent: The top griddle stopped locking into place. There is this little metal ball, that holds it in place. And after 2 months it stopped holding it in place. I tried to push it into place. And dented the machine and broke a leg on it. :(I tried to contact about a warranty and they never got back to me.

CommentsTitle: High-quality product; lots of cooking options
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2011
CommentsContent: I've had other counter-top grills before, but this one definitely ranks up there at the top. Grill and panini temperature controls and different cook surfaces make it easy to grill just about anything. The top also adjusts as it sets itself down on the food, so it grills evenly. And given the cook surfaces are removeable, cleanup is a snap either in the sink or by throwing the plates into the dishwasher. The only negative is the separate drip cup- It has to be lined up perfectly on the countertop or you'll have a mess (and it's easy for it to become mis-aligned when you're opening and closing the grill). It's also easy to forget to use it in the first place, but I suppose that's my problem because I'm just used to there being a pan underneath that slides in and out. That said, I think this product would be even better if it had a mechanism like that..

CommentsTitle: Terrible heat distribution, doesn’t reach max temperature
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this product based on a supposedly good brand and Amazon reviews but I could not be more dissatisfied.Cooking anything beyond a sandwich is nearly impossible since it doesn’t seem to heat up properly and it has terrible heat distribution between both sides.A complete waste of money.

CommentsTitle: Removable plates make this item a no-brainer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2012
CommentsContent: Having looked at several panini press before purchasing this one, I can tell you that this one takes the cake! Great stainless steel design, compact, yet durable and well-made. This is a great home and travel item for grilling, making grilled PB&J for the kids (and adults), and for cooking all sorts of things like sandwiches, burgers, and more.Most of all, I love the removable plates. Not only can you flip them around for flat and grill surfaces with a side-by-side option making this excellent for burgers and pancakes, but it is easily cleaned! Since most of the panini makers DON'T have removable plates, this feature makes this item a no-brainer. Seriously, if the idea of a panini maker caked with cheese, crumbs, and other food gunk makes you queasy, go for this one - you won't be disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2013
CommentsContent: We have had this for some time now and love it. We use it at least a couple times a week. its fantastic for bacon - cooks without curling and grease doesn't splatter all over the place. Cooks a yummy hot dog or hamburger when the whether doesn't allow for outside bbq cooking. Makes great grilled chicken too. I've actually used it for frozen chicken nuggets instead of putting them in the microwave or heating up the entire oven - just a few minutes and they are nice and crisp. I also have the waffle adapter and have made some delicious waffles on it as well. Can't say enough good things about this - just love it.

CommentsTitle: It's a versatile little grill/griddle. The grill plates get ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2018
CommentsContent: It's a versatile little grill/griddle.The grill plates get worn out after a while. DO NOT SOAK the plates! If water gets underneath the surface of the plates, they'll be ruined.I bought a second one when my plates wore out. It was cheaper than buying replacement plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this one. I may never grill outside again. New to panini as well and experiment with sandwiches. Better than other burger maker too, as you take the plates out and put in dishwasher or hand wash with no fear of getting cord in the water.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2013
CommentsContent: Bought this griller about two months ago after looking at it for about a year as a possibility. We bought a big RV recently and were looking for things that would make cooking on the RV easy and fun. This RV has a big diesel generator so we can have 120 volts any time we need it. However, we have started off using it at home in the kitchen and my wife and I have been delighted with this griller. We have used it approximately 15 times, primarily for grilling paninis which it does beautifully. We have been surprised that it does such a great job on steaks. All in all, we have been delighted by this griller and wish we had bought it earlier. This will definitely go with us on the RV and we will probably buy a second one to keep permanently here in the house.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2010
CommentsContent: I have used my Griddler two or three times a week since it was delivered in November.  It makes great grilled sandwiches, and is very handy for grilling fish, chicken, and hamburgers.  It also does a nice job on pancakes and French toast.  There are two issues that I have with Cuisinart.  One, the lights on the control switches are difficult for a tall person to see, and two, the overall construction seems to be a bit on the light side.  I do believe that with a little care in using it the light construction should not be a issue, and the location of the lights is a minor design flaw, and not even an issue for those under six feet.  On the plus side, it is fast to use, and easy to clean up.  I wash the removable non stick plates on mine by hand, but Cuisinart says they are dishwasher safe.  All in all I have enjoyed using the Griddler and would recommend it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2020
CommentsContent: We love this little appliance for home use and for camping. It's compact and easy to clean. I love the fact there are different removable plates for different items. They are easy to clean and allow me to have a single unit, instead of two or more, allowing for more counter space.
