The temperature is easy to control and regulate.I would purchase this again as a gift for someone else.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Spend a little extra and upgrade from that certain boxer’s grill. Thing this is awesome. I use it for quesadillas, chicken, hot dogs, grilled cheese, even steak!The best part is how easy it is to clean. Just pop the grill plates off and throw them in the dish washer: done.Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I really like this. I had a waffle iron that was very hard to clean so it finally broke and I got this multipurpose grill/griddle that is so easy to clean as the plates come out and you can flip them over for the griddle. I also got the waffle plates. It does not take up a lot of room.

CommentsTitle: It's very easy to forget that you own a stove if you ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2017
CommentsContent: I almost got a George Foreman grill and a waffle maker before I came across this unit that can do both. Waffle plates are a separate purchase, and the grill plates it comes with have both grill and smooth surfaces, allowing use as a contact grill or an open griddle. It's very easy to forget that you own a stove if you have one of these, because it will mostly replace your use of pans and cooks things in half the time when used as a contact grill.Just don't touch it when it's hot!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I love this thing enough that I'm on my second one. My only complaint is cleaning up after making something like fajitas. With it being open around all sides the splatter can also be on all sides.

CommentsTitle: Brilliantly designed, don't bother with 3-in-1, get the 5-in-1, it's worth it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2016
CommentsContent: Actuallly 4.5 stars. I had a 5-in-1 for 5 years and loved iit. Only probblem was eggs before solidying and grease going over the back; then it would sometimes get caught on the inside where the plates sat, and it was a pain to clean. Also, it was wobby and the plates were not seated levelly. Still, I used it all the time and loved it. Rarely used my oven. Even though I live alone, I like to cook and store, and it was large enough to cook extras for me or for guests.When I was tired of looking at the parts I couldn't clean, I decided to be cheap and try the 3-in-1. Big mistake. Even if you're single, I definitely recommend against it. It was wobbly, you couldn't regulate the heat, no two-sided plates and the plates had white gunk on it even after cleaning. All I could do was cook one thing.So I did what I should have done in the first place:  Bought another 5-in-1 and was pleasantly surprised to find that:- it wasn't wobbly- the plates were better seated (more firm, and level)- they had extended the over-flow tray in the backI've used George Foreman, two older versions, and they were a chore to clean. I don't see how you could beat the 5-in-1. It's a brilliantly designed griller/griddler, and I heartily recommend it for the following reasons:PROS- two-sided plates allowing for grilling and griddling, no storage of extra plates necessary- new and improved over-flow tray- space-wise is perfect (no wasted space) and yet could yield 8 hamburgers if you open the top to full extension- cooks eggs, pancakes, bacon, salmon, hamburgers, grilled veggies and more perfectly- you can control the heat- plates are removable and are very easy to clean . . . plus they hold up wellOh, and I just learned a trick wiith runny eggs:  Use the included grill cleaner's long side to "block" the runny eggs until they solidy if your counter isn't perfectly level like mine. :)CONS- wish they would extend the overflow tray to be wider in the backI love this machine, and I'm sure you will as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Love this little unit didnt have a grill thought I'd pick this up and it's great! Keeps heat well seems like the top is hotter then the bottom on mine. Sears great hearts up fast and u can lay it flat for more cooking surface or flip the plates and make pancakes!

CommentsTitle: Good for the sale price...not original price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2018
CommentsContent: Was advertised at a very high price point on sale at 40% off.  If i had paid full price I would have been disappointed in material quality.  I say this because I was hoping for a thicker higher quality use of metal.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2020
CommentsContent: the machine i received does not heat up enough to toast bread.plus i cant get thru to the cuisinart phone number for info.

CommentsTitle: Husband loves it so much we bought another!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2018
CommentsContent: Got this during a lightning deal for a Christmas gift for my husband.  He LOVES it, says it's one of his favorite presents ever.  In fact, he likes it so much that when another retailer had them on sale, we bought another as backup.  Great for sandwiches and awesome for bacon.  I also bought waffle plates for it, can't wait to try them!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2019
CommentsContent: We love our new grill!  Love the versatility of it and size.  Does not take up a large space like our GF Grill did.  It heats quickly and very easy cleanup. Do not need non-stick spray and the catch tray is smaller and easier to remove and clean.  Definitely  a great purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2019
CommentsContent: As a single with a small kitchen this is great for searing and not too big to be impossible to store. Not equal to a gas Viking stove or a man at an outside grill (alas) it still works for me. Plus keeps my kitchen a bit cooler in the summer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2017
CommentsContent: The design seemed so promising, but it fails to deliver. It works OK for sandwiches, and it works well as a griddle, but as a grill, it fails. Due to the fact that the heating element only goes around the edges of the grill or griddle plate, it cooks unevenly. A piece of bacon on an edge cooks quickly and shrivels, while a piece placed in the center takes forever. Of course, this also applies for steaks or chicken breasts -- the edges cook way before the middle. It's a shame, because the clean-up is a breeze.

CommentsTitle: First unit defective, but replacement is working well so far
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2014
CommentsContent: The first time I tried to use my new griddler, I attempted to cook 2 filet mignons on the "sear" setting.  The green light (indicating the unit has heated to temperature) illuminated fairly quickly.  A little too quickly.  As I placed the steaks, it was obvious the grill wasn't hot enough.  I gave it a chance, though.  After 10 minutes, they were barely turning color.  I flicked some drops of water on the grill plates and they just sat there.  I returned the unit to Amazon, easy-peasy.The replacement unit heats properly and grills meats and vegetables as expected.  I'm looking forward to trying paninis soon. :)

CommentsTitle: Cooking with the Cuisinart GR-4 Griddler
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2007
CommentsContent: Let me say, right off the bat, that I am very pleased with this purchase.  I had been looking for months for an indoor grill and had done a fair amount of research before ordering this one.  This combination grill and griddle is the right size for my small family.  It is attractive, simple to use and easy to store.  I love the removable plates.  I just snap them off and put them in the dishwasher to clean. Last night I cooked salmon fillets on the grill.  I was a little worried about doing this - after all, good fresh fish is pretty expensive and I didn't want to overcook them.  Not to worry - they were done to perfection.  We have cooked eggs, pancakes, burgers, veggies and bacon on the griddler.  The bacon is super because it is not all curled up and overdone the way it sometimes is when cooked in a skillet. I am happy to recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2018
CommentsContent: What more do you need?  Get the waffle plates and you don't need to have a waffle iron.  I have already used it to make steak, asparagus, sweet potato slices, pancakes, tuna melts, quesadillas...The plates remove and clean easily.  A great Christmas gift.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2012
CommentsContent: We were so excited to get this and use it. The machine is heavy and well made, but the plates are light weight and very expensive to replace when you need to. The slant isn't quite right and the grease goes over in many places, not just the spout so you get a greasy counter to clean. When you have the griddle open so you can also use the top as a base, the liquid from that part does not fall into the drip tray, It drips just short of it. It's pretty easy to clean with just a sponge if you soak it for a bit but food tends to hang on in the creases and you need to use a brush or other tool (use very gently or the coating comes off very easily). The more we use it, the harder it gets to release the trays. It does cook the food well. You have to decided if the cooking quality beats the easy of cleaning quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2017
CommentsContent: This worked pretty well for 4 1/2 years, then mysteriously stopped working: the main power light comes on, but the plates don't warm up, and neither of the control knobs makes any difference. They don't have a repair manual, and they don't sell parts, so I can't fix it. Otherwise, it cooked ok with some uneven heating, and the plates are a little thin, so they gradually warp over time. The raised ribs on the panini side of the plates are not very high, so it doesn't give you quite the effect that more expensive panini presses do.

CommentsTitle: SO handy and easy to clean!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Handy kitchen appliance! Have made chicken, waffles, sautéed mushrooms, burgers, and more. Clean up is easy. This grill is going to be used anytime we don't want to fire up the big green egg.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2014
CommentsContent: I have been very happy with this purchase primarily because of the easy clean up. You can detach the grills and put in the dishwasher.  I however am hand washing them due to less wear on the nonstick surface.  I like that the grease moves to the side groove of the grill and there is no overspill.  I had a little George Forman and the clean up was ridiculous; grease on the counter, and residue on the grill that was hard to get off.  I also like the versatility of the grill and the temperature range.  This is a wonderful grill!  I highly recommend the  purchase.  It is also more reasonable on Amazon than on other sites.

CommentsTitle: Out of all the kitchen gadgets I have bought, this is one of the best.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I have to admit, that I don't use it much for sandwiches. But, I cook sausages, steak, pancakes and every now and then sandwiches.  I would buy another one when I wear this one out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I do not find that heat distribution adequate. Bottom grill heats up quicker and more intense than the top. Works OK not the greatest, probably should’ve gotten the smokeless power grill.  Seems as though you have to turn it up hard to get food to brown.

CommentsTitle: Cuisinart  Grill makes a great Paneni sandwich.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Our family loves these hot sandwiches made the Italian way with the Cuisinart Panini press.The griddle flips over to make their other favorite: pancakes. I order the largest Cuisinart mode.We all love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I've seen multiple reviews on this product. One included a professional chef. Alot of complaints about the buttons that release  the grill pl8s failing. As a meal prep kinda guy who uses this multiple times a week. I dont think ive used the buttons once. You can pull the clamps back by hand even easier. I have cooked burgers, steaks,salmon,wraps,lamb,made quesadillas,paninis. Pretty much everything on here. This thing rules! Just because a chef left a review is irrelevant.  This thing is much cheaper than most too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2018
CommentsContent: This kitchen gadget is amazing! I’ve grilled chicken, salmon & veggies so far but plan to use the griddle side to cook eggs & bacon for guests during the holidays. What a great buy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Had George Forman Grill that was getting old. Decided to try this grill/griddle and am extremely pleased. Have only used two times but know this will get a lot of use in our house.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2014
CommentsContent: This griddler is AMAZING!! I am shocked that it all works well and nothing was delivered to me broken. The first night I grilled shrimp and within seconds the tails were starting to cook, I put the griddler on contact grill and within two minutes my shrimps were cooked. The next day I made a panini and it worked great. The cheese was all melted and I saw those great grill marks. I cannot wait to keep on using this. The drip tray is great, makes for little clean up. This griddler comes with a small scraper and I like how it actually fits in the ridges of the grill. Sometimes you get grill scrapers and they don't even fit. My next purchase will be the waffle inserts and I cannot wait!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2021
CommentsContent: So far been fantastic! Love this panini press/griddle. Highly recommend especially if its as good as mine. Just works. Thicker bread has to be manipulated but it just works good.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2017
CommentsContent: Love this tool.  It's everything they say it is, griddle - grill.  The possibilities are endless with this machine.  Use your imagination to create anything you want.  Easy to clean, easy to use and easy to store away till next time.  I bought it because of the name and the dual controls.

CommentsTitle: Finally one I can throw in the dishwasher!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: It’s a great little grill! You can open it flat if you want to.  The grill plates are removable so when I’m done using it, I can put them in the dishwasher and it comes out like new!

CommentsTitle: Panini Press pressed all the cheese out of my half cooked sandwich.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I was really excited about this multi-functioning product.  My first experience was making a grilled cheese and it squeezed the sandwich so hard that the cheese ran all over the back exterior of the appliance.  One side was grilled and the other not so the heat distribution was not the same on each side.  I then called customer service, recording said 10 minute wait which was 50 minutes.  He said he could replace it and I just needed to send the cord back to them at my expense.  At my expense??!!  No thanks.

CommentsTitle: So easy to clean, so fun to use...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2019
CommentsContent: The non-stick surface is amazing -- even when we grill chicken with sweet chili sauce, the burnt (yummy) mess slides right off.  Overall, this is a simple, no-nonsense product that does exactly what we expected!

CommentsTitle: A professional machine small enough to use at home
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2014
CommentsContent: I picked this one because of the different knobs and settings.  The drip-pan is neatly tucked underneath.  The plates come off and are easy to clean and replace.My problem is when we made bacon.  We had the tray in the proper place but the grease went everywhere but the tray.  Instead of dripping down the back into the tray, the bacon grease dripped from one of the corners.  Not one drop in the tray instead it was all over the counter.  What a mess!We enjoy this grill, but if we cannot figure this out, it will be going back.

CommentsTitle: Un producto necesario para la casa
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2020
CommentsContent: SpanishUn producto que todo el mundo debería de tener en su casa. Es muy práctico puedes realizar prácticamente de todo. Calenta rápido. Las fajitas y sanduches quedan tostaditos ricos y adicional a eso es muy elegante su diseño. 100% recomendado

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2019
CommentsContent: This unit is great and use it to cook almost everything. The only thing I don't like is the plates don't line up when you close it and the unit isn't leveled so I have to lift the front a bit so it can drain into the drip pan.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2020
CommentsContent: So easy to clean. The bottom gets a little hotter than the top but still cooks great. The only bad thing is I wish the lid locked close. But its still a great product. Glad I made the purchase.

CommentsTitle: Top doesn't get hot, overall so-so for panini
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2014
CommentsContent: The panini press works pretty well, but regardless of settings - tried em all - the top plate doesn't get as hot as the bottom one, so you really have to flip your sandwich to get it evenly browned. I also purchased the waffle plates and they're pretty useless, for the same reason; the top just doesn't get as hot. The instructions say to use the griddle setting for waffles, but on that setting the top doesn't get hot at all. With the panini setting the top will get warm, but not hot. Flipping waffles? Silly! I'm going back to using my 1959 GE waffle iron with the cloth cord. Still works like a charm, even if moderately terrifying when the cloth around the cord gets hot!

CommentsTitle: Always on the counter we use it so much!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2019
CommentsContent: My husband LOVES this thing and so do I! We love making paninis at home. He loves making waffles too! Super easy to clean. We hand wash and place in the dishwasher if we don't need to reuse immediately. This thing stays out on our counter often because we use it so much!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2020
CommentsContent: this product is great as a grill as well as griddle for a family of 5-6it is easy to use and the grill part comes off to be  hand washed/ dishwasher safe.warms up quickly so fast snack preparation

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This was a gift for my mom and she is so extremely happy with it! My sister has one and she likes hers but doesn’t use it much. If my sister doesn’t give me hers, I will eventually buy one for myself - I need this in my life!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2018
CommentsContent: Update: Loved the product the first 3 three times I used it, went to use it for the fourth time and it didn't work comes on but heating element doesn't heat up. The only thing I can say is if you do purchase this product, purchase the warranty. Here it is a month later and it doesn't even work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This is amazing, cooks fast and does not over cook. Easy to clean, remember to use a nonstick spray on racks to make clean up even easier. I love cooking all different types things on her. Your imagination can go wild.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this press, it makes amazing paninis, grilled cheese and Ruben sandwiches. It heats quickly and you can even grill steaks or burgers and they come out very good. I would recommend it but be careful, there is not any heat insulation between the heating elements and to top of the case. I gets very hot and can burn if touched, watch the kids around it. Other than this I would have given it five stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Just cooked my first meal on the grill and was pleasantly surprised at how good the Italian sausage turned out! Didn't take long to heat up. The smoke detector did not go off! And the sausage had a nice "crisp" finish to it. Clean up was very easy! Just let it cool down and hand washed it. (Didn't have enough dishes to justify putting it in the dishwasher).I purchased this to take with me when I vacation in a condo and am very pleased so far with my purchase! I also bought the waffle plates which fit perfectly. Can't wait to use the griddle and waffle maker next!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2019
CommentsContent: A great grill. Had to replace an old cruisinart grill due to grill plates needing replacement after many years. Found it more economical to just order a whole new griddle.  This is a great product

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2016
CommentsContent: I wish I could rate this lower, I received it yesterday and couldn't wait to try it. Made a pannini but discovered there's some problem with temperature control. It couldn't melt the cheese unless I set it to grill. Even then, it would stop heating. The instructions said it would take 5 minutes to cook on high., it took 15 minutes before the cheese melted. The meat was cold.I tried to cook bacon and eggs this morning. It's been set to 450 degrees for 15 minutes and the bacon is just sitting there -- nothing happening. It is warm but that's it.Complete waste of $$.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought this to replace my griddle, George Foreman, panini press, and toaster oven/broiler.  It functions well for all of those (I never used my toaster over to toast, only to broil) and takes up way less space than the 4 separate products I had before.  It cleans easily.  The only "con" is that the cord wraps for storage, but there's no tab-thing on the cord to secure it, so it unwraps rather easily.  It would have been nice if it locked closed as well so I could store it upright instead of flat so it would have a smaller footprint in my cabinet and not waste the vertical space.

CommentsTitle: Loved it at first but the heating element on the ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2017
CommentsContent: Loved it at first but the heating element on the top half began to give out less than a year in, so you have to flip everything over, open it and look in doesn’t look done,  meanwhile the bottom is burning.

CommentsTitle: How did we live without this product?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2013
CommentsContent: The Cuisinart Griddler is in constant use at our home. We use it for toasting buns, making eggs, grilled cheese and any other sandwich that we would like to serve hot. It works great for grilling burgers as well.  We have used it as a flat surface to make multiple pancakes for breakfast which got everyone fed a lot faster than using a pan.  The plates go in and out very easily and clean up is a snap with the non-stick surface and the ability to put in the dishwasher.  The temperature is constant and easily adjusted.  We also bought the waffle plates and love that we could use the Griddler for even more uses.  Highly recommend this great appliance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this unit last Christmas and it has been a force to be reckoned with. I even bought the waffle plates and they work like a charm as well. Being able to make chicken and waffles on the same appliance is amazing. Plus all the other delicious meals you can make.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2013
CommentsContent: So far, I've only used this to make paninis, and it's perfect. Takes a few minutes to heat up - a little more time than it takes to assemble a simple panini (sample: sour dough slices, roast beef slices, mayo, sauer kraut, and cheese slice). Press for 30 seconds and then cook for another 3 minutes. Turn it off. Lift the grilled panini off and cool on a rack for another 3 minutes before slicing diagonally and enjoying. Butter (or apply olive oil) the outside of the bread for added flavor. Once cool, the grill plates are easily removed and cleaning with a sponge and soap is a snap. You can make several in a row, but once cooled, clean so you don't end up with black burnt bits on your panini.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2013
CommentsContent: We have used this tool for everything from grilling fish and steak to making pancakes.  Everything went well.  A slight negative I have is that the griddle takes quite a bit of time to reach full temperature, but then it works well.  Another issue we have seen after a couple of months is that the top heater does not seem to heat as hot as the bottom heater.  That means some uneven cooking, especially when the top is turned down to cook something like pancakes.  Those on the bottom heater get done quicker than those on the turned down top heater.  As long as you know this, you just turn those quicker so you can get around this issue. That the plates and the drip catcher come out to put into the dish washer is excellent.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: This is the 2nd grill I purchased and I love it. I have cooked steaks, chicken, pork and Hamburg’s and it beats going outside to grill. I also have cooked eggs and pancakes on opposite side. Would recommend 100%.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This Cuisinart Griddler replaced one I had bought at a yard sale. I must say that it’s a big improvement over the older one. It’s heavier and better made, easier to clean after grilling.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2017
CommentsContent: I gave away my outdoor grill... This little baby will spoil you.  Boneless Chicken breast in 8 minutes and when you cut it, the clear juice fills your plate!  Excellent for steaks, pork chops... You name it!  Beats stinking and heating up the house with a frying pan.  When do you even get those nice restaurant style grill marks!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this! In an apartment where we can't have a grill, no AC this is great when you don't want to turn on the oven. Cooks burgers evenly, chicken breasts, panini's. Then use the flat top for pancakes! Thinking about getting the waffle attachment too! It's awesome.

CommentsTitle: What's not to like about grilling inside. Great kitchen tool
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2013
CommentsContent: We had looked around for an inside grill and finally settled on this Cuisinart unit.So far it has done everything we wanted it to do. We are just waiting for the waffle plates to arrive so we can try that out as well.Regarding the panini process we like to pre heat the unit closed prior to putting the pannini in it and that way we get the nice grill marks on the outside.When used open as a double grill the bottom half seems to generate more heat than the top. Once you know this it's not a problem to tailor the foodthat goes on each. Having it open with the two grills means you can do the whole meal on one appliance. Definately an advantage

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I cook on this grill several times a week. Now both my children have one and we gifted our grand daughter this grill for her apt. at college. I love the design, quality of product and non-stick griller plates. Extra bones is that clean-up is a breeze.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2019
CommentsContent: I cannot use an outdoor grill where I live. But this indoor electric grill is fantastic and gets the job done in some ways even better than an outdoor charcoal or gas grill. I can cook fish, chicken, and steaks in just 3 minutes or less. And it's very easy to use and clean. A great product all around. I give it an A+.

CommentsTitle: This newer model was better than what I had with the grill that is ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought this years ago and had a compliment from my parents. So I bought this as a gift for them. This newer model was better than what I had with the grill that is detachable so  you can wash it or put it in the dish washer.The 1st one came in defective and when I contacted the company, they quickly resolved it by sending over a new one, which works perfectly.The price, quality,delivery and customer service was great. Will order through this company again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2020
CommentsContent: We have used this to cook sausage patties, toast sandwiches, or grill pineapple slices.  It's an amazing small appliance.  So versatile with the reversible plates.  I love it.  It's also a breeze to clean.

CommentsTitle: since I can make the food I like and it taste good
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2015
CommentsContent: I just got this product and made "brick chicken"  from a baby corn hen.  Tomorrow I will see about lamb steaks.  :)Now, the original recipe call for frying brick chicken in butter with garlic salt an pepper... This device makes it much healthier and still taste right...See, since I can make the food I like and it taste good, I am keeping this gadget !  :)update 12/01/2015.  I figured out how to make good steaks on it, so now people are asking me for model number.  Other then boiling eggs, this is the ONLY appliance I use.  :)

CommentsTitle: Great for keeping your kitchen cool during the summer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I love the ease of using this indoor grill.  I've made chicken, salmon and pancakes on this neat little grill/panini maker.  It cleans up easily and is really a pleasure to use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a excellent kitchen addition. I hardly use my stove anymore. Even temperature and heat distribution and easy to controll temps. And the clean up is soooo easy!!! Total game changer for not only a single person but even more for a family!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2012
CommentsContent: I love this girdler! I'm not big on kitchen appliances for Christmas but this Cuisineart Griddler is superb.  I use it about twice/three times a week for paninis, grilling chicken and more.  Easy cleanup, easy prep.... Good quality dials with high contrast lettering/numbering makes it easy to select the function and temperature.  The non-stick grill plates appear to provide even temperature and cooking across the plate.  One caveat...the top seems to be a bit heavy which caused the panini sandwich to flatten a bit as it cooks.  If you place spinach or other veggies in your sandwich the steam from the vegetable moistens the bread.  Also don't use spread on the bread...it too makes the bread soft thus making for a thin panini.  I'll have to buy another for my RV cause it's that easy, fun and delicious.  Amazon had a good price on this too...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2019
CommentsContent: My husband bought me this for Christmas and I loved it! Used open face as a grill and a griddle and used to make paninis very convenient. After about 2 months went to open it and make paninis and the hinge on the side just broke off so we had to throw it out, very disappointing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2015
CommentsContent: This is a really nice addition to the kitchen. My one daughter uses it once or twice a day! We grill paninis, I've made eggs, I've cooked chicken breasts and pork on it and it's just great. Easy to clean. The only reason I give it 4 stars rather than 5 is because I had to return the first one because the top plate didn't always stay in place on one side. The replacement unit is better but not quite perfect, I sometimes have to jiggle it a bit to get the little arm to hold it in place but other than that it's really great. Amazon did a return/exchange very quickly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2015
CommentsContent: We love this griddler!  So much so, that when we had to replace it, I went back to the exact same model.  We use it primarily for paninis - not fancy, but even a grilled cheese is better cooked on this.  My husband makes plenty of hamburgers on this, and we've used the flat pans for eggs and pancakes.  I've heard that are waffle inserts, so I have to look into that one for hubby's birthday.  The operation is simple, and the machine is sturdy.  Ours was treated quite badly for a time - hence the replacement - otherwise, I believe it would have lasted much longer.  It is a bulky appliance, though.  It's a rounded top with the handle sticking up above it, so you can't stack on top of it.

CommentsTitle: so far i love it. the only negative thing i can say ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2016
CommentsContent: so far i love it. the only negative thing i can say about it is that it fills in with liquid in a way that the tray is to full when trying to sear or grill to meany peaces  of chicken or more then 2 burgers at the time. u just cant load a full tray at once.  works great with toast. the body does  get very hot  to touch, so careful touching any part other the the top lift wail cooking. easy to clean, u better use a soft brush for easy fast cleaning. the hinges in the back did get dirty from grease, i was not able to clean it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2012
CommentsContent:
I take pride in my pancakes,  striving for a delicious, fluffy, uniformly golden brown, chimerical perfect circles.  This past christmas my wife gave me two gifts to aid my quest for the perfect pancake... this griddler and 

  
Tovolo Pancake Pen









  
  
    
  .  For pancakes this Griddler certainly does the trick.  It is easy to use and quick to clean (the non-stick cooking surface pops out easily).  The pancake pen helps to achieve the perfect circles I'm looking for.As with some gifts given by a spouse, she bought it for herself as much as for me - but she uses the panini press more than anything.  We use it primarily with cibatta bread and it does a great job with paninis when the right amount of pressure is applied.  I follow the cooking instructions that came with the Griddler and the paninis consistently come out great.The way it is designed allows you to set it up in many different ways as described in the product description.  The only flaw I've noticed so far is that the drip tray doesn't work as well as I would like.  It is designed so the grease is funneled to the drip tray; however, I've found that it doesn't always follow the desired path and occasionally doesn't wind up in the tray. Overall, great purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Do not buy this product - or the waffle plates, either. The heat is erratic; the upper plate does not even get hot enough to put grill lines on a piece of bread! I ordered this right before the virus "lock down" and wasn't able to try it out until the end of July! Unfortunately,  too late for me to find out that this is a good brand name on a piece of JUNK!! I have used it once, today, and tomorrow it goes to the dumpster.  I would not wish this junky thing on anyone! Don't say you weren't warned.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2016
CommentsContent: Awesome device.... Took me a little while to get the knack of getting it open as a full grill. Cooking plates are super easy to reverse, remove, and I also got the Waffle plates. All plates appear to be of high quality and go in the dishwasher easily if you decide to not just wipe them off. Drip pan is super efficient and slides in on an angle so there is no slipping and no spilling.It removes easily and is of high quality as well, and I am not easy to please.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2015
CommentsContent: Cooks fast, easy cleaning, attractive.  I've gone through 4 Hamilton Beach grills, the last two family size.  We use our grills daily.  The HB grill had a 15 min. timer and was larger.  We loved it but they quit making that model.  I bought the Cuisinart because it was similar.  However instead of a timer there is a temp. control for the griddle side which makes no sense to me.  It's a grill, not an oven.  I really miss the timer which auto cut off the grill.  The grease cup, removable grills and both surfaces cooking sold this one for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2014
CommentsContent: I recently bought this griddle/panini maker and might ultimately give it 5 stars, but I've only had it for a short time and so I don't know about the reliability and extended quality of it. I've used it a couple of times for panini making -- I'm so happy with the ease of use and the terrific sandwiches I've made with it! It's very fast, easy to use (read the manual, tho), and clean-up is very easy as well. I would recommend it. I bought this model because it was on sale, the price was good, and I got free shipping with my Amazon account. My daughter also has one, which I tried and liked -- another reason for buying the Cuisinart.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this grille, from making panini, wrap, grille chicken and other things.  this grille is amazing, it works as describe , i haven't had any issue with it yet. i take care of it. i wash the plate as soon as im done with it . the plates are removable which is nice . they're non sticky which makes easy to clean. . I just need to buy the waffle plates and ill be good to go

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2018
CommentsContent: This product came defective. I have included pictures. I’ve only used it twice - once to make eggs which worked well (season for the two overall stars) the other to make a panini sandwhich which didn’t cook evenly at all and took forever - I don’t recommend this product - I plan on returning it and getting my money back

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Dandy grill and griddle. Heats up very quickly. Easy to disassemble to clean. Easy to reassemble. I’ve used with chicken and steak in different styles and cuts with great success.

CommentsTitle: kitchen appliance that actually gets used often
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2016
CommentsContent: Works well, heats up evenly. The removable grill plates make this much more practical than my previous press. Cleanup takes almost no time. I use this much more often than my previous one. The  grill area is enough to make 6 hamburgers. The drip tray is large enough to catch quite a bit of liquid. I do wish this had locking lid and a back designed so you could store it standing on it's backside, but i'll take the removable plates over storage position any day.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2020
CommentsContent: It is easy to use, except it smashed my grilled cheese sandwich flat.  I thought it had a setting that kept it from putting full weight on top part, but I can't seem to make it do that. I still like it very much and would buy again.  It makes a good steak.

CommentsTitle: Great for panini, not so much as grill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2017
CommentsContent: The first one that was delivered had some issues where the top grilling plate was not hold securely by one of its latches so there was a risk of it falling off. Returned that one and got a bundle deal of this griddler plus waffle plates for less money. This is our first time doing panini and they turned out fine, with a good crust and cheese melts inside before the bread is scorched. Easy cleaning because you can remove the plates. Warm up time is a bit long - about 3-5 minutes so you have to remember to turn it on before you start assembling your sandwich.I think it is a bit underpowered for what it is advertised to do - tried grilling marinated chicken breast and then steak and both look more like braised than grilled. The green light (ready to cook) goes dark once you put a steak on it and it was never green again during the cooking. Looks like this steak was too much for this grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Unfortunately, this doesn’t actually make crisp paninis and leaves your bread soggy.  Had to replace an older Cuisinart grill that worked great for years. This is definitely a cheaper quality and does not work like old one. Tried to make paninis three times with no success. It is being returned.

CommentsTitle: I use this (with optional waffle plates) at least once a week, with the "What to Waffle?" cookbook. A+ for Ease of Cleanup & Use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2016
CommentsContent: I bought this to use with the marvelous "What to Waffle?" cookbook (sold on Amazon). I also purchased the optional waffle plates (sold on Amazon).This product is every bit as good as the positive reviews promised: easy to clean, easy to switch out griddle/grill/waffle plates, easy to store. My young son and I have had a lot of fun using it with the "What to Waffle?" cookbook. I am going to get my Dad one for his birthday!

CommentsTitle: We absolutely LOVE this! In the winter
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2017
CommentsContent: We absolutely LOVE this!  In the winter, it is great to use this vs. weathering the cold outside to use the grill.  It cooks a thick steak in 6 minutes, chicken is very tender, and we could not be more pleased!  Recommend that you use a meat thermometer to get best results.  I bought this for my son and daughter @ Christmas and they too are sold.  So convenient that the griddles can be removed and easy cleaned in the dishwasher!  Nice gift at a great price!

CommentsTitle: Broke after 15 months of infrequent use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2018
CommentsContent: Worked well for quickly cooking salmon, which I probably did 2-3 times a month. Took good care of it but the non-stick coating did wear off in some places on the plates. 15 months after getting it, the red light on the power knob flashes and it won't heat up. There's a warranty, but I'd have to pay to ship it there, and add $10 towards shipping it back. Investing 1/3 - 1/2 of the value of the item to get it repaired doesn't seem worth it, especially when the plates are wearing out, and who knows what else could go wrong a month later.

CommentsTitle: Does the job, but weird plastic smell
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2013
CommentsContent: I was craving panini, so I bought this to make my own. It does a nice job, but I can't get over the plastic smell. I feel like I'm eating chemicals when I make a sandwich on it. And frankly, except for the design features (which are convenient), there isn't much functional difference between this and the George Foreman. But, if you're looking for something to accomplish counter-top grilling, etc., then by all means, this is probably the best one to get that won't break your bank. I just wish now that I'd bought an actual stainless steel industrial panini press, so I could make a panini without ingesting all of those non-stick coating chemicals.

CommentsTitle: Seems like a quality made product.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2014
CommentsContent: Have just used it twice and so far, am very pleased!! It was very hard to take a chance on something other than a George Foreman, which weve used for years. I liked the idea that we can use this as a grill and a skillet.  A little slower to heat up than the Foreman, but not bad. The plates come in and out very easily, which i love! Hope the non-stick finish lasts longer than the Foreman, that will be the true test. It is attractive and fairly small, so dosent take up a lot of valuable cabinet or counter top space.  Highly recommend this appliance!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2020
CommentsContent: it heats up quickly and cooks evenly and perfectly! this is the best grill i have ever owned and i have had plenty! i do live alone and this is the perfect size! i highly recommend this grill!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2012
CommentsContent: What in the world can I say that has not been said many, many times? This must be a good product if most of the reviewers are purchasers as well. But, here is my $0.02 worth. I bought a Crofton grill. It has no controls. Plug it in to turn it on and pull the plug to turn it off. It does have two lights. The plates are not removable and a major project to clean. I wanted removable plates and the ability to control the temperature in order to sear a steak to get a bit of flavor so I bought this Griddler. It is a winner. No point in my repeating the details. This cost about 4 times more than the Crofton and it is many more than 4 times better. You will love this Griddler. 'Nuff said, get you one. It has everything.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2019
CommentsContent: This cooked unevenly and was a greasy mess to clean. Disappointed with purchase.

CommentsTitle: The little Grill that could...and almost did!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2011
CommentsContent: Pros:1. Works as advertised - it is a grill, and, when the plates are reversed, a griddle. The plates are non-stick and easy to clean.2. Heats up a bit slowly, but, once hot, gets food ready surprisingly quickly.3. I love the fact that it leaves grill marks on the food.4. The steel casing seems to give it a classy look.Cons:1. The non-stick coating is rather flimsy - I scratched it while rinsing it under the sink faucet (it lightly grazed the faucet).2. The outer casing gets very hot - keep out of reach of children.3. A timer would have been nice. When creating a sandwich in the morning, it would have been helpful to have some preset timed shut-off feature - would have saved me the need to baby-sit the thing during busy mornings.All in all, I would recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2012
CommentsContent: I researched and read a lot of reviews for this grill and also the George Foreman. I wanted to replace my George with something more aestically pleasing.  I hated the look of a toilet seat on my counter so that was one of the reasons I chose the Cuisinart grill.  I'm happy with my purchase. I have cooked chicken breasts, hamburgers and steak so far on this grill and am happy to report that the grill heats up evenly and leaves a nice looking sear on the food. The grill plates are lighter than on the George but that doesn't seem to matter as the food comes out well cooked and hot.  The only thing I miss is a timer.  My George had a timer.

CommentsTitle: Great but be careful outside gets very hot!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Great, we love it. Easy to clean. But be careful don’t touch anywhere but the handle. It gets hot enough to burn you even on The outside, like the SSteel

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2019
CommentsContent: LOVE IT AND I'M USING IT IN A COMMERCIAL SETTING - IN FACT BOUGHT ONE FOR HOME AFTER USING THIS

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2015
CommentsContent: Once I figured out how the device worked, I was able to use it without any further problem.  The first problem I encountered was in opening the Griddler to the flat position.  There is a small lever on the right arm which is identified as allowing you to open the top half to a horizontal position, but I struggled quite a bit pushing it, and pulling it, and turning it in every direction until--purely accidentally--I felt it release the lock on the top half.  The instructions should include a clear explanation on how to use this lever to get the desired result.Subsequent to my purchase of the Griddler, I ordered the waffle-making plates.  I thought they would snap in place with ease as the grill/griddle plates had.  I found that the side clamps would not close.  I thought I might have to grind down the underside of the clamps so they would close securely on the waffle plates.  I knew that the odds were on the side of the manufacturer rather than on the side of a confused customer.  And I was right.  In examining the slots on the waffle plates, I noticed that there was a slim fin, which unlike the similar slots on the regular flat plates were not exactly in a center position but closer to one side of the waffle plate than the other.  When you positioned the waffle plate with the fins in the closer to the top position, the side clamps could not clear the fin to securely hold the waffle plate in position.  However if you turned the waffle plate over and the fins were in the lower position, the plates snapped into place.figuring this out nearly drove me crazy.

CommentsTitle: ... for a little over a month now and I love it. It has a small foot print so ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2016
CommentsContent: I have had the Cuisinart 5-in-1 grill for a little over a month now and I love it. It has a small foot print so it does not take up a lot of counter space, which is great for me because I have minimal counter space in my apartment. The cooking plates are easily removable so you can flip them over from grille to griddle or for cleaning. The plates have a good non-stick coating and I have not had any issues with any food sticking to the plates while cooking.

CommentsTitle: One if the prongs keeps popping open.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2014
CommentsContent: We use this many times a week.  Mainly for sandwiches.  We also purchased the extra waffle plates.  My one complaint on this, however, is that the right "prong" pops open and the plate becomes loose & pops out on that side.  This happens while it's heating up & during the grilling.  The thing is super hot of course by now, so you have the fun of trying to pop it back in.  If I would have purchased this locally I would have returned it for another.  I'm guessing not all have this problem, quality error I suppose.  We love it, so we will work with it.  But for the price I'm disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2016
CommentsContent: Definitely one of the best products I've ever picked up for my kitchen. The plates heat up evenly and are easy to swap in and out for different applications. Griddle breakfasts and their subsequent clean up have never been easier with the non-stick surfaces and removable grease catcher, all of which are dishwasher safe. The only thing stopping me from the 5th star in the rating was an issue with locking the upper plates in place. It takes a good amount of applied force to get the plate on the lid to sit properly without hanging off just a little bit. It looks negligible, but can and has affected the heating of the plate.

CommentsTitle: Works just maybe to much overkill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2019
CommentsContent: All in all not too bad. I sometimes use the cheaper one I have because it’s much simpler, and It also has a locking arm to hold at whatever pressure you want. Sometimes more complicated doesn’t mean better.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2011
CommentsContent: I was very puzzled by the disparity between reviews on this product.  People seem to love it or think it is junk.  I had to send the first one back as it did not open or close properly.  The 2nd one is working very well.  After reading several negative reviews, I was waiting for the plastic clips to melt after using it.  I've fried an egg on it, I've grilled a one inch steak, I've made countless waffles, a panini and a quesadilla.  Nothing has melted that I can observe.  Many of the problems I've read seem to involve the unit getting too hot or not hot enough.  I think that this is caused by faulty thermostats.  It's just a theory but it could explain many of the problems that people are having with this product.I've read that the grates are dishwasher safe but I handwash and dry them in the hopes that they will last longer with the extra care.  My boys love the waffles that I'm able to make with the waffle plates.I'm happy with it.  I'll try to remember to post an update later on regarding how it is holding up.

CommentsTitle: Better than the grill it replaced...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2017
CommentsContent: Love this grill.  After a few trial runs I tossed the GF grill out to the curb.  Having adjustable temperature is the big advantage and the plates / coating seem to be better.2/2020 update.  Just over 2 years of using this grill and the plates are worn but still going strong.  Hamburgers stick to the top plate now and I'll probably replace it.  Debating between a new unit and ordering just the plates.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2020
CommentsContent: This is great for grilled chicken, fish and veggies. The plates are easy to remove and clean.  Works as a panini press which makes every sandwich or quesadilla taste great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2015
CommentsContent: My wife wanted this for Christmas and I must admit, I kind of rolled my eyes at the idea.  But, I got it for her and now I am the one who uses it the most!  We've only had it about a week, but I've used it most every day...sometimes twice a day!  Couldn't be happier with it!  The plates are easy to pull off and clean.  We've grilled plenty of paninis, hamburgers, and even toasted some rolls.  Works like a charm!UPDATE: Well, we seem to have the same problem a lot of people do.  It wasn't more than a few months after I wrote the first review that the darned thing broke on us.  Something must have come loose on the inside because the plates never get warm enough to cook anything.  You can let it heat up for several minutes and still put your palm on it.  It was awesome while it lasted.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Make sure you test how grease will drain with water first. On the surface your cooking on. The drain slot needs to be bigger.  Grease was dripping out the sides. Was cooking hamburgers, so nothing but grease. To be fair on review.  Plus, first time I used it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2012
CommentsContent: I ordered this for my wife for Christmas 2011.  One or the other of us use it at least 3-4 times a week.  I usually cook Tilapia on it, but we cook burgers as well, plus panini sandwiches, and about whatever else we decide to.  You have to spice up the burgers a bit, or else they have that plain, stove cooked taste.  We're planning to get the waffle grids for it.  It isn't good for cooking eggs, due to the small space of each griddle plate.  Our full sized, regular griddle is much better for that.  Other than that, I expect it to be a regular member of our kitchen for many years.*Update: Got the waffle plate back in December 2012.  It is a wonderful addition.  We love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2009
CommentsContent: Since purchasing the Griddler we've made burgers, toasted sandwiches, blueberry pancakes and sausage (recipes included with appliance- YUM!) and tuna steaks.  What a time-saver and energy saver too.  Everything cooks quickly and evenly, (although the tuna was a bit over cooked simply because of cooking both sides at once, I over-estimated the time but will adjust next time).  We've used it for breakfast. lunch and dinner; we've used it on the kitchen counter and on the patio table in our enclosed porch-it works beautifully and clean-up is a breeze; let it cool and then either wipe down after toasting sandwiches or remove the plates and load in the dishwasher.  Easy, quick, we absolutely love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2018
CommentsContent: This is a great little counter top griddle. I purchased this to replace a very old unit that had died after 10 years. The removable plates are easy to clean, and it cooks nicely. The grease trap is well designed, and the multiple inserts lend themselves to many different recipes and uses.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: Very versatile. Cooks very well and evenly. Easy to clean--just put the griddle plates in the dishwasher. Griddle plates are easy to remove and remount.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Just arrived today and I’ve already used it! Cooked bbq chicken in 5 minutes grill style. I even temped it once I thought it was done and it came out perfect! Can’t wait to use this for Sunday breakfast as I cook for a lot of people on Sundays so this will really help out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2014
CommentsContent: This is a great multi-purpose griddler. Ours sits on the counter, as we are using it more and more frequently. It is extremely easy to use - we had to practice a bit getting the griddles off and on properly, but now it's a snap.  We also got the waffle plates. It was great to be able to get rid of one extra item! (Our old waffle iron) this griddler is also very easy to clean. The plates can go right in the dishwasher.One thing, for doing pancakes, the temperature needs to be turned up all the way. You'll get beautiful golden pancakes!I would not trade this for anything.

CommentsTitle: I love it so much I use it every day! Sometimes more!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Where has this been all my life? Perfect for making pancakes and hamburger patties! They come out perfect every time. So easy to clean and store too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2015
CommentsContent: I love this Griddler. I have a lot of Cusinart products and trust the brand.  I wanted one machine that had a griddle, grill, panini and waffle. The waffle plates had to be purchased separately. The price, even having to purchase the waffle plates separately, was very reasonable.  I almost didn't get it because it doesn't mention that the waffle plates can be bought separately (that I could find) and I wanted one that did everything.  II actually found the waffle plates accidentally, and was very pleased to find a machine that did everything I want.We have used it every weekend sine we got it and I love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2015
CommentsContent: This is a good appliance for making hamburgers and paninis on the grill, but the griddle side didn't work as well. I've made hamburgers twice already and they came out very well, but when I tried to make pancakes on the griddle with both sides open the top portion didn't get hot enough. So much for that idea, but if you do use it for pancakes, there is room for four large pancakes when the unit is open. Maybe I didn't start the griddle setting on high enough, but I was following the recipe booklet, so your experience might be different. Anyway, I bought it to make burgers so I'm happy. And the plates are easy to remove and clean...

CommentsTitle: The plates come off for easy cleaning. What's even more awesome is the drip ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2018
CommentsContent: This is a must have!!  Cooking time is cut in half when using this product!  Quesadillas, hamburgers, paninis, and even filet mignon!  The plates come off for easy cleaning. What's even more awesome is the drip tray that's embedded underneath for easy storage and less mess.  This is a great product for someone going to college, a wedding or housewarming present.

CommentsTitle: Incredible appliance at a great price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2015
CommentsContent: I can't say enough good about this product.  It is so handy to have around we use it much more than I thought we would, it has become one of our standard appliances.  We have a family of 5 and this keeps pace.The griddler is easy to use and cleans up nicely.  The griddle/grilling plates easily snap on and off, and we have not had any issues with them falling of as others have seen.Cleaning them is simple, most the time we try to hand wash but we have used the dish washer a number of times and they have held up with no problem.

CommentsTitle: Works great and easy to clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I've used it a bunch of times since getting it. I love it - easy to use and especially easy to clean. I used to dread cleaning my George Forman grill but this thing is a snap thanks to the removable plates. I have had no issues and it performs flawlessly.

CommentsTitle: It's great, but we don't use it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2021
CommentsContent: We bought it because our sons love grilled cheese sandwiches and even make them for themselves, but they refuse to touch it. I love how easy to clean it is. Trying to find ways of incorporating it more, because it does its job well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Yes, grills are removable and dishwasher safe. Makes for easy clean up. Good temp control. Lots of versatility. Yummy panini results. Good all around grill. Very nice product. Definitely recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought to replace a George Foreman that dropped and broke. We like the adjustable top for sandwiches and Panini's. Also bought it to take camping.

CommentsTitle: Skeptical at first, but love it now!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2014
CommentsContent: I had been wanting one of these for awhile, but kept talking myself out of it - until I saw tons of food bloggers boasting about it and posting photos of yummy looking paninis.  I originally bought this just to make paninis, but it has turned out to be one useful appliance!  For the most part, I really love it, but it does have spots that are hotter than others when I'm making pancakes, but it's not enough to be a nuisance. I haven't used it to make burgers or cook any meat so I can't attest to that.  It's on the large side, so I have to store it in a cabinet (I don't have a lot of counter space).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a repeat buy, i replaced one i had previously bought several years ago. We love it. We use it to grill indoors for burgers steaks chops etc.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2016
CommentsContent: This device is very versatile, easy to use, and easy to clean. I have used both the grill and the griddle sides. I saw in an earlier review a complaint about the device leaking. I did have this happen when I grilled a greasier piece of meat. It was annoying, but I did not find the mess to be too overwhelming. Otherwise, I have not had this problem (I buy mostly lean meat). I do not know what I would do with out my Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler! I use it at least a couple times a week usually!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2021
CommentsContent: Great little grill My second one. This has the rotational plates which I really like. Easy clean up. It does say you can put in the dishwasher but I won't do that this time around. Better on the finish to hand wash.

CommentsTitle: I don't think I would have purchased this if an old roommate hadn't been given one as a gift - I couldn't see the need for something like this. However
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2018
CommentsContent: Honestly, I don't think I would have purchased this if an old roommate hadn't been given one as a gift - I couldn't see the need for something like this. However, we used it frequently, and now that I've moved out and purchased one for myself, I use it at least 3-4 times a week. Grills fish, chicken, pork, burgers, veggies, etc quickly and easily, and the plates are super easy to clean. Also, I think its pretty easy to lug in/out of drawers/cabinets if you don't want it sitting out on your counter all the time. If you're on the fence about purchasing this, I'd say go for it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Perfect for single man during quarantine! I cook all my fresh meat on here almost nightly. Super easy to use and dishwasher safe. Only thing that doesn’t work great are pancakes because it’s angled back to the drip tray but i pretty much only use it for meat. Great product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2018
CommentsContent: We love this griddler.  We've used it over and over again since our son bought it for me for Christmas.  I love it so much I also bought the waffle plates for it.  So easy to clean, melted cheese wipes right off.  We've cooked steaks, hamburgers, sandwiches, waffles, eggs, lots of things on it and clean up is a breeze.  Highly recommend this machine and Cuisinart has always been a good brand for us.  This will be great in summer too, we won't have to use the stove.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2019
CommentsContent: Have only used as inside grill. Seems to work well. Bought one for my wife and I and one for our daughter. Daughter’s kid set this up and are learning to use for cooking.  Really like the fact you can remove the plates for cleanup!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve been able to step up our grilled sandwiches game. It’s great for meals for one or 2 when eating healthy so you can just do a quick meat, clean veggies and go! It makes weekend breakfasts easy, fun and quicker to clean up. Also doesn’t heat up the house.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2011
CommentsContent: The griddler has been a great addition to my kitchen.  I have had it for about two years now and use it about once a week.  My family loves burgers, paninis, and pancakes.  Making pancakes is a breeze when you open it up allowing you to cook six pancakes at a time.  Panini sandwiches come out perfectly crisp with the center warm and gooey.  Burgers cook up perfectly in about 7 minutes.  The only con I have is that the plates are shot.  The smooth plates have broken down to the point where I need to replace them.  It makes me wonder if we are eating some of that non-stick surface with every meal...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2019
CommentsContent: Tried many meats, but couldn’t find any that we preferred when using this griddle.  I’m sure it’s ideal for people who like grilled sandwiches or panini style.  There’s nothing wrong with it, we just prefer other cooking methods.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2020
CommentsContent: use it all the time. Doesn't heat evenly between top plate and bottom plate. Notice yesterday that heat Doesn't stay consistent when using it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Wow I love this thing. Awesome for apartment living and SO easy to clean. The trays are light weight and just so easy to pop on and off. I use it all the time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2019
CommentsContent: My sister in law brought one to our beach vacation and we fell in love. Best paninis. Even made pork chops and grilled a steak. All very good and easy!!We even bought the waffle plates later. Worth it!!

CommentsTitle: I found this on Amazon while searching for an exact replacement for what we had before and liked the added temperature functions
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2015
CommentsContent: We have used the George Foreman brand for years and needed a replacement when our last one with removable waffle plates died.  I found this on Amazon while searching for an exact replacement for what we had before and liked the added temperature functions of the Cuisinart.  This Cuisinart is the best indoor grill we have used.  I am very happy with this purchase, the food comes out evenly cooked and tasting great.  The waffles are even better in this 5 in 1 griddler as well.  Note: Make sure this is on an even surface so the grease drains properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2014
CommentsContent: We love the Griddler.  Everything cooks up perfectly. We grill a lot of fish, vegetables and panini's on it.  It is a snap to clean.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is too soon to see how long it will last.  If it works for 2 or more years, then I would give it 5 stars.I also bought one for my daughter-in-law and she also loves it, especially the ease of cleaning feature.I have also used the griddle sides to make pancakes and that also works very well, and provides a large surface so you can cook quite a few pancakes at one time.  I want to order the waffle plates soon.But my main use for the Griddler is to grill foods. Grilling is fast, easy and healthy using the Griddler.MSF

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2014
CommentsContent: This Griddler is far more Versatel and much, much easier to clean than the George Foreman I had! With the Foreman you have absolutely no control over temp settings. The Cuisinart  offers much more control depending on what and how much you are cooking.The removable/reversible grill/griddle, is a charm to use and broadens the type of cooking you can do with it. Clean up is very easy, just release the grill/griddle plates and wash. Be sure to not use any type of pot or pan scratcher on the non stick coating, stick with a wash cloth or sponge and these grills should last for years!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2013
CommentsContent: After reviewing several panini presses, I ordered this one and have been very satisfied. I prepare paninis 2-3 times a week, grilled cheese sandwiches once in awhile and have flipped the plates and made pancakes and eggs. Grilled hamburgers a couple of times. Everything works completely as expected. Paninis are great. Be aware that when grilling hamburgers be sure to check and empty the grease tray. I forgot the first time and after the second set of 4 burgers, the tray was completely full. Luckily, I caught it before it overflowed. This griddler is easy to operate and removing the plates makes clean up a breeze. I really like the top that articulates so thicker sandwiches are evenly cooked instead of having to be pressed flatter.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Good

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021

CommentsContent: We bought this to replace our old grill ( same model) and it is a huge disappointment.  I don't know what they changed but good luck trying to cook anything on it. Save your money or look for a different manufacturer with a similar product.  This one is headed for the trash. Such a disappointment.

CommentsContent: This is a great product - lightweight, easy to clean, versatile - and oh, yeah, it makes great sandwiches!We've had fun experimenting with different items - right now, one of our favorites is to split a croissant. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2014
CommentsContent: After a year, the plates rusted in the dishwasher. The cost for replacement plates from Cuisinart? $80. For two pieces of metal. The rest of this griddle is apparently valued at $4.95.11/30/2014 Update: Cuisinart has increased the price to $100 ($50/apiece) for the griddle plates (part #GR-4NRGP). At this writing, the entire griddle goes for $64.99, which tells me that I should go into the griddle plate arbitrage business, buying grills for $65 in order to sell the plates for the low, low price of $40 apiece (netting me an 18%--a tidy profit).

CommentsTitle: Not all that it should be
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2016

The open griddle does not work well at all.  Pancakes do not cook well due to uneven temperatures between the plates.  Great idea, the product just does not perform well in the multi-use way it is supposed to.  I am disappointed.  Maybe the company will improve this product to work properly as a griddle and then I could give it a 5-star rating.

CommentsTitle: She concluded that unit is bad and needs to be returned

CommentsTitle: I am in love with this griddler

CommentsContent: I am in love with this griddler!  between the dual plates that it comes with and the waffle plates I ordered with it, I have cooked at least half my meals on this thing since I got it. CommentsTitle: My Favorite Thing in the Kitchen
