CommentsContent: We absolutely love the Gridder! You can cook anything on it with no oil, and you usually just have to rinse it with water to clean it! It cleans easy, and is such a high quality product! I can make some killer omelettes on this thing, great sandwiches and waffles! It has been the most used item in the kitchen this year, and adds a healthy alternative to greasy skillets. You will not be disappointed with this purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Ive been using it quite often and am well pleased with it. Ive done burgers quesadillas and paninisAll yo everyone’s delight.I good little grill. It especially cleans easy

CommentsTitle: Best I had for red meat only
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the best I ever had to cook red meat.  So tender.  Not too good with chicken though...keeps leaving it dry.  And not good for pancakes.  Taste rubbery.  My griddle cooks chicken and pancakes better.  Easy to clean.  Takes a long time to cool down when done using.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2020
CommentsContent: This exceeded my expectations. Have used for burgers (4 quarter pounders at once) and panini. Cleanup is a breeze. No issues so far.

CommentsTitle: This was not what I expected
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2014
CommentsContent: I've used George Foreman grills for years, and I ordered a Griddler 5-in-1 because it seemed to be more flexible than the Foreman grills. Bigger grill, flippable to use as a griddle, and temperature control. I'm judging this as a grill, not a griddle. I hadn't seen a Griddler until I opened the box from Amazon. I wasn't happy with the Griddler:1) The case, particularly the upper shell, gets very hot. Hot enough to burn; I slightly burned myself the first or second time I used it. I'm used to a Foreman grill, which has a plastic top cover, which is not burning hot.2) The top of the unit is a part you have to handle a lot, as when you go to close the the unit on your food the first time you have to use a hotpad to unlock the top so that it floats free and doesn't squirt your food off the front of the grill. Every time you open the grill this swivels loosely, making it easy to burn your forearm. If you want to stop it swinging (and possibly dripping fat in back of the grill) you have to latch it upright, putting you back to the beginning when you want to close it.3) Having the cup under the unit and fill from the back is nice idea. What's doesn't work is the expectation that the grease will flow off the back of the unit and into the grease cup. The grill plate is flat, and the Griddler holds it flat. The grease pools on the surface instead of flowing to the cup. If the plate had a design which gave a slant to the grill this would work, but if that was done the unit probably couldn't be used as a griddle. The slanted design is what the Foreman grills started.I expect this unit makes a great griddle, but it's not a very good grill, especially if you cook food that has much fat in it.I have returned this unit to Amazon and purchased another Foreman grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2015
CommentsContent: This is a great little griddle.  I love how it can grill a burger or a grilled cheese sandwich, and also unfold, totally flat and make pancakes and french toast.  The plates are super easy to release and switch, and they seem to be nonstick, because they come clean with a swipe of the sponge.  The little fork-like scraper that's included is also useful for removing, say, cheese from between the grills.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2016
CommentsContent: Cuisinart GR4N first impression notes:Both top and bottom heating elements are hard wired in parallel, although the wiring to the top element is longer and of smaller gauge. This will make the top (lid) element run at a slightly lower temperature due to I²R losses. Both elements are cycled on and off by a relay on the "Griddle" circuit board (a rather puny one for 13 amps by my estimation). It seems that the "Griddle" temperature control knob cycles this relay at the temperature preset (controlling the temperature of both elements simultaneously) but it is unknown where the temperature sensing thermistor is located; there is no exterior wiring from the "Griddle" circuit board to a thermistor, only two wires to the 'lower grill present' safety switch. (If the lower grill element is not in place the unit will not heat.) We must assume it is mounted on the 'Griddle' pc board.There is a fusable link in the hot lead, which is wired to the 'Selector' switch. 'Selector' switch closure to "Griddle" energizes voltage to the element control relay contact. In the "Grill Panini" position, voltage is still applied to the control relay contact and additionally to circuitry which supplies the "Grill Panini" thermostat control. It should be noted that neither control is a true thermostat, merely potentiometers with LED's in the knob that are turned on by the 'Griddle' board circuitry when the desired temperature is sensed.It appears that the "Grill Panini" control is nothing more than a second thermostat potentiometer that is selected by the "Selector" switch in the "Grill Panini" position. The 'Grill Panini' knob circuit board has no second thermistor and is nothing more than a cross connect board and a mounting platform for a large ac capacitor, with all wiring routed back to the main "Griddle" board..Since both the lid and the bottom grill heating elements must operate by design as a single unit, it is unclear why a second "Grill Panini" thermostat is needed at all, which also brings into question the need for a 'Selector' switch at all when a mere on/off switch would suffice, creating a simplified unit with only a single knob.This is further confirmed by lid open or closed, either thermostat control will cycle the elements, depending on the position of the "Selector" switch, and they both seem to have similar positional symetry as to temperature in spite of the labeling.The heating elements are of good quality and the unit is almost completely metal, with few plastic parts. The internal wiring is all high temperature oven type wiring with welds for attachment. The two circuit boards use conventional components and do not look like they are high temperature rated (above 80°C), although the bottom case is vented and there is a second aluminum heat shield between the boards and the heat element lower tray.So what is the electrical difference between "Griddle" and "Grill Panini"? And why do we have a "Selector" switch?? Unknown other than sales pitch. I called Cuisinart customer support and they don't know either so don't waste your time. Use either one, they seem redundant.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2009
CommentsContent: Purchased this Griddler as a replacement to a GF.  2 reasons for replacement purchase: (1) capable of turning off with having to unplug it[GF biggest drawback] (2) Removable cooking plates [again some GF's has removable plates but I found none with on/off]This is a great product.  Cooks very evenly on both sides with excellent temperature control (ie. things cooked on the stove uses the same temp on the GR-4).Have not actually used the griddle side but if it cooks like it does with meat products, I should be very pleased.The only drawback with the GR-4 is size.  It is considerable smaller(lid closed). The GF could cook 25-33% more product.  Maybe Cuisinart will make a bigger one in the future.I would recommend this to others for general everyday use.  Large gatherings would be an issue.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I can cook so many things on this and am sure there are many more things it can be used for. ex. burgers, hot dogs, chicken breasts, grilled cheese, eggs, and bacon.

CommentsTitle: Would not want to be without it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2014
CommentsContent: We had an older model of the grill that we used almost daily.  However, after a few years of that heavy use, the grill plates were no longer coming clean. We opted to replace the entire grill rather than just the grill plates.The new model is somewhat different than our earlier model. On this one, the grill plates are lighter and reversible (one side ridged; the other one flat.) our older model had two different sets of plates. The old plates had grease drip spouts and it came with a plastic cup to catch the grease. The new model simply has a continuous lip round the grill plate. The lack of a spout is no big loss. In our use of the earlier model, the grease cup rarely had anything in it and never very much. The earlier model had distinctively different top and bottom grill plates. The new ones seem to be interchangeable.The big performance difference is the cleanability of the grill plates. I use rubs and seasoning on meats that stick to the grill plates (as well as other cooking items). This model comes with a heavy plastic scraper that makes cleanup an easy process.We use ours primarily for grilling meat - boneless pork chops, burgers, chicken breasts, steaks. It does a great job.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2019
CommentsContent: takes forever to preheat.  the griddle does not lay totally flat.  the pancake in the pic was on the griddle for 20 minutes after the 20 minute preheat.  i felt like i could have left on max temp all day and it wouldn't have burned.  not my style maybe someone at goodwill will have better luck.  i don't know what wirecutter website cooked to give it such a good rating.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2019
CommentsContent: My mom asked for this griddler specifically to solve the problem of malfunctioning community grills at their condo. No more grilling outside, because she LOVES this for burgers and steaks.  She's thrilled at how easy it is to clean, too!

CommentsTitle: It was good while it lasted
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Broke after 5 years. The electric cable inside overheated... although I liked it I will not replace, 5 years is too short of a lifetime, not environmentally friendly in my opinion. I will get stove top cast iron grill instead, they will last me much longer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2014
CommentsContent: The grill works very well.  The grill's contact plates are held in place by metal tabs that seem very durable.  The area of the cooking surface is not as big as it seems in the photos.  Also it does not drain as much grease as other contact grills with contact plates that have deeper grooves.  It is easy to clean and it heats up quickly.  I typically grill lean meats or burritos on it.  I also use the optional waffle plates to make waffles.The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because of the size of the cooking area and grease drainage for fatty cuts of meat.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I was looking for a grill/panini maker that would look nice in my kitchen as well as work well. This grill does the trick. I have made paninis, grilled steak and chicken and everything has cooked nicely. And I love that my kitchen doesn't get all smokey.  I only gave it 4 stars because it is NOT a cool touch exterior and can get very hot. Also, I feel like the cooking temp is not as hot as it should be so I need to set the temp a little higher than normal to get the result I want.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2014
CommentsContent: Does a great job on burgers, chops and so far anything I've tryed to cook, my biggest issue is when I cook I do extra to eat on because I am on the Atkins diet and the drip pan fills quickly, it's alright for a couple of burgers but when you cook like I do it's troublesome, my solution I take the drip pan out line a Pyrex dish with foil and straddle it with the griddle , this makes a huge drip pan , sometimes drippings run out the sides a little but so what I just clean it up when finished if you cook you make a mess,  love the removable plates and they clean up great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I had purchased a Quisanrt griddle years ago.  I loved it!  In fact I wore it out is the only reason I had to get a new one.  This new one is a cheap piece of plastic, lightweight and poor quality.  I would not buy it again, it was made in China and was made cheap

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2020
CommentsContent: we gave up  our grill to downsizethis works greatthe only thing i don't like is it has to cool before you can lift it by hand

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2013
CommentsContent: I do love using the griddler for many different meals.  Sandwiches being only one of them.  I cook full breakfast on the grill when fully open.  Bacon, eggs home fries all together without the need for other pans.  I cook chicken, burgers, steaks and even fresh vegetables when needed.  Easy to clean with the removable surfaces.  They clean up with soapy water and the grill itself stays neat and clean with the use of their smart grease dripping arrangement.  It was one of my best buys and at a great price.  I would recommend it to any who want a nice easy cleaning appliance that does a great job of cooking and keeping the kitchen tidy.

CommentsTitle: The appliance is easy to operate and clean

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2018

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021

CommentsTitle: We will be returning this product.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Very disappointing. This product has a drip tray but it doesn’t catch the dripping from the top grill plate. When you lift the lid all dripping run down the back side and all over the counter. As long as the grill is closed the drip tray catches all dripping but when you lift the lid it drips down the backside. I was very disappointed in this flaw.

CommentsTitle: Very easy to use and clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Omg!!! For the price, this is awesome!! I’ve made paninis, steaks, and pancakes. It came out looking as if it was bought. Love it!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2012
CommentsContent: After reading all the reviews, both good and bad, I decided to go ahead and order this Griddler. So far it has met my expectations. I especially like the Panini press feature. Hamburgers, chicken tenders and chicken breasts have all been good. Pancakes on the hot plate were slower than my previous griddle but were cooked satisfactorily. The only problem so far was a mechanical one. After the second use, while removing the plates for cleaning, the plastic retainer around the upper plate release button, fell off. It would not stay in place after this until the metal tabs on the retainer were spread out. The griddler has been used 4 times since then with no further trouble.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2011
CommentsContent: I bought this and have used it a couple times now and I have to say, I am very impressed.  The construction is very sturdy and in-line with Cuisnart quality.  It is very sturdy, easy to use and heats evenly.  Food tastes great and the integrated drip tray that slides inside the bottom of the unit catches a lot of unwanted grease.  The removable grates are easy to clean and a quality non-stick material.  I had no problem grilling salmon with the skin on.  It didn't stick whatsoever.  My sister has the former boxer's grill and by far, this one is built much better.  I am  very pleased with this purchase, even if it does cost a few dollars more.  It is worth it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2013
CommentsContent: The whole idea of a 5 in 1 appliance is very attractive for anyone with a small kitchen, and this is one so far works very well. Makes panini sandwiches, waffles (purchase the extra plates), pancakes, hamburgers - in fact anything that you would cook on a flat or ribbed surface. It's easy to take the square cooking "plates" out for cleaning, too. I am heeding the reviews of others who indicate that the non-stick coating on these plates chips rather easily. I don't scrub, I don't use metal utensils, and I definitely don't put it in the dishwasher.Recommended.

CommentsTitle: Plastic Tabs Will Break.  Newer Version Has Metal Tabs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2012
CommentsContent: We bought one from Amazon and loved it, but the tabs that hold the plates in place broke on the very first day.  We later found many online reviews complaining about this.  We returned it (love Amazon's convenient return policy), but because we loved the grill, we decided to buy another one from C***co.  To our surprise, the new one looks identical, but it had metal tabs instead of plastic, so obviously Cuisinart has discovered this flaw and updated the product.How can you tell: If you have black tabs holding the removable plates down (there are four of them, one on each side, top and bottom which are released by pressing the button on the side), then they are plastic.  The new ones are shiny metal.  In fact, the entire assembly underneath, of which the tab is the end, is now metal.  The pictures on Amazon for this product, as well as on the Cuisinart site show the black plastic tabs.In the previous version of this review, I had said it was the same model number, but I retrieved the box and it is in fact a different model no - GRID-8NPC.  I can't find that model listed anywhere. Its possibly a C***co only model no, but there was otherwise absolutely no other difference we could see.I have uploaded a picture of the new version.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2019
CommentsContent: I had two of these and they break within a year!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I like the functionality. You can use as waffle, then panini or plain grill. Easy to clean also. I bought the waffle grills separately. No issues on waffles and pancakes. I tried grilling the zucchini and had to cut round instead of strips to help it cook faster. It took a bit of time but it got the job done. I laid the grills flat and instead of enclosed.  Overall, I am satisfied.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2018
CommentsContent: I picked this model because I wanted a thermostat. That it has but I can’t see that it is accurate. The plates are small, about 8x10 inches. The unit doesn’t sit level. If I was you I would chose a different brand

CommentsTitle: The lid is a little tricky.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2014
CommentsContent: It is a nice product, but the lid leaves a little to be desired.  It does not easily transition from a flush close to an elevated close.  I found it cumbersome and difficult to maneuver.  The biggest issue is trying to adjust its position while hot.  Additionally, the griddle feature would not lay completely flat without a bit of effort.  The reviews compelled me to buy the product, so perhaps I just received a defective item.  I sent it back.  Cuisinart often produces an impressive product, so I'm hoping they revisit the lids design.

CommentsTitle: Get that cooked out flavor with the ease of being inside.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: The Griddler is great!  I get the taste of cooking out with the ease of being inside!!! Cleans up with ease, dishwasher safe!

CommentsTitle: easy to clean and way more versatile than other models
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2021
CommentsContent: love it!  only challenge was cooking some bone-in chops and i was concerned boneless portions were not cooking as fast.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve only had it for a few days and so far it cook my steaks eggs and bacon pretty well. The only thing I do not like is the knobs for the temperature control seem very flimsy I wish they were better quality and had more of a resistance, they don’t feel like they are accurate temperature wise.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This thing is great.  If I don’t want to use our Blackstone on the deck this works perfect.  Ideal for just the wife and I.  Cleanup is easy. Amazon gets our orders out to us quickly.

CommentsTitle: Nice grill, love the reversable/removable plates
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2015
CommentsContent: Nice grill, love the reversable/removable plates, however the release button on the top plate was broken right out of the box!  My boyfriend put it back on, but it fell off again when I used it!  The plate still releases if I push my finger in the hole where the missing button goes, but it is a little disappointing for the price.  I didn't even contact Cuisinart because I didn't want to hassle since I can get the plate off, but I did deduct one star for that purpose.

CommentsTitle: Always use the silicone tongs with this.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2018
CommentsContent: I love this so much I ordered one as a gift to my son and his family. My husband is highly allergic to smoke of any kind, I can use this right next to him and he is never bothered. and wow the steaks are amazing on this, burgers outstanding and I have done pork chops and chicken also. Easy to clean also.

CommentsTitle: They all graduated from college and figured this was a great appliance that would do multiple things for them to ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2018
CommentsContent: I purchased these for all my kids (adult).  They all graduated from college and figured this was a great appliance that would do multiple things for them to start out and take up less space in their apartments.  I currently have one and LOVE it!!!  Great sandwiches, pancakes, grill, etc.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2018
CommentsContent: I love the fact I can use this for multiple uses grilling or as a griddle or sandwich maker. it warms up fast and gives wonderful grill marks. I have used this daily for about 4 weeks now and it is excellent and easy to clean up

CommentsTitle: The plates are removable and dishwasher safe
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2014
CommentsContent: This product was purchased because the plates are removable and multi-useable (flat or grooved), the plates come off and are dishwasher safe, i compared with the rest and the Cuisinart won. The paninis come out way too flat, maybe im doing something wrong. the floating cover were supposed to help that. Will do some research - the only reason i gave it a 4 star was because there were some scratches and physical defects to the outer edges and sides, as though the product was refurbished and boxed - the box was new though. I don't know, its weird because was shipped and sold by Amazon.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: A friend recommended this to me and definitely I would recommend it to others. It’s a great quality and I like that is so easy to clean. It’s a great addition to your kitchen

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a nice grill/panini press. It works as advertised. Panini's cook nicely and the non-stick surfaces are easy to clean. I have the waffle plates for it as well and they cook a nice waffle. It is an attractive appliance of good quality that works as described. Highly recommended at this price point ($58).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve worn out one of these already as I use it at least once a week and many weeks, more than once. I use it to cook bacon for the week and to grill fish fillets. Can’t beat it for convenience and I can always count on it performing perfectly!

CommentsTitle: Do not buy if you're looking for a griddle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2018
CommentsContent: First time Cuisinart has ever let me down.  The griddles do not lay flat, so when you make eggs they want to run out to the grease pan.  And the grease pan is a devil to get out for cleaning.  Griddles take awhile to heat up and then loose heat very quickly when food is placed on to start cooking.  Might be good for sandwiches, but i doubt it based on how fast it cools.  If you're looking for an electric griddle, do NOT buy this one!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2011
CommentsContent: I purchased the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler as a gift for Christmas, as well as one for myself. The griddle/grill plates are extremely easy to remove and clean. They are reversible which is very convenient, I don't have to store extra plates. This is such a versatile little grill! Can be used as a press, grill, or griddle and takes up very little counter space.My daughter uses hers daily, but I have only used mine several times. I was pleased with the results each time. So much easier to clean than my old George Forman without removal plates. Great to grill steaks when it is too cold to grill outside on the gas grill. Have not had it long enough to really comment about the durability.Shipping was very fast and the packaging was great. Received in excellent condition.

CommentsTitle: Doesn’t work after a couple months
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this about 3 moths ago and reallly like it...we used to griddle for pancakes as you can lay it fat...however the latch is no longer working to lay flat can only be in the panini position...so 4 in 1 is only one position...very disappointed. It has a warranty but from what others say I would pay about as much to send back when all said and done to cusinart

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2009
CommentsContent: We'd been thinking about getting a panini grill for ages, and we finally decided to give ourselves one for the holidays.  It was a fantastic idea because we use it at least three times a week.  It's made dinner a cinch and we enjoy thinking up creative combinations.  It's so easy to switch between grill plates and griddle plates.  Because food is being cooked from both upper and lower surfaces at the same time, cooking time is reduced.  You have to remember to use the drip cups if you cook things that will produce juices (like chicken breast) or fat (like bacon) or things will get messy.  The plastic scraper has been useless so far, but the non-stick plates are very easy to clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2017
CommentsContent: We really enjoy this new kitchen appliance. Waffles are delicious and makes panninis and basic grilled cheese with ease. Nothing sticks - I do brush on or spray a small bit of oil to ensure such. Overall, it has exceeded my expectations.I have been hand-washing the grill and waffle plates so they last longer - harsh dishwasher soaps likely will deteriorate the non-stick surface much faster.

CommentsTitle: Cuisinart Grill is good, but has one flaw
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2013
CommentsContent: This grill was a replacement for my George Forman, which was disappointing for several reasons.  This Cuisinart cooks very well, much better designed that the Forman.  However, after the first use, the spring switch mechanism that releases the plates did not work for the top plate.  I had to manually pry it open with a knife blade because it did not retract on the left side.  I am tempted to remove the top inside cover to see if I can reconnect the slider mechanism, but I am a little afraid that I will not be able to put it all back together.  This is not serious enough to return the whole thing--it cooks well and I like it a lot, but this defect makes it hard to recommend to others.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Wow! I love this small appliance!! I cook for myself and to pop in a chop, hamburger patty, hot dog or make a grill cheese sandwich,  this wonderful grill does it all. Very easy to clean as the grills just pop out. I would think every household deserves to own such a great appliance,  not to mention the great price on Amazon Prime!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2006
CommentsContent: I got this grill a few weeks ago.  So far, I've made hamburgers, turkey burgers, marinated chicken, hotdogs, garlic bread, and grilled cheese.  It's been so easy to clean.  I just use the tool that came with it to scrape off the major gunk and put the removable plates in the dishwasher.  They come out perfectly clean and ready for more.  After reading a few of the other reviews, I was concerned about whether there would be a big splatter mess on my countertop.  There hasn't really been any mess.  There were a few small splatters after I made 8 pounds of marinated chicken but it was no more messy than my old George Foreman grill.  I'm very happy with my purchase!

CommentsTitle: My new go to kitchen appliance! I love it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2015
CommentsContent: I researched this as I wanted some grill that can do it all. Panini, chicken, turkey burger and hot dogs. Griddle pancake , egg and quesadilla!Throw in the waffle attachment! What else do you need. Lays flat for larger surface. Cooks fast if using the top and bottom together.Has drip tray , clean up a cinch or in dishwasher for grill parts.I probably wouldn't cook a fatty burger or steak, that's me because you could ! Lean meat fine. Too greasy food will create smoke!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2021
CommentsContent: Works well and easy to clean since the plates can go in dishwasher, ordered waffle plates and they are good also

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a same one for years. But it stopped properly heating the top plate so I ordered this one. It has the exact same issue. Bottom of the sandwiches will burn but top won’t even be pink. I have waffle plates for this model. Waffles are the same 😥

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2020
CommentsContent: It’s missing the waffle plates it says 5 in 1 and in the video it includes the waffle plates reason i got it was for that.

CommentsTitle: This was a really great investment. I bought it mainly for the waffle ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2015
CommentsContent: This was a really great investment.  I bought it mainly for the waffle plates, but find that I use the grill and griddle more than I ever thought I would.  Hot dog rolls, hot dogs and grilled cheese sandwiches are the best ever.  It also does a great job on chicken breasts, hamburgers and pork chops without making a mess of the stove.  It's light enough to carry between the pantry and the kitchen countertop.  Very pleased with this appliance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2017
CommentsContent: This is somewhat more expensive than similar models, but there is a reason for this. It is better. It is well constructed, and product design is quite good. The drip tray is attached and cannot be bumped out of place and make a big mess. It is flat so you don't have to worry about brats rolling off. It is dishwasher safe, but I don't put any nonstick pans in the dishwasher. I'm sure they will last longer and clean up is really a piece of cake. You should give this product serious consideration. It also heats up very fast

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2012
CommentsContent: I really wanted a panini-maker and a panini-maker is what I got. I can't imagine using this for burgers or bacon, no matter how lean. I can see how it would annoy anyone using this for that purpose. As a panini-maker, however, this unit is stellar. The temperature dials correlate to accurate temp readings on the contact surface and I have produced dozens of fabulous sandwiches since it arrived. I even grilled a sandwich pre-wrapped in parchment paper because it contained gooey chocolate. I bought the optional waffle plates and, like this machine, I would give them 5 stars. The waffles were deep, belgian style and 4 can be done at once. The non-stick coating on the plates seems incredibly durable.  Thumbs up!

CommentsTitle: Might work better as a panini press or as a griddle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2018
CommentsContent: It's not hot enough to really sear the meat, but after a while it will leave grill marks.  Might work better as a panini press or as a griddle.  Haven tried those features yet.  Also got the waffle plates for it.  I like how the plates pop out for easy cleaning.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2020
CommentsContent: After having a similar appliance where the plates were not removable, I could never go back! Super easy to clean and does a great job on everything we cook! Would highly recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2014
CommentsContent: The grill works very good, but to use for Panini the lid should swivel more into a flat position so that the food has the weight pressing it evenly. When you use it for a thick Panini sandwich it is higher in the front than the back, so it tends to squeeze the Panini crookedly.  When you look at the picture, imagine the lid coming down on top of the food and staying at that angle.  The heat produced is sufficient, it's easy to clean and switch the plates around.  So, I'm happy with it except for the angle for cooking thick items.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: It is my new toy. Cooks very fast. Haven’t cooked a bad meal yet on it. Locks in the juices so steak, fish, and chicken are super tasty.  Easy to clean non-stick griddle and grill reversible light weight cooking surfaces. Pancakes, bacon, French toast is a joy to prepare.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2018
CommentsContent: I purchased one of these back in 2015 and it was very well made. This new model is very cheap and the controls are a joke! I would not recommend.

CommentsTitle: Different cast iron plates and you can buy replaceable ones.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Very easy to use and clean.  Nice and solid.  Just remember to change that grease tray.  It will over flow if not changed and to much grease is in it.  But good indoor grill. Cooks even.  And there are different cooking plates that pop on and off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2011
CommentsContent: When grilling burgers grease would drip off upper tray when lifted off burgers.When using grill/griddle setup, it was confusing on how to set controls for different functions at the same time. Bacon did not cook quickly and properly. Griddle temp didnt stay hot enough for browning on both sides. I will strike this as first attempt and possible mis-setting of controls and will give it another shot. Looks like regular grilling and pannini use are most effective uses. Not sure yet about grill/griddle operation and control settings.Very easy to clean - just pop out the plates and wash them. Much better than Foreman grill.

CommentsTitle: she loved it. The only thing was that we found ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2018
CommentsContent: Bought the Cuisinart Grill for a 2nd Christmas present for my wife, she loved it.The only thing was that we found one at our local supermarket for half price!! $40.00  !!So we bought a second one to give too our daughterEasy to clean and excellent grilling for all kinds of meals.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2012
CommentsContent: My wife wanted to go on the Atkins diet, that's a lot of meat cooking (I do the cooking). I figured one of these would be good for cooking all those hamberger patties this would take. I was right, I had been frying them in a skillet, the Griddler works much better. Crank it all the way up, smash the patties in it for 6 1/2 minutes and you have supper. I also picked up the waffle plates for it (I didn't say I was on Atkins). The plates make really lame waffles. Skip that one. I went back to my belgum waffle maker. I only gave it 4 stars because it drips grease all over my counter when the top is up.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Top panel heat is not distributing, so sandwich is toasting on both the side at the same time....for the price$89.99 this didn't come more than 3 years.... disappointed 😞

CommentsTitle: Me tocó un producto con defecto.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
    
   Solo la use un par de veces y presento esta falla, enciende intermitente las luces verde y no calienta, lo compré en línea y vivo en otro país, no lo puede devolver porque me sale más costoso el envío,

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2013
CommentsContent: A friend had one of these and made us yummy quesadillas on it, so I decided to give it a try. We get tired of firing up the big grill outside and things can take a long time to cook on it, so I was looking for a quicker, indoor alternative. I've used it several times with good results. It seems to get nice and hot. I've only made quesadillas and Panini sandwiches so far, but those turned out good. I'm excited to try burgers and chicken, as well as veggies. That's coming soon. More feedback when I do that!Thus far, a nice little grill at a good price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Love it mainly because it’s easy to clean, probably the only product on market that has removable plates? I do kinda worry about the Tefron tho

CommentsTitle: this is the biggest disappointment ever. it does not cook meat well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2018
CommentsContent: I went to buy a cheap foreman grill. this is the biggest disappointment ever. it does not cook meat well. Everything drips. It does not close well. It is a bad mechanic workshop project. I can't even regift it because I would feel bad. I threw away the box, so I never sent it back. Epic Fail.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2015
CommentsContent: My husband was begging me for a George Foreman grill for awhile. I did some research and decided to order this little beauty instead. We love it. We bought the waffle plates, as well. We have owned it for a year and couldn't be happier with our purchase. We love to make paninis, tuna melts, and waffles in it. The clean-up is super-easy, thanks to the removable plates. I'd definitely recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Didn't work. We had to fix it ourselves.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2017
CommentsContent: We have wanted one of these for quite some time so finally bought one. We set it up and plugged it in and turned it on and waited.  Nothing happened. It did not heat up. Luckily my husband is great at repairing things. He opened it up and one of the wires was not hooked up. It works fine now, but I would have been disappointed if I was a single woman and this happened.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this to replace my old George Foreman grill. This is such a huge improvement! I use this almost every day. It offers more options and temperature controls. And I can’t begin to express how much easier it is to clean! The plates pop off, and even the most burnt on messes just wipe right off. They can even be put in the dishwasher!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent: It doesn’t really get that hot. Takes a long time to cook food unless you use the press but then all of your food is smashed. Also took an insanely long time to grill corn.

CommentsTitle: Loved it five times until it doesn't work now. ????
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Have no idea what happened.  I loved this grill and after five uses, it is not heating up at all.  I thought it was my outlet so tried a few and even reset the breaker if that could ne the problem.  Outlets are not the problem.  Very disappointed as I tried to heat up to sear my marinaded shrimp on Father's Day no no avail...

CommentsTitle: A real do it all product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2011
CommentsContent: I have used this product almost every day since it arrived in my home. The grids change from grill to griddle in a snap and it works wonderfully when  making a Saturday breakfast of pancakes and breakfast meat, each on a separate griddle. I previously owned George Foreman grills and wanted a change. This is definitely superior to any product I have used before. The temperature controls make fine tuning of the level easy and the ability of the upper grid to come down directly on the items, rather than from a hinged position, allows for more even cooking on chicken breasts and other items which might not be exacly the same thickness throughout.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2019
CommentsContent: You will not be disappointed this product will do exactly as stated! Heats up fast. I can cook 5 to six medium steaks. The grill marks are just like an outdoor grill... It opens into a two sided grill allowing you to cook more food, at once. I love it very much. One draw back is you will get some smoke with this grill...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2015
CommentsContent: Love this machine.  We borrowed our neighbor's Griddler during Mardi Gras to make Cuban (pressed) sandwiches for a crowd and it worked so well we ordered one from Amazon the next day.  Well made, heavy, feels professional.  Really like the tilt-able lid that allows you to press food flat or with a 1.5 inch gap between the two plates for doing pressed sandwiches.  Plates easily remove for cleaning and can be flipped over for a flat cooking surface.  Great price from Amazon.  Highly recommended.

CommentsTitle: Use it every week, it’s great
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I didn’t think that I’d get as much use out of this grill when I first got it. It’s easy to use with the removable plates. The lids open up, perfect for making pancakes or grilling bacon. Even cooked porkchops on it. Good Product.

CommentsTitle: Stopped getting hot after less than a year
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2018
CommentsContent: We bought this less than a year ago and now no matter how high we put the temperature it barely cooks what is in it.  It was great up until that point.  Pretty disappointed that for this kind of money it doesn't last.

CommentsTitle: This is my favorite item in the kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2015
CommentsContent: This is my favorite item in the kitchen!  My mother-in-law bought me this a few years ago before she passed and I used it all the time.  Then I dropped it when taking it to a special event, so I had to get a new one.  I saw nothing comparable, so I'm glad I picked the same thing.  It looks awesome in your kitchen and is great for pre-cooking food for the week ahead.  The best part of it is that you can pop off the grill plates and easily wash them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I gave this as a gift to my son and he loves it. He says that he uses it all the time for breakfast, lunch and dinner and it is easy to clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2019
CommentsContent: I simply love this thing!  I've had it for about a week now and so far have used it for panini as well as the griddle for pancakes.  Works great.  Setup was easy and clean up is a breeze.  Highly recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Has been using it for 1 year
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2019
CommentsContent: Works great so far and good for searing and grilling as well

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2010
CommentsContent: I debated about buying this for some time.  I dont like to have items in my kitchen that I use only every now and then.  I am happy to say not the case with the Cuisinart GR-4N Griddler.  I have made a number of panni's with it and my husband loves them!!!  So easy to make and he is sooo impressed.... ha  I have used it twice for pork chops and I even tried leaving the bones in once.... It works just great.  Juicy pork chops. Granted they arent the same as if you cooked them outside on a grill, not as dark but from health reports, chared food isnt that healthy for us to eat anyway.I would highly recommend this product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2008
CommentsContent: This has been a great product and so far no problems with it. We use it in our RV and I have no complaints about it at all. It can fit open on our table so we can cook or keep things warm on it as we eat. When open it is an even surface and has been very good cooking both as an open griddle and closed like a griller. The plates snap off and on easily - very nice! Just make sure to put the top plates on the top (as marked) and the bottoms on the bottom. We have had good success with steaks, burgers, bacon, waffles being cooked on it so far. It has been a one of the best cooking utensils that has been added to our camping trips to date.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2018
CommentsContent: Love the removable plates for cleaning. Extremely light weight, which is not a good thing for a panini "press". Plates are not firmly attached to the tabs; they move and clang as you move the lid up and down. Knobs are also somewhat loose. Very disappointed in the overall quality of the product. Gives the feeling that it will fail any minute. I used a very basic Breadman TR456 for years, which did not have removable plates but everything else. Unfortunately, it is no longer available, otherwise, I would have returned this flimsy item.

CommentsTitle: Great improvements over the older model
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2013
CommentsContent: I replaced my 7-year-old Griddler with this one and am happy with all the improvements -- integrated drip tray, interchangeable top and bottom plates, and better float hinge. My old one got used several times a week for years when it finally wouldn't turn on and its bottom plate was completely worn. Given the heavy use for so long, though, that was to be expected. The new one works great. The one thing I won't do again is run the plates through the dishwasher. It only takes a few moments to wash them by hand, and I'm sure they'll last much longer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2021
CommentsContent: Love that its multi funtional cause i also ordered the waffle iron for it. Eady to clean .Highly recomend

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Everything works as good and as easily as described. The only complaint I have is if you are grilling burgers or other high fat foods, the grease will fall off the edges of the grill which makes a pretty nasty mess on the counter.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2013
CommentsContent: It takes a few minutes to heat up, but it cooks meat to perfection.  It leaves a good sear on the outside, and the meat is juicy.  I've done chicken, steaks and hamburgers so far, and they've all been terrific.  Clean up is a breeze!  The plates come out easily and you can either stick them in the dishwasher or just rinse them off.  It folds up to a size that is easy to store, but when you open it up affords a large grilling surface.  I purchased this because the Farber Ware grill that my mom had (so it was 50 years old) finally gave up the ghost.  I loved that grill.  But this one has won my heart because it is so easy to clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve only had this countertop grill for about three months now but I’m loving it so far.  I think it’s one of the better ones on the market for the money build quality seems decent and it’s versatile and easy to clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2019

CommentsTitle: Love it! I can't wait to try this out ...

CommentsContent: Love it!  I can't wait to try this out as a grill for burgers and chicken in the winter.  Made delicious Ruebens last night. 10 mins from heat-up to prepped to cooked. First time I have had a waffle maker pop those waffles out without sticking. (Waffle plates are a definite thumbs up)  Heats up and cools down in record time.  Just made my life a little easier and added new options for meals.  Worth every penny.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Very pleased with this griddled,  it’s quick to heat up, the sliding hinge makes for an even sandwich.  Really like the removable plates as it speeds up cleanung

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2019

CommentsTitle: It's great to have top and bottom heated together.

CommentsContent: This was my 3rd grill I've used in the last year and by far the worst of the group. It's the smallest of the 3 I've used and and doesn't seem to cook as well as the other ones I've used. And for around the same price I don't think I can recommend this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2013
CommentsContent: Needed an indoor grill for our steaks/burgers.  We cooked our first meal on it tonight.  It cooked a sirloin steak, a ribeye steak and a filet mignon to perfection.  The ease of setting it up and the clarity of the instructions was trumped by the deliciousness of the steaks!This is the perfect size for my family.  We'll be using it often.  I like that you can both cooked bacon and eggs.This is my 3rd Cuisinart product and I find them superior for the price.  And Amazon continues to substantially beat prices from other sources.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I make my breakfast all at once now. when I have eggs, bacon and toast, even room for pancakes.  Healthy fried eggs, no oil needed.  Scrambled eggs work well.  I gather my eggs batter together quickly on the hot griddle and it cooks fast.  Melted cheese come out so perfect for me.  I am elderly and need this easy cooking.  Thank you.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2012

We had it shipped to our resort and as soon as we received it we used it for the rest of the week to make breakfast in our room. The flat griddle plates made great pancakes, fried eggs and bacon. The temperature kept well once it was heated and opening it up totally flat gave plenty of room to cook four good size pancakes at one time. The plates were very easy to clean and the unit itself is quite sturdy. We love being able to cook so much on it. We recommend it!

CommentsTitle: The clean up on the plates was so easy and you can't believe how much grease is in ...

The clean up on the plates was so easy and you can't believe how much grease is in the tray.  Would be great for someone on a diet who is watching their fat intake.

CommentsTitle: My Weber grill is gathering dust

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2018
CommentsContent: Excellent excellent grill!Ive been trying to find a good quick grill for lunch but no luck after three other grills! They all had something bad about them but Finally I bought this grill and I tell you BUY IT don’t hesitate it’s perefct. Easy to operate and easy to clean ! CommentsContent: I have used the product twice so far and each time it makes a real mess.  Let me explain, the grease splatter comes out of the grill and all over the counter space. The griddle works well, it does but another thing about it I don't like is how it drains.  The grease from the meat and things off of the meat block the pathway. You have to watch it and make sure it's draining. If I had to buy another I wouldn't. Our old foreman worked much better as to the draining and no mess on the counter top.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2018

Wow! The grill plates are so much easier to put in and take out! And I love having the removable drip pan fitted to and under the Griddler instead of pushed up to the edge. I used to always end up with grease on the counter -- not so with this model. I've also used the flat side for French toast. Great versatility. A good product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2016
CommentsContent: I wonder if anyone else bought this as a result of watching the movie the chef? To be more specific to make Cubano sandwiches with it? It maintains the temperature very well. We are very happy with the purchase.

CommentsTitle: Works well, but broke during first use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2012
CommentsContent: Product works well, and continues to work however a component broke during use.The griddler uses hard plastic components to lock in the reversible/removable grill plates, and clearly they get more brittle after heating.  After my first use I went to remove the plates and the top plate had some trouble getting out, I went to examine why and one of the plastic retention clips wasn't actuating (there's a little button that makes them rotate out for removal, but when pressing the button the clip in question did nothing).  I picked up the unit to inspect it, and I heard a rattle - the sound of a metal piece rolling around inside the frame of the unit.  I rotated the unit around and shook out what turned out to be two pieces, a hard plastic clip and a thin, 1 inch metal tube that it clearly connected to.  It's clear that the hard plastic they use gets really brittle after heating, and upon inspection the plastic retention clip is actuated by just pushing on it so it rotates, a simple design but if the plastic is really brittle then it gets easier to just break the clip than to rotate it, which is what happened.I'm continuing to use it until I can get in contact with Cuisinart or Amazon regarding getting a new one, because it functions well outside of this problem and the other clips are working okay, so it might be one of those items where it is worth getting another if it means being careful.  The clip that's broken is on the top plate, so I'm a little worried about safety at the moment, but it does still hold the plate on.  Other than that, it cooked hamburgers well and toasted up some paninis in a good way.I gave three stars because it is a good product except for one silly mistake, using a hard plastic piece that can break easily during regular use.  I don't know why they went for that kind of plastic or didn't do anything to make it more heat resistant, it seems like one of those engineering issues where the original engineering called for a different material, but this one would "probably" work (or "work well enough") and would save $0.02 per unit, so they went for it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2012
CommentsContent: I ordered the waffle plates too and have now (in the three days I have had the gridler) used it for 4 different types of cooking. All very wonderful outcomes. My only worry is the little clips that hold the grill plates on. I hope that with careful attention to them that they will last for a very long time. The product does feel a little flimsy, but dang, it makes GREAT food. I ordered it to replace both our gridle and our waffle maker. I'm thrilled with my choice to combine the money it would take to get two appliances into this one dandy kitchen friend. I recommend this highly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this little guy! You control the heat and settings and you can leave grill marks or flip it over and use it flat. Cleans like a breeze!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: We absolutely love this griddle, it is in continuous use making panini sandwiches, quesadillas, etc.  Great quality unit and super easy to clean.  Highly recommended.

CommentsTitle: Some grease trap issues, otherwise a good griddle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2017
CommentsContent: Like the product, the only problem is that grease and debris can fall off the back of the griddle and not go into the grease trap.The griddle is big enough for 2 standard sized sandwiches, while using the pannini press.Otherwise it works well

CommentsTitle: Works Great and Easy to Clean.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2019
CommentsContent: We use this a couple of time a week. Mostly for pork chops or Chicken breasts. It works as well as you would expect, but the clean up on it is so much easier that the GF Grill that we had prior.I would recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 4, 2013
CommentsContent: This Grill is perfect for Hamburgers, Bacon, eggs, and Pancakes it comes with a grease scraper which easily doubles as a mini spatula. I also like the price from Amazon I have seen this griddle priced as much at $70 more in some of the stores.The Griddle Plates are nice as I can remove them for cleaning, I also like the fact that I can order different Griddle plates should I decide to use it as a waffle iron.Great Value and Excellent Quality

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought this for myself for my birthday last month, and I am very pleased with myself.  I also bought the waffle plates. I use the griddler 3 or 4 times a week for grilling meats, vegetables and bread (for crostini).  I've used it for breakfsts: bacon, eggs, pancakes, french toast and , of course, waffles.  It is great for panini's also. I love that the cord wraps around the back for storage and that it cleans up so easily--all the plates can go in the dishwasher. The upper plate does not heat quite as much as the lower, but I don't have a problem flipping things over, if necessary.  Also the timing and temperature of the waffles in the recipe booklet is a bit short for crispy waffles.  I jack up the temp about 50 degrees and add 3 or 4 minutes to what it shows in the booklet and they come out fine.  Overall, I love my new toy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2015
CommentsContent: DAY ONE: I love the design and function of this grill.  I rate it a 4 only because the materials seem, well, light.  I'll have to see how it holds up over time.  I also plan on getting the matching waffle plates.SIX WEEKS LATER: "I love the design and function of this grill.." EXCEPT for the channels that drain off the fats are inadequate or otherwise DO NOT WORK!  You are left with your grill standing in a pool of grease.  Not a pretty picture.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2013
CommentsContent: I was replacing a George Foreman Grill that I've had forever, and which finally died.  I really liked the fact that this grill has removable plates for easier cleaning, and the flexibility to be used as a press or a griddle.  The surface area is a little smaller than the grill I was replacing, only holding 4 Bubba Burgers where I used to be able to cook 5.  Not a problem.  However, even while allowing the grill to heat up until the light goes on and the dials to the hottest temperature, it took the frozen burger patties forever to cook.  I also had to re-position them, as the corners of the grill near the back corners weren't getting as hot as the center and the food was cooking unevenly.I'm also disappointed that the waffle plates for this grill appear to be more expensive than the grill itself.

CommentsTitle: This Griddle Kicks some serious Foreman bootae
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2005
CommentsContent: This Griddle is amazing and perfect for the "on the go" people. We are a very active family, and our kids play a lot of sports, so we are always on the go. This baby heats up fast and cooks very evenly, and if so easy to clean up. I looked at the pictures put up, and we have not experienced any of that spatter or nastiness shown in those pictures. Its VERY easy to clean, the plates come right off and go into the dishwasher. The machine itself just wipes down in seconds. Then the next day, its ready to go again. It comes with a real handy cooking guide and some good suggestions on recipes. We have cooked fish, chicken, hamburgers, hot dogs, and even some grilled cheeses, and they came out wonderful.We have not used the griddle plates yet because we have a griddle on our stovetop, and have not had the need to use those, so I cant say anything about that, but the machine is definitely worth every penny. The brushed stainless steel looks great on the counter, with a nostalgic look, and 3 heating dials. Very Retro looking indeed. I highly recommend this Griddle. Enjoy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2020
CommentsContent: We got one for a gift, so we bought one to give to a family member.  Simply because it worked so well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2011
CommentsContent: I bought one of these griddles from Amazon & only used it a few times, never at anywhere near the highest heat settings, and the heat it put out melted the plastic grease drip pan that fits underneath it.  I have to wonder if this isn't a fire hazard.  If it gets so hot underneath that it can melt it's own drip pan, is it not also possible it might catch the grease on fire?  That didn't happen for me, but it was enough of a concern that I didn't order another one.  To Amazon's credit, they took the griddle back and credited my card with no problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought one for myself 2 years ago love it. I live in a condo it is not easy to use my patio to grill. My parents are in there 80's using their grill in the winter was not working for them. So we bought them one for Christmas it is working out great. This works great for 2 people. Highly recommend for anyone living in a condo or apt.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I originally purchased this for my husband to use while he was over the road trucking. He brought it home when he retired and now I can't imagine life without it!!!  We use it multiple times a week!! It heats up quickly and is very easy to use!

CommentsTitle: Best cooking tool I've purchased in years!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2012
CommentsContent: My boss brought a slightly different version of this to a work pancake breakfast and sold me on purchasing one. He swears that he'll be forced to leave it at work when he retires because it does pancakes so well! I have to agree that it does pancakes well. In the less than 2 months we have had this, we have cooked chicken breasts, blue cheese stuffed NY strips, sandwiches and pancakes. All turned out excellent. For a short time I was cooking for three instead of two and found that cooking 3 sandwiches was a bit difficult--much easier cooking only 2 sandwiches at once! So why only a 4-star rating? I'm only giving it 4 stars because it needs to come with a spare set of plates--mine are always needing to be cleaned due to use!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2015
CommentsContent: I waited some months after buying this to write this review because I wanted to actually put it through it paces first.First, the feature I do not use: This thing has the ability to open completely allowing you to use it as a flat, larger single sided grill or griddle. I already own a larger flat electric griddle and a cast iron grill/griddle that I use for these purposes when needed so that was not really useful to me but I see where it would be to a single person or small family with limited storage space.As I said, I have had this for 6 or 7 months now and have used it fairly extensively for the 2 purposes for which it was bought, cooking meat and making Grilled Cheese sandwiches/paninis.This thing rocks at grilled cheese! My son and my favorite is a grilled cheese with ham or bacon on rye and you can easily prepare them 2 at a time on this grill. Reverse the plates and the same can be said for paninis.Cooking meats can take some trial and error to get right. It is very easy to overcook something. If you think about it, this makes perfect sense. Because it's cooking from both sides at the same time, things cook faster, so you have to get used to it. Personally, I have taken to using an instant read thermometer to check the actual temp of steaks and chicken breasts and the like to avoid any such issues and have found that to work out quite well. I have also found that it also takes a bit of trial and error  to learn what temp setting to use with various items but you should quickly get the hang of it.Clean up: This thing is great. The cooking plates pop out easily and are some of the best "non-stick" items I have come across. The things will almost literally wipe clean with a paper towel even after cooking something with the stickiest of marinade/glaze. I wash them with the rest of my dishes in soapy water, dry them in the rack and pop them back in to device and it's good to go.The grease trap on this is also quite well designed. It is of sufficient size to handle pretty much any meal with fear of it filling up or over flowing. I have cooked a dozen 80% burgers on it and it hasn't even come close to being full. But perhaps the biggest plus is that it works really well. I have had a few of these devices where the the design and traps did not really contain the  grease all that well. This one does the job quite well and without the angles and large flairs I have seen on other devices.There is also very little to no splatter while cooking so cleaning the main part of the device is as simple as giving it a quick wipe with and damp cloth or sponge (after unplugging, of course).I would say the only real limiting factor to this device is its size. It would not work for a bigger family. I can easily cook a half dozen 5 oz burgers or boneless pork chops at the same time. Perhaps 4 or 5 bone-in chops (depending on the size) and 4 nice sized boneless chicken breasts also work out well. I have also done a few nice sized london broils on it with good results. But with 1 lb porterhouses, you will be limited to 2 at a time. So if you are cooking for 2 or 3 people, this should work out well for you. Any more than that and you might want to investigate other possibilities.Bottom line for me though is as somebody who is generally cooking for only 2 or 3 people, I love it. It works well, cleans up easily and is easy to tuck away on a shelf when not being used.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2014
CommentsContent: This is so easy to use.  We use this to make panin's, grilled sandwiches, and grill meats.  It doesn't take up a lot of space on your kitchen counter if you place things there and it's small enough to store under the counters.  The only thing about this appliance is that it feels cheap.  Other than that we love it, it's super easy to clean and it comes with a recipe book to open your mind up to new food ideas!

CommentsTitle: Heats evenly great for panini sandwiches"

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2012
