If stands the test of the time I will give it the 5 stars rate, for now I recommend it, and I will update this review in December 2012.January 9th 2013It is still going strong.January 20th 2014Still going...May 20th 2018Years of heavy use, and still going...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Like every thing

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2018
CommentsContent: I absolutely love this grill.  My girlfriend bought it and based on advice, I bought one.  I live alone and it’s so hard cooking healthy for one!  I’ve done chicken, pork chops, hot dog and all came out perfect.  Highly recommend!  My sister is going to buy one now!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2013
CommentsContent: I'm really glad my dad pointed this item out to me, because I was fed up with my Foreman grill. I had one of the larger models that is nearly impossible to clean in a sink. I loved the concept of the removable (dish washer safe) plates in the Cuisinart and that was my primary reason for buying it. I used it for the first time tonight and it worked perfectly. The other features like being able to fully open it and have heat control knobs are just an added benefit for me. It feels very well made and as of now I am very happy I made this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: been using Gearoge foremen, upgraded based on reviews. really don't see the improvement and the controls are hard to see, added the same one after the purchase was on sale at Walmart for 20 less. It's decent quality, but overbilled. for my needs I wish I would have stuck with George with removable hot surfaces.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2014
CommentsContent: We've been using the Griddler since they came out. Our last one was used up - the plates were getting gross - so we noticed this newer model had come out with some small but important improvements and we've been very pleased.Ours is a workhorse, getting lots of use grilling and griddling. The draining improvements and fact that the plates are interchangeable now - no bottom or top, they work either way - makes this the best Griddler yet.

CommentsTitle: Why did I wait so long?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2012
CommentsContent: I had been watching for sales on the Cuisinart Griddler in stores and online for months!  Finally Amazon had a sale and I was able to purchase one... As a college kid with no stove options for cooking, this 5-in-1 has allowed me to expand my menu from microwave-only to a whole new realm of relatively quick food options.  So far, my biggest regret is that I waited so long to get it!Pros:The griddler is easy to cook with after a bit of a learning curve of its temperature controls.  It's not a range top, so it's not going to match a gas burner for heat, but it's hot enough to sear a steak, make an omelette, etc. The main reason I bought this brand rather than others is the configuration of the heating element, which creates an even heated surface with minimal hot/cool spots, and it does so quickly (only a couple minutes from cold to "max" heat).  Cleanup is easy with the removable plates and steel construction.Cons:Ignoring for the moment that I only paid $70 for this, I do wish the 2 surfaces had independent temperature control.  And grease doesn't drain well... but it's not designed to be a Foreman, it's supposed to be pretty flat!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I like everything about this grill. The plates are easy to change, easily washed in dishwasher or by hand, wonderful for grilled sandwiches, which is what I use it for.

CommentsTitle: Very compact, good design, but needs some improvement
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2013
CommentsContent: The Cuisinart 5 in 1 Griddler is a good concept, but it doesn't get hot enough to cook anything at a fast pace if it is unfolded all the way...which is the way I would think most people would want to use it.  It took forever to cook bacon, until it was folded over.  It works great as a panini press, or to grill a burger on both sides at the same time.Positive: Good size, easy to store, and very easy to cleanNegative: Doesn't get hot quickly, doesn't get hot enough when opened all the way to grill on both panels separately

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2012
CommentsContent: I recently received it and have used it several times for making Chinese style pie (beef bun, see my pictures in the picture section of this item) and pancakes. It works perfectly well and super fast! I am so impressed and couldn't be happier. Wish I have bought it sooner. It is pretty compact, which is extremely good for my tiny kitchen; looks very cute and modern; no unpleasant smell from the pans even when I first used it. I also love it for that no smoke comes out from my cooking and temperature is controlled almost precisely. When I make pancake, I close the griddler. So I don't need to turn the pancakes and they are cooked even faster! I plan to cook french toast and more Chinese pie £¨±ý£©soon. Strongly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Had this for 1 month and used it frequently. Started out great but now top plate is half the heat of the bottom. Bought the waffle plates which are now a big waste of money.  Will use it for grilled vegetables and fish since I am outside return window. Would not buy again and unfortunately can not recommend to others. Super disappointed in the Cuisinart brand.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2013
CommentsContent: I grill very often and I had my old George Foreman for years.  It would not get clean and started smoking up the whole house so I purchased this one to replace it.  I LOVE it!  The temperature settings are great and the removable plates go right into the dish washer which is just AWESOME!  No fuss cleaning!  I also like that I can use the plates as a griddle or a grill or both, one of each on each side. Being able to open it fully and use both sides as once is an awesome feather.  I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an indoor grill!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2021
CommentsContent: Our old one broke after at least a decade of service so when I saw they were still selling the same model I was happy to pick it up again.

CommentsTitle: I was excited that the griddler plates were removable for easy washing. Now that I have it I am ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought this to replace my George Forman.  I was excited that the griddler plates were removable for easy washing.  Now that I have it I am not crazy about it.  I don't like the design of the grease trap and I miss how the Forman grill is angled so all of the grease rolls into the drip tray.  If I were purchasing again I would buy another George Forman grill.

CommentsTitle: I've had two & loved them EXCEPT they don't clean well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2018
CommentsContent: I've had two & loved them EXCEPT they don't clean well.  Grease builds up on outside, even though I wipe it down every time I use it. Under bottom plate grease falls through & gums up electronics.  The plates do clean well in dishwasher but the rest is a grimy mess.  Looking for a different product this time:(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2014
CommentsContent: First thing I would like to point out is the REMOVABLE AND WASHABLE griddles!!!!! The top griddle does a "fair" (best I've seen so far)  job at matching the temperature of the bottom griddle so your food cooks evenly top and bottom. My wife is a panini freak and loves how well it evenly melts the cheese on both sides without burning the bread.I've had it for a few months and it gets quite a lot of use and it seems quite durable/reliable. So far I'm very pleased and was worth the $$$.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: It works wonders. Loving it. Perhaps I'd like it to warm up faster but once hot it gets the job done.Used it for chicken, steaks, sandwiches, arepas (colombian), tacos, and so far so good. The grease catcher works great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2013
CommentsContent: I bought this for my husband and we love it. It makes a great grilled cheese, or any other grilled sandwitch. It also grills chicken and fish quickly and evenly. As for the plates, I had read that putting them in the dishwasher was not recomended, so I have been hand-washing them and that has been quick and easy. The plates are really non-stick and any cheese or fat that is left over from grilling comes up quickly and easily. Getting the plates on and off is also a snap, both literally and figurativly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Takes a long time to heat up, and sometimes foods that should only take less than an hour according to the advertising on the box take upwards of 3-4 hours.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: This was for my mom and she loves it! She has me wanting to buy one for myself!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: Overall a pretty mediocre product but it suffers from one major design flaw that makes it absolutely terrible. The grease drainage just doesn't work. Anything you cook in it will just puddle on the countertop. A little silver lining though is that my butcher block counter top is always nice and oiled...with bacon grease...

CommentsTitle: But I have one as well and its great to cook on
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2017
CommentsContent: This was a Christmas gift I gave.  But I have one as well and its great to cook on.  Can cook anything, has a drip tray on bottom that never fills up as long as you keep it clean each time after cooking but it works very good.  Plus you can buy different types of hot plates like one for waffles.  Yes this is a great grill!

CommentsTitle: Bought this to replace broken Foreman grill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2010
CommentsContent: We had a Foreman grill for years.  I dropped it and it broke, therefore we needed a replacement.  I looked at the Foreman and decided to look at other grills as well.  The Cuisinart was less expensive and seemed to do the same thing.After having it for a couple of months now, we are very happy.  We have only used it for grilling, but it does a fine job and cleans up very easily.We did have a concern before buying it that it would be much larger than the Foreman and we would not be able to store it in the same place.  It is not larger (might be a bit smaller) and stores great.

CommentsTitle: I enjoy it, you will too
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I make cheese sandwiches on this a few times a week. Easy to clean, even heat.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2012
CommentsContent: Have used the grill every day since its arrival, it works really well. Hamburgers to porkchops all came out perfect really impressed with this little machine. I know some folks have had some small issues but so far I have not found a flaw. Its easy to clean, just pop the plates off and wash your done. Even the greese catcher works well, just all around good solid Cuisinart quality, have bought many of their products and have never been disappointed. Price and function make it in my opinion a good purchase if this is the what you are looking for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Very intuitive controls and the fact that they are mechanical dials, they should maintain accuracy. Plates are easy to remove and clean in a jiffy.

CommentsTitle: A disaster from the word go.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2019
CommentsContent: Sits on a shelf waiting for my wife to return it.

CommentsTitle: Very practical and easy to use and clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2018
CommentsContent: Very practical and easy to use and clean. Designed large enough to fit lots of food, but small enough to not take up all your counters

CommentsTitle: i am very disappointed in this product for only gibing me 2 uses ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2018
CommentsContent: My cuisinart was delivered May 24th 2018 i used it twice & today is may 28th 2018 this would've been the third time i used it but my grill will not get hot at all. The red indicator is on as if it's heating up but it's been 10 long mins & i can still take the non stick plates off & touch the heating coils under them, i am very disappointed in this product for only giving me 2 uses out of it but i will definitely be shipping it back tomorrow. Happy holidays to all fire up the grill & eat good!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2014
CommentsContent: I do highly recommend this appliance.  My kids and husband use this all the time.  Now I don't have to cook nearly as much as I used to.  They use it as a press for everything sandwich.  I over cooked the boneless pork chops I made on it, but the family still loved it.  The 12 year old even cooks burgers for the family now.  I say it was a good purchase in our household.  The only drawback is it does not wash itself and does not clean the counter where my family made a mess.  Since they are apparently untrainable, Cuisinart needs to come up with a solution to this problem  :)

CommentsTitle: Fast - this grill allows you to cook an amazing meal in half the time!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Grill onions and carrots in minutes and fish turns out perfect every time by applying heat to top and bottom at the same time.  Flakey and not over cooked.  I love this grill!  I will avoid my oven at all costs now that I have this grill that cooks in ½ the time and twice as good!

CommentsTitle: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS COOKER
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2014
CommentsContent: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS COOKER!!! We recently replaced a Foreman grill that had lasted for many years, and while we were satisfied with that brand's performance, the options on this one were too good to ignore. Being able to wash the plates in the dishwasher is a huge plus. We haven't used the flat sides of the plates or cooked with it laying flat yet, but I'll looking forward to trying that out with pancakes. It's just wonderful.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my second one. . I let someone "borrow" my first one.  I thought I wouldn't be using it anytime soon.  . been awhile so I purchased another one just like it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this so much, I’ve bought one for my nephew, my step-daughter, and my niece.  I also have one for my RV...it is so versatile and easy to use and clean.

CommentsTitle: Pay Twice to get a Working Unit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2015
CommentsContent: Disappointed.  I bought two of these December 21st, 2014 as Christmas presents - one for my husband and one for my 76 year old dad.  My husband's works fine, but my dad's is broken.  He tried to use the Griddle to make pancakes and tried to use the griddle on the top portion as advertised, but the top portion doesn't heat up enough to cook a pancake.  So my dad called the warranty department at Cuisinart.  They told him they would provide him a new one, but he had to pay $10.00 for shipping.  Then he had to ship the old one back to Cuisinart.  That cost $44.00 plus $16.00 for the box and packaging it up for him by the UPS store.  All told a new unit is going to cost him $70 which is about $14 bucks or so short of what I actually paid for the darn thing.  So 50% of the units I bought were bad and my dad has to basically buy a new unit himself.  Crappy service and support by Cuisinart.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: And, that is EXACTLY where it is now!  Huge disappointment.  This one stings, Cuisinart!  First time, shame on you! Second time, shame on me!  GUARANTEE - there will be no second times for ANY Cuisinart products - period!PLEASE - DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY, TIME OR EFFORT ON THIS SHODDY PIECE!

CommentsTitle: Did a TON of research and love this one so far!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2014
CommentsContent: I bought this for my husband for Christmas because he loves to cook and we always enjoy paninis from PB.  We have only used it three times so far, but I love that it gives him another way to explore his creative side in the kitchen.I did a TON of research before finally deciding to go with this product. I was torn between this one, the one that offered the "hovering lid" option and the more expensive one where the additional plates were sold separately. While I really liked the idea of the hovering lid, I wanted to give my husband more options with the grill, griddle and open-flat surfaces. One of the attractive features of the more expensive ($200+ more) option was that the heating elements were inside the plates. However, that version only came with two plates and I would have to pay $80 for each additional one I wanted to order making it an almost $500 gift to get the same thing this one offered). As much as I love my husband and as much as he loves to cook, I just didn't think we needed a $500 counter top appliance.So far, we love this product and haven't had any of the troubles others reported having.  We haven't tried to grill anything extremely greasy, but the drip tray seems more than sufficient to me. The surface is sufficient for making two large paninis (e.g. french bread or sourdough) at the same time. The plates seem durable and we hand wash them with ease, so we avoid any risk of them being damaged in the dishwasher.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: Makes the best paninis and wraps - let tik tok inspire you to buy this lol

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2014
CommentsContent: I replaced a large GeoFor Grill with the Cuisinart 5 in 1 Griddler. I like the temperature controls and the large surface area. Food cooks fast with little splashing. I'm careful to remove excess fat and residue between batches by blotting with paper towels and removing with tongs. Also do not wash grill plates in the dishwasher; aluminum and the alkali soap don't like each other and the non-stick finish will deteriorate quickly. Overall, a definite improvement on the old favorite.

CommentsTitle: Very different and takes time to figure it out
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2021
CommentsContent: I’m mixed on this the pork chop came out GREAT! But grilled cheese took forever.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: When I bought it I expected it to be a little bigger than it really is. Also I noticed that the griddle sometimes gets sticky for the food which is a bit annoying if you don't use oil on it.The product is fine, but I am not 100% satisfied infact I don't use it often unfortunately.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Really great product. It's amazing. Cooks really fast when you use it in "sandwich" mode

CommentsTitle: How did I live without this?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2011
CommentsContent: I debated, for a long time, before buying this. I wish I hadn't.  Plates snap in and out without a problem, it cooks beautifully and cleanup is amazingly simple - wipe and done. Not a fan of the grease catcher being underneath - there's times I have to basically 'shove' the grease towards the drip area and it's in a weird spot.  But, compared to my last grills - a Foreman and an Emeril, I'm thrilled with it.  We use it 3-4 times a week, nice to be able to cook veggies right next to the meat. Nice, even cooking and the sear marks are great. Love that it opens flat too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2014
CommentsContent: Have only used this 5 or 6 times, so I'm reluctant to give it five stars because I don't really know anything about its longevity.@ However, I have "grilled" steak and fish, and cooked up a few pancakes and it does do a great job.Cleanup is very easy and it takes up very little room on the kitchen counter.I guess I won't really know how good it is for another six to twelve months but, as far as I_ can tell right now, this is everything that I could hope for in a grill/press.

CommentsTitle: Good overall, but drip oil catcher needs improvement
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Like everything except the clean up.When lifting the top to take burgers off, the top plate drips grease on the counter.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2019
CommentsContent: Great product.  Makes great panini’s and grilled sandwiches, as well as pancakes and French toast on the duel side.  We will also be taking with us to use in our RV.

CommentsTitle: I used foreman grills before this and was not satisfied. Sometimes it felt the temperature was uneven and ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2017
CommentsContent: I used foreman grills before this and was not satisfied. Sometimes it felt the temperature was uneven and food came out raw. One use of this product and I could taste the difference! Cooks much faster and tastier than the previous grill

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Oh wow, love this thing, panini sandwiches, bacon, sausages & pancakes!! To to good to be true, but it is, Love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Not sure about the meat, I use it for sausages, mushrooms and vegetables and it is great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2009
CommentsContent: It took me a while to decide between this product and a couple of others in the market.  The quality of Cuisinart is just unbeatable.  This griddler is well made and sturdy.  The plates are removable yet it seems they are permanently attached.  They don't wiggle around or feel flimsy like other machines I tried.  I use this little appliance almost everyday for either breakfast sandwiches to steak, brats, vegetables...etc.! I could not be happier with this product!  And, while the price is pretty standard everywhere, with Amazon.com you will save on the shipping charges.  Once again, a very happy consumer!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2018
CommentsContent: I liked the versatility - you can open it up and use it as a griddle, or use it as a panini press. However, the top half of it never cooked as well as the bottom when you opened it up as a griddle, and today it just died completely right in the middle of a batch of pancakes (you can picture the angry hoards of children swarming, as I threw out the rest of the batch that didn't cook). So I can't recommend buying this - definitely not what I expect from Cuisinart

CommentsTitle: Great for a family of four or less.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Took longer than expected to grill chicken, but works great for paninis and hamburgers.  Evenly heats and easy to clean up.  Great value and does not take up a ton of space.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2018
CommentsContent: Works great. Tried making Quinoa waffles, hash browns, pancakes, turkey bacon, dosa, reheat spring rolls. Everything comes out perfect. Very easy to clean with no/minimum oil usage. Wish they had a closed-sandwich maker accessory - would buy it right away.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this for my dad and he can't say enough good things about it. He does a lot of cooking and he really likes it.

CommentsTitle: Still great after a year of use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: We use this almost daily as a toaster and press (It's great for making quesadillas!).  We've had it for well over a year, and it still works great.  The plates are very easy to remove and wash.  I'm purchasing another as a housewarming gift.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this and use it several times a week. No fuss no muss grilling.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2014
CommentsContent: I really like this grill and the only complaint I have is that cleanup is a little tricky.  I like to remove the grates while the thing is still hot so that it's easier to spray off all the grease, however it's very difficult to remove the grates using oven mitts.  The grates are not angled so that the grease slides into the grease cup underneath, so after I'm done cooking I have to push the grease to the back of the grates into the grease collector.Other than those minor issues, this is a great grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Very Handy, cooks awesomeThank you for such a good product and excellent price.I loved it

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2019
CommentsContent: Love this grill. It’s become my go-to for dinner. I just throw a Stark’s or chicken etc on the grill. Close it and come back to perfectly cooked meat, not all dried out or over cooked. Clean up is a breeze. I’ve used this for multiple dinners now and each time it’s taken me just minutes to clean it and put it away.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Living in an apartment this was the best alternative to a grill and it's perfect! I was nervous it woulf produce alot of smoke but it doesn't at all. It's also relatively easy to clean.  Definitely would recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Not Perfect Product..

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this so I could downsize appliances in my kitchen which is small. It is a griddle, panini press and I purchased the waffle plate, so it's 3 appliances in 1. Very happy with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Works great made 2 sandwiches at one time. We are going to enjoy this griddle for a long time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Given as gift and was told the griddle works very well and uses it often.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2012
CommentsContent: Had this griddle for a couple of weeks and and I love it.  Heats up quickly, cooks as expected and easy to clean up.I've cooked the following:burgers - turned out great, not greasy and remained moist!hot dogs - as good as outside without the hassle!boneless chicken breasts - need to put the breast between plastic wrap and flatten first (cooks quicker and has a better taste) - turned out GREAT!waffles (got the waffle plates) - great waffles BUT used the simple waffle recipe in the booklet --- use another recipe or a waffle mixsandwiches - panini grill was awesome, my husband didn't know he would like the toasted sandwich so muchLooking forward to trying it on Brats and more interesting things like steaks.I read many reviews and found them to be very helpful in selecting THIS particular griddle.I would highly recommend this unit.8/8/2013 - I used this product for several months now and still really like it for grilling........ BUT....... DO NOT TRY TO SCRAMBLE 3+ EGGS on this unit.  I had eggs going all over the place the day I tried to scramble 6 eggs...LOL... it was a mess.  The little edges on the flat griddle were not high enough for all those eggs!!!  So, unless you want to be cleaning eggs up, think twice (like I should have!!!) before using it for scrambling large amounts of eggs!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2019
CommentsContent: We had the previous model of the Cuisnart griddler which we loved.  We replaced it this year because the teflon was wearing out.  This model the GR-4N does not heat evenly.  We primarily use this griddle for making pancakes.  The bottom or front griddle always cooks the pancakes faster and more evenly than the top or back griddle.  It takes significantly longer to cook a batch a pancakes with this griddle because half the heating surfaces don't work properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019
CommentsContent: It is a good one. Works well. Stays up firmly when u lift the top half , which was a problem in different grills. Plates are dish washer safe, which is way cool. But has two extra knobs- one for griddle and another for grill. And one more for heat.All of this can just be one knob, reducing parts.

CommentsTitle: holds up fairly well over time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2013
CommentsContent: We've had this Griddler for nearly four years now, and it still works.  The plates are removable, which is great for cleaning - we throw ours in the dishwasher.  The top of the grill sometimes makes me nervous - it swings fairly freely, and I wish it were more stable like a George Foreman.  This is also a larger grill, so you need to have space to store it AND the accessories.  I believe this came with a plastic scraper and a fat catcher, but those have long since been discarded in favor of the dishwasher and a simple bowl.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2015
CommentsContent: I've only used this item a few times, as we also have a larger griddle that is more suited to the needs of our large family, but I haven't been disappointed yet. I've used it primarily for when I'm making a big breakfast with hashbrowns. I like that I can put them in and close the lid to cook both the top and underside at the same time. I also purchased the waffle plates separately for this appliance and have used them a few times to make pretty good waffles. We don't use it everyday, so I'm sure it'll hold up for many years.

CommentsTitle: So many uses it is great.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2014
CommentsContent: we use this all the time! Hamburgers, panini, pancakes, quesadillas, roasting asparagus. So many uses it is great.Update:we bought the waffle plates and the thing is even better than before! We use this to make so many things. It's nice we don't have to store an extra waffle maker now we just have extra plates to store which take up practically no extra space.This thing cooks everything great! We have it out and use it almost every night we cook

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019
CommentsContent: This makes some good paninis, and they taste great. It's pretty easy to use and clean - no complaints.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2017
CommentsContent: Bought this for a family gathering. Works great for sliders, cooking evenly. Shrimp was hit. The pieces wash up perfect in dishwasher. Hope to order the waffle section for Christmas.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: It is just so Handy if I want to cook a hamburger or steak.  It saves me from going out to my barbecue grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The top heating element doesn’t get as hot as the bottom. Other than that it’s perfect for what I need it for

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2015
CommentsContent: This griddler does what I expected it to do and that is make my grilled sandwiches. I always seem to overload my sandwich and this griddler saves me from flipping said sandwich. I tried meats on the griddler an incline to the drain is a must. I recommend not using the top of the griddler in a closed fashion. When doing meats leave the griddler totally open, where the grease goes when opening the griddler might not make it into the drain. If you do wish to grill meats with the griddler top down I recommend paper towels under the back or middle of the griddler.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2017
CommentsContent: I read all of the reviews on this product prior to purchasing it, and to took the risk. I've had mine for quite awhile now, and love it. The clips must have been improved because mine are made of sturdy metal, and work just fine. I cook with it every Sunday and Wednesday, when making chicken for our weekly meal plans.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2015
CommentsContent: I cannot get over how much I love this product. I have cooked eggs, chicken, fish and pork all perfectly well on this little griller. All the grease falls to the containment at the bottom and the plates come right off and can be washed in the dishwasher. I can have dinner made in 8 minutes flat. For someone who hates to cook, this is a lifesaver!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought used had to return broken part other than that it's a nice product grills well

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2014
CommentsContent: I use it almost daily every since I got it for Christmas!!! It's so easy to clean and convenient to cook on. Since I live in an apartment, we are not allowed to have grills. This way we are able to have the grilled foods we love without getting in trouble for grilling! You do have to turn the heat up to high, especially for meat but it still gets done just the way we like it. No complaints here. I even bought one as a gift for the parents. They love theirs as well. Would buy again if it ever quits working.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Liked mine so much, bought three more for gifts n they loved them. Easy to  use, program and clean.We all cook meat, veggies and all kinds of potatoes on them. Maybe not able to cook  a whole meal for a large family, but perfect for us older singles or a couple. Sea food is perfectly cooked also

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this every day.Get the waffle set.So useful,easy to clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2013
CommentsContent: I ordered this on Friday and it arrived on Weds and I was thrilled!  Grilled salmon and zucchiniand it worked great.  Thought I would need to use by my range in order to use the fan, but itwasn't necessary.  I love that I can use one side for grill and one side for griddle if I want to.I love grilled veggies, so will be using this a lot.  It folds up so compactly and doesn't take upa lot of space like the ones that do not.  Easy cleanup.  I am extremely happy with my purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2018
CommentsContent: Good materials, easy to clean and very practical. I usually make panini in the morning and grill chicken or beef at night.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Use for 85% of all meals.  DEFINITELY worth the money and timel.

CommentsTitle: I love the removable heating plates!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2014
CommentsContent: We have used a Foreman grill for years, and I always hated cleaning it because the model we had did not have removable plates. I read the reviews that the Foreman grill with removable plates did not get very hot. I picked this one because it had the controllable temp and the reviews seems to indicate it would get hotter than the Foreman. It does frozen boneless, chicken just fine and without completely drying out the meat. My 14 year old uses it a lot, both me and I will use the Griddler more than we did the Foreman simply because it is so easy to clean. The drip catcher works really well. I haven't used it as flat griddle, so I can't comment on that. I felt like I was getting a great deal because I had a gift card. I would definitely have paid full price now that I have used the Griddler. If you are looking for easy clean up, a dependable high temp, and a step up, I doubt this model can be beat.

CommentsTitle: Fatal no me han entregado el producto a la fecha
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2019
CommentsContent: Fataaaallll no me ha llegado desde hace casi un mes no me saben dar respuesta hasta los momentos

CommentsTitle: This little griddle is awesome! I purchased it for my husband for Christmas
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2015
CommentsContent: This little griddle is awesome!  I purchased it for my husband for Christmas.  He has used it at least three times a week since he's gotten it!  He does pancakes, sausage, eggs and bacon for breakfast on the weekends, ribs, hot dogs, burgers, chicken breasts, pork chops, grilled cheese, even veggies for dinner.  This griddle does it all!  Clean up is so easy too.  This is by far the best small appliance I have ever purchased!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2017
CommentsContent: Wish I would have read some of the negative reviews before purchasing this. I expected a better product from Cuisinart. Like other reviews have said the top part does not cook nearly as hot as the bottom. Took me forever to cook a pound of bacon. The grease doesn’t run off very well. The knobs are so flimsy they feel like they are going to come right off. Very disappointed in this grill. Glad I didn’t pay full price is all I can say.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2020
CommentsContent: They seemed to really like it but i know they will grow to really appreciate it as i have one and been using it for 7 years and it still works great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2013
CommentsContent: I love making Panini sandwiches and had an older model with non-removable grills - I wasn't happy as it was very hard to clean.  This new Griddler by Cuisinart is just the thing.  It can make perfect Panini sandwiches in no time and the clean up is a breeze.  Not only does it have non-stick finish, you can remove them and put them in the dishwasher!  What a deal!!Further,  the griddler can be used on the smooth side for pancakes, etc.  Highly recommend - you will love it, too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2011
CommentsContent: I purchased the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler over a year ago and I have to say I was totally satisfied! In fact I was so satified, I purchased one for my daughter a few months ago as well.  This is an excellent product!  It cooks steaks, salmon, veggies, whatever quickly and the meat always turns out juicy and delicious.  I love the fact that I can use it in the closed or open position to cook and the results are the same - awesome!  I was skeptical at first because I thought the cooking surface would not be big enough, I was surprised to find that I can actually cook four nice size burgers at the same time or I can cook two T-bone steaks with ease. Clean up is a breeze too since the plates pop right out and the drip pan slides out for cleaning as well.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: We bought this to replace an old Foreman grill and its been great. Very easy to use and small enough to store without trouble.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought as a gift for my daughter’s boyfriend and he loves it. Works great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2019
CommentsContent: The Griddle is a great grill. I have cooked steak , hamburgers and bacon. I love the way it cooks both sides at the same time. NO popping grease all over. Very easy to clean just pop out the plates and wash them.If you have any grease it goes into the grease catcher which slides in and out very easy. I really haven't found anything that I dislike. I highly recommend  the griller.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020
CommentsContent: This product grills thick cut steaks great and also makes a great grilled cheese.

CommentsTitle: I love it and used it all the time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2017
CommentsContent: I got this as a gift 7 years ago for my birthday.  I love it and used it all the time.  It is great to use for 1-2 people.  It is easy to clean.  But the handle in the back that holds it both sides broke and it was useable but just frustrating.  I decided to get a new one and threw out the old one.  I love it.

CommentsTitle: With the inter-changeable grates that are easy to clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2018
CommentsContent: For a single person on the go or a busy mom with a family, this counter top grill is the answer! With the inter-changeable grates that are easy to clean, I can do pancakes to hamburgers to salmon and steaks.Love it!!I bought one for my girlfriend. She is hooked on it.

CommentsContent: This is a great kitchen addition. Both griddles pop out at the touch of a button and there is a dripping tray to catch grease. I am so glad I purchased this!!

CommentsTitle: Although it still doesn't taste like hamburgers on an outdoor grill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2014
CommentsContent: I bought this griddler so we could grill hamburgers  and other things in the Winter. Although it still doesn't taste like hamburgers on an outdoor grill, it will still work out great. I did make some breakfast sausage and eggs and they turned out to be very good. I haven't had a chance to use it for many things, but I'm sure I will be making many things this winter. Nice looking appliance all stainless

CommentsTitle: Two down, none to go.  BUYER BEWARE!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2012
CommentsContent: I bought my first Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler on August 5, 2011.  It work perfect for a month.  At that time one of the clips that holds the griddle plate in place broke off.  I contacted Amazon.com and they allowed me to exchange the griddle for another one exactly like the first one on September 3, 2011.  I used the griddler tonight, January 3, 2011.  When I went to lay the top half flat so I could remove the griddle plate, the lever that lowers the top broke off in my hand.  I cannot set the griddle flat.  I cannot remove the top plate.  According to Amazon.com's return policy, I can no longer return or exchange this item.  I have had two of the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddlers break in 5 months time.  The cheap plastic parts they use break easily.At the price of $88.98 for the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler, it just cost me $17.79 per month to use this product.  I will not spend any more money on poorly constructed Cuisinart products. I have contacted Cuisinart directly.  Hopefully they will honor the 3 year warranty and replace this item for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2013
CommentsContent: We got this to replace another countertop grill that was just too big.  This is a nice size for a family of 4.  We've used it for burgers, pork chops, and grilled sandwiches.  I think my son used it for pancakes once.  The adjustable heat is nice, and i love being able to put the plates in the dishwasher.  I'm not too fond of how the juices and grease run off it while it's in use - the opening seems kind of small.  I would still recommend this for someone that wants a very versitile grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2015
CommentsContent: So far so good with this griddler.  Works as advertised, truly make fantastic hamburgers in 5 minutes (both sides cooked at the same time, and burger keeps it's shape, etc.).  I haven't had any issue with cleaning it...griddles pop off for easy cleaning.  I will say that it works best for things like hamburgers and cuban sandwiches than as a flat griddle, but overall an excellent product at a good price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Easy to clean and makes nice sandwiches. Both plates pop off for cleaning. Lightweight.

CommentsTitle: Fast, tasty and easy to clean!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I am not a cook...but the pandemic has changed our lifestyle and we eat at home now. This is such a easy  and quick way to whip up a great tasting hamburger.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020

CommentsTitle: A MUST have for EVERY kitchen!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Absolutely LOVE it! Heats up quickly, cooks evenly, easy to use & clean. Large drip tray. Bought this to replace my George Forman grill (original) & there is definitely no comparison between the new. Best decision I've ever made!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2009
CommentsContent: These customer reviews are a very important benefit and so it was that before purchasing the GR-4 Griddler, I noted how many reviews gave it a 5-star rating while a large number also rated it much lower - mainly because of a reported problem with the coating of the grill plates. But "throwing caution to the wind," I went ahead and bought the GR-4 with the following experience. Thus far I have used my Griddler three (3) times using only the "griddle" plates and to my surprise, there on the surface of the bottom griddle plate have appeared several visible "cracks" which weren't there before!... I have been very gentle in cleaning after each use by soaking the plates in soapy water and using a sponge to whisk away any burnt-on remnants and so I was startled when these cracks appeared. As far as cooking goes I am pleased with the results that the Griddler turned out but because of the coating problem I am only able to rate it at 3-stars, and I would advise any potential buyer to pay attention to the comments of those who rated it at only 1 or 2-stars!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Works well good for grilling heats up quickly and clean up is a breeze

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2020
CommentsContent: This is great as a griddle, panini maker, and grill. Heats up quickly, I like that you can set the temperature, and the clean-up couldn’t be easier!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2010
CommentsContent: This is my first counter top grilling appliance, and I could not be more pleased.  After hearing friends, and family telling us how easy it was to prepare quick and tasty food on them we decided to get one.  After reading all the reviews I could find, we opted for the Quisinart Griddler GR-4N.  The best money I have ever spent.  If you are looking for this type item, go for it.  If you decide on the Griddler make sure you get the GR-4N, not the older GR-4, some of them are still out there.  The GR-4N has taken the minor complaints and changed for the better.  No more cups to catch grease, it's built in now, and the plate system has been made better.  The unit looks great, but it is also small enough to store when not in use.  I have become a huge fan of Amazon.  When I ordered this unit, it was scheduled for a Thurday delivery.  My wife and I had decided to make Panini when it came. Not to be, it came in damaged.  I put in a return good request, and checked damaged.  One hour later I had a return label, and a new one was on the way for next day delivery, which was Saturday!  Great customer service!  I hope this review helps in your decision to get a Griddler.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2015
CommentsContent: We use this a lot!  It has finally found its place out in the open on the counter.  I wish it had waffle plates included but they are available separately.  It toasts evenly and effectively.  And we LOVE being able to put the plates in the dishwasher.  Can't beat it for perfectly grilled burgers indoors or the perfect lunchtime panini.  It does not dry out your food like a Foreman does but it does have a grease catcher for excess drippings not critical for good taste...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2014
CommentsContent: It doesn't get as hot as a normal cheap-o griddle.  It cooked slower, and I suggested that maybe it cooks more evenly than a normal griddle that just gets super hot... My husband always cooks on the griddle --it did seem to be slower and not a sizzly-hot as our old griddle.  I will have to update my review after we've used it a few more times.Also - the plates were already peeling their non-stick and had to have it replaced upon first receiving.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my mom. She really likes it. And believe me it's hard to please that woman.  She likes that she can turn it off without unplugging it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2019
CommentsContent: it makes the best steaks, panini's , and anything you can think of to put on a grill!  AND YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO OUTSIDE AND PLAY WITH A GRILL!!!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2012
CommentsContent: My original review is below.  I have changed the rating from 5 stars to 1 because I experienced the problem other reviewers reported. During normal use the clips that hold the grills to the unit broke.  These clips are plastic and flimsy.  This one feature turns an outstanding product into one that is unacceptable.==================================================================================================================================================I just ordered my second Griddler.  I have used one for about 4 years and the element just doesn't heat up like it did when it was new. So it is time to retire it. (I can relate.) I live on the 8th floor of a condo building.  Charcoal grilling is not practical.  The Griddler is a pretty good substitute. Addendum: I just received the Griddler and it has a couple of significant improvements. I have edited my review to reflect the new featuresFeatures you will like:(1) It cooks top-botton (illustrated) and it lays out flat.  So it makes grilled sandwiches, pancakes, burgers and steaks.(2) It has griddle settings (by temperature) for pancakes and sandwiches and grill settings (low, med, high, sear) for meats.(3) It had two reversible plates with two surfaces.  One is flat, for a griddle.  The other has grill ridges.  The plates snap in and out easily.  Unlike previous versions of the Griddler, each plate fits both the upper and lower unit.(4) Clean up is as easy as it can be.  The cooking plates snap out for cleaning.  They are coated with a non-stick surface, which greatly eases the cleanup job.  But some stuff still cooks on.  A hard plastic tool is provided that makes it easy to scrap off anything that sticks withoug damaging the surface.  Just keep after it and the plates will last a long time.(5) Grilling and griddling drips oil.  There is a built-in drip cup to catch it. Easy to remove and clean.(6) The sufaces are rectangular, not round of oval.  I find this shape very practical.(7) Waffle plates are available separately.I think you will like the Griddler better than other electric grills.  The new design has all the good features of the model I have used for 4 years plus some very useful improvements.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2017
CommentsContent: We really compared griddles before this purchase. This was the only one that met all our specifications.  Follow the directions for use and you will enjoy good food quickly prepared.

CommentsTitle: In love with the Griddler...  So easy to clean, easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2011
CommentsContent: I was skeptical at first about ordering the Griddler - after all, I first saw it on TV, so who knows about as seen on TV items!  That being said, this thing is GREAT.  I live in a state that gets really cold in the winter and hot in the summer, and I don't want to always have to grill outdoors- but George Foreman grills with their tough to clean surfaces are for the BIRDS.  I also wanted a griddle before purchasing this, and that's what tipped me towards buying it (since it's two in one).  I cannot tell you guys how wonderful this is.  It makes eggs & pancakes like a champ with the griddle side of the plates, and it grills chicken to perfection with the grill side.  I LOVE that you can easily open up the grill or griddle all the way and use the plates flat.  It doubles your cooking surface area!  I do this to make grilled cheese (which, by the way, turn out perfect every time).  And unlike most indoor grills, you can control the temperature with the Griddler.  That's awesome because you won't wind up with anything charred.I haven't had any problems so far with it working; it works great, heats up fast and everything.  It is SO EASY TO CLEAN, which is one of my favorite features.  You literally just press a button and pop the plates out, wash them, and pop them right back in.  It takes me 3 minutes, tops.  What can be better than that?In short, the Griddler is highly recommended!  It may seem expensive, but to me it is WELL worth it!  I plan to buy one for the next set of newlyweds I encounter!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2015
CommentsContent: We previously bought a different cheaper griddle maker.  After we realized how much we used it, when the other one wore out (quicker than it should have), we shelled out the extra cash for this and have not been disappointed.  It heats more easily and the surfaces are interchangeable.  No more confusion on which is the top one and which one is the bottom one.  We love it and use it frequently.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2021
CommentsContent: This is the best griddler I've bought. I love this thing!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Does not heat. At highest temp grilled zucchini slices took 15 minutes to get light grill mark's, but were mush by then.  Hamburgers just steamed, no sizzle. And took 15 minutes to cook.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2013
CommentsContent: I bought this because I had have a good experience with Cuisinart products but this Griddler is terrible, the grease stays ON the plates and does not drain into the tray like it's supposed to probably because there is no angle the plates are so flat also the clips holding the plates are PLASTIC which is crazy this whole thing feels cheaply made. I am very disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2015
CommentsContent: This Griddler is wonderful. It heats up quickly and cooks food evenly. I've mainly used it for pancakes, and they cook up beautifully. I love being able to take the plates out to wash them. I had been on the search for a good electric griddle for awhile, and was a bit leery of getting this because it was more than I wanted to pay. But it is completely worth it. It seems very well made and like it will last for a long time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2010
CommentsContent: This was a gift for my son and we used it, fresh out of the box, for breakfast Christmas morning.  What a great machine! It handled bacon, sausage, eggs and pancakes like a breeze. But, after this, he can see the possibilities...mainly for the panini feature, "Hey, I can do fat sandwiches without causing them to slide apart because the lid "floats" and presses down evenly!"  Now, I'm giving serious thought to getting one of these little beauties for myself, even though I have both a panini press and a griddle! It was a big hit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2012
CommentsContent: Bought this for my boyfriend's birthday about 2 weeks ago. Since then we've made some paninis that turned out well, but we mostly love this griddler for cooking dinner. You can easily grill up chopped veggies in a few minutes using the contact grill. I just grilled asparagus, eggplant and onion slices for lunch in five minutes as a healthy side dish. We plan to try it on fish, chicken and burgers in the future. Our first morning we used it as a full griddle for pancakes and sausages. Again, cooked great and a big time saver.- Heats up fast- Reversible grills are great for different meals (contact grill = great timesaver for veggies)- Great design, easy to clean- A little heavy but not awful.I'm extremely satisfied with this purchase and it has been worth every dollar.

CommentsTitle: Fortunately, I had already seen this one on Amazon

CommentsContent: We make a lot of paninis, so when our last panini grill started breaking down, it was a family tragedy. Fortunately, I had already seen this one on Amazon. It works very well, even after months of almost daily use. We also got the waffle plates, and they work really well too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought for a gift, so I returned it. They already got one.No hassle return.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2014
CommentsContent: Grilled sandwiches can make a mess with cheese and toppings melting on the grill, this unit has dishwasher safe removable plates, so clean up is easy.  Heats well, and you can finish a sandwich in 4 minutes on high.  Great value, replaced my $179 unit that does not have removable grills.Now, if this self correcting software would let me type "panning", but it won't. Oh well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2008
CommentsContent: PIECE OF JUNK.  I can't believe anyone gave this thing a good a review.  First of all, the coating on the plates is very inadequate.  Scratches very very easily.  The ridge on the edge of the plate is not high enough to prevent spills.  These spills seep under the plates and stain the unit where the coils are.  FURTHER, AFTER ONLY A COUPLE OF WEEKS THE COILS NO LONGER HEAT TO THE APPROPRIATE TEMPERATURE.  I purchased this after being lured by the infomercial.  I thought the quality looked good.  It's not.  It;s worth about $50-60 max.

CommentsTitle: Makes oil free cooking so much easier
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2019

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2012
CommentsContent: I love this griddler! I live in an apartment, so having an outdoor grill is a no-no. I use this griddler almost every night to cook, and I love it. I love the fact that I can adjust the temperature, the handle is heat resistant (so I can touch it without fear of being burned!), and that clean up is a snap. I don't have a dishwasher, so hand washing is my only option. Food comes off the grill plates very easily with hot water, a sponge, and some dish soap. Nothing fancy or labor intensive about it. Although it may be a little small for a family, for a couple or a single person, it's perfect. Love it!

CommentsTitle: After all these years, still a hit!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2015
CommentsContent: This appliance was a replacement for the same make/model which was going on 15 years.  The new one is even better.  Having the griddle on one side and the grill on the other means I don't have storage problems.  I ordered the waffle iron addition and I love it.  Makes wonderful pumpkin waffles and Belgian waffles.  This is the kind of appliance I love.  It provides multiple uses and doesn't sit on the shelf waiting for the once-in-a-while kind of use most appliances offer.  I am really thrilled with the appliance.  And, by the way, it makes GREAT grilled cheese sandwiches, too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: So I love this thing very easy to disassemble, easy to clean. The grill itself is nonstick. I think the only downside is that it doesn’t cook evenly so you do need to flip it if you want both sides seared the same way.Nonetheless I do not regret buying it, I love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2007
CommentsContent: Having done my research on grills/griddles before purchasing this item, I really thought that this was the clear winner.  It arrived in no time and I was ready to grill, it heats up quickly, and I highly recommend following the cooking recommendations since it is very easy to overcook your food with this unit.  I have a few complaints, first off the lip on the surface is not very high and fat and grease, or moisture of any sort bubble and splash all over the counter from all sides of the unit, secondly the unit is not on a slant so the fat just sits around your food and kind of marinates the now lean meat in fat.  To try and solve this problem, I rest the back feet on a cutting board, but the liquid seems to just spill over the front of the unit rather than into the receptacle off to one side.  After a few uses I have gotten the settings down apt and food cooks evenly and quickly, clean up is a breeze with the removable plates, if the lips was just a bit larger and if the unit was angled for proper fat run-off you'd have a real winner.  I am pretty neutral on the item, it works but makes a mess and is a little inconvenient.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: does what i wanted and is easy to clean.

CommentsTitle: I'm very disappointed in this product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2014
CommentsContent: I'm very disappointed in this product.  I tried it on both the griddle and the grill and neither cooked properly.  I set the temperature for the griddle at 375° per the recipe directions.  After a couple of minutes the green light came on so I thought it was ready to cook.  I spooned on some batter and it just sat there - no sizzle.  No bubbles forming in the batter after 5 minutes and the bottom was barely starting to color.  I upped the temp to the maximum of 425°.  At that temperature, it took 10 minutes for the pancakes to cook through, but still just a light yellowish color.  The next day I decided to try the grill.  I had some marinated boned chicken thighs as a test.  I set the temp to sear which is the maximum temp.  The green ready light came on after about 8 minutes.  I added the chicken and there was a bit of sizzle.  The chicken did cook in about 5 minutes, but it was more a steam cook even though I had thoroughly drained and toweled off the marinade.  There were some grill marks, but not as much as I would have expected or liked.  In addition, even though there was very little fat on the chicken, a small amount of the fat escaped into the bottom of the unit instead of the fat tray.  I'm sure that cooking a steak would not have been successful either in cooking or collecting the fat.  I bought the Griddler as an upgrade from my old George Foreman grill and the Griddler doesn't come close to cooking as hot or as well.  I am returning the product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Used for first time today and it worked great with even heat distribution and easy to clean

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2021
CommentsContent: Heats up evenly. Cleans up easily. So far performed well in cooking steaks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2018
CommentsContent: We bought this to replace an older Hamilton Beach product.  Was impressed with how solid this was made, cooked, and cleaned.  Not a negative thing to say.  Well worth the buy and recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2013
CommentsContent: I've used this several times per week for the last 6 months. I cook primarily fish and chicken on it, though occasionally some veggies. The nonstick coating on one plate is now bubbling and coming off, despite being very careful with my cleaning, with using nonstick spray, and with trying to maintain the unit.I've also had problems since day one with the grease drainage. The grill plates don't have an angle to them, so grease can just sit until it accumulates enough to dribble off the back where the notch is. It's not really a good design, and it results in a fair amount of grease and spray on the unit and counter, rather than in the tray that's made for it. I've never had a contact grill with this much grease ending up outside the tray no matter what I do.My unit is easily within warranty, but return shipping or just buying new plates doesn't make sense to me, especially with the grease issue. I'm now just going to go buy a better grill from someone else. I used to use a Hamilton Beach grill with removable plates which was great and lasted for years, but unfortunately the cover cracked and the model is discontinued. We'll see what I can find... hopefully something that also has a timer while I'm at it.Anyway, I bought this for mid double-digits, and 1/2 what Amazon is selling it for as I write this. And I look back and just say I should have bought something else. The high reviews and ranking aren't justified. This might be okay for someone just occasionally grilling vegetables or panini, but it really doesn't seem well-suited for regular use, and especially not for things like meats that actually put out fat/grease.This product is reviewed way too highly. And unless you're ready to cough up return shipping when the plates fail... don't hold your breath on the warranty being worth anything, practically speaking. I can't recommend this for regular use.

Well, getting the waffle plates for this product is nearly impossible.  Currently they're back ordered from Cuisinart until May, or you can buy them from Amazon at a HUGE markup.  So that's where the -1 star comes from, the lack of add on parts.  Also, models in the store have a different plate design, so I'd wonder about this becoming discontinued.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2013
